u

u 1

letter. (gram) letter u; 5th letter of the alphabet; labial vowel ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter u; 5th letter of the alphabet; labial vowel
Sanskrit u

a kavagga hā kaṇṭhajā, i cavagga yā tālujā, u pavaggā oṭṭhajā, ṭavagga ra ḷā muddhajā, tavagga la sā dantajā, e kaṇṭhatālujo, o kaṇṭh'oṭṭhajo, vo dant'oṭṭhajo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
u 2

prefix. up; upwards ✓

Grammar prefix
Meaning up; upwards
Notes classical grammatical form of ud
Sanskrit ud

pa, parā, ni, nī, u, du, saṃ, vi, ava, anu, pari, adhi, abhi, pati, su, ā, ati, api, apa, upa, pahāro, parābhavo, nihāro, nīhāro, uhāro, duhāro, saṃhāro, vihāro, avahāro, anuhāro, parihāro, adhihāro, abhihāro, patihāro, suhāro, āhāro, atihāro, apihāro, apahāro, upahāro, evaṃ vīsati upasaggehi ca.

kaccāyana nāmakappa 221
ukka 1

masc. re-opening (of a (legal) question already settled) ✗
ukka 2

masc. house ✗
ukkacelasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.14 (SN47.14) ✗
ukkacelā

fem. name of a Vajjian town [ukkā + celā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a Vajjian town
Construction ukkā + celā
Commentary (MNa) tattha ukkacelāyan'ti evaṃnāmake nagare. tasmiṃ kira māpiyamāne rattiṃ gaṅgāsotato maccho thalaṃ patto. manussā celāni telapātiyaṃ temetvā ukkā katvā macchaṃ gaṇhiṃsu. nagare niṭṭhite tassa nāmaṃ karonte amhehi nagaraṭṭhānassa gahitadivase celukkāhi maccho gahito'ti ukkacelā-tv'ev'assa nāmaṃ akaṃsu.

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vajjīsu viharati ukkacelāyaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aciraparinibbutesu sāriputtamoggallānesu.

SN 47.14 ukkacelasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vajjīsu viharati ukkacelāyaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā tīre. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

MN 34 cūḷagopālakasuttaṃ
ukkaṭṭha 1

adj. (+loc) prominent (in); elevated (in); in a high position (in); lit. dragged up [ud + √kas + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, pp of ukkaṃsati (+loc)
Meaning prominent (in); elevated (in); in a high position (in); lit. dragged up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

y'āhu raṭṭhe samukkaṭṭho,
rañño aṅgassa paddhagū,
sv'ājja dhammesu ukkaṭṭho,
soṇo dukkhassa pāragū.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā
ukkaṭṭha 2

adj. large-sized; lit. dragged up [ud + √kas + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, pp of ukkaṃsati
Meaning large-sized; lit. dragged up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Antonym omaka
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

tayo pattassa vaṇṇā ukkaṭṭho patto majjhimo patto omako patto.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ

daṇḍo nāma majjhimassa purisassa catuhattho daṇḍo. tato ukkaṭṭho adaṇḍo, omako adaṇḍo.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo
ukkaṭṭha 3

adj. high-class; rich; lit. dragged up [ud + √kas + ta] ~

Grammar adj, pp of ukkaṃsati
Meaning high-class; rich; lit. dragged up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ukkaṭṭha 4

adj. excellent, specialised [ud + √kas] ✗
ukkaṭṭha 5

pp. pulled up; hitched up; lit. dragged up [ud + √kas + ta] ~

Grammar pp of ukkaṃsati
Meaning pulled up; hitched up; lit. dragged up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Antonym okkaṭṭha
Commentary (MNa) accukkaṭṭhan'ti yo hi yāva hanukaṭṭhito ukkhipitvā pārupati, tassa accukkaṭṭhaṃ nāma hoti ... yo'pi ubhato ukkhipitvā udaraṃ vivaritvā yāti, tassa'pi accukkaṭṭhaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ukkaṭṭhā

fem. name of town; lit. elevated [ud + √kas + ta + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from ukkaṭṭha
Meaning name of town; lit. elevated
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ud + √kas + ta + ā
ukkaṭṭha + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Phonetic Change d > k
st > ṭṭh
Commentary (MNa) ukkaṭṭhāyaṃ viharatī'ti ettha ukkāti dīpikā, tañ'ca nagaraṃ, maṅgaladivaso sukhaṇo sunakkhattaṃ mā atikkamī'ti rattim'pi ukkāsu ṭhitāsu māpitattā ukkaṭṭhā'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit utkṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

ekam'id'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, samayaṃ ukkaṭṭhāyaṃ viharāmi subhagavane sālarājamūle.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
ukkaṭṭhita

pp. boiled up, seething [ud + √kaṭh] ✗
ukkaḍḍhiyyati

pr. is postponed; is put off; is delayed; lit. is dragged up [ud + √kaḍḍh + īya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of ukkaḍḍhati, intrans
Meaning is postponed; is put off; is delayed; lit. is dragged up
Root Family ud √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 īya (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + īya > kaḍḍhīya > kaḍḍhiyya (pass, irreg)
Construction ud + kaḍḍhiyya + ti
Phonetic Change īy > iyy
Sanskrit utkṛṣyate
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ukkaṇṭhati

pr. (+instr) sick (of); is fed up (with); is dissatisfied (with); is annoyed (with); up to the neck (with) [ud + √kaṭh + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+instr)
Meaning sick (of); is fed up (with); is dissatisfied (with); is annoyed (with); up to the neck (with)
Root Family ud √kaṭh
Root √kaṭh･2 ṃa (live in distress)
Base √kaṭh + ṃa > kaṇṭha
Construction ud + kaṇṭha + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkaṇṭhati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √kaṭh 1 (live in distress)

ukkaṇṭhāmi sarīrena,
bhaven'amhi anatthiko,
so'yaṃ bhijjissati kāyo,
añño ca na bhavissati.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
ukkaṇṭhanā

fem. dissatisfaction, commotion [ud + √kaṭh] ✗
ukkaṇṭhita

pp. dissatisfied, fretting [ud + √kaṭh] ✗
ukkaṇḍaka

nt. mange; skin inflammation [ud + √kaṇḍ + aka] ✓

Grammar nt, from kaṇḍa
Meaning mange; skin inflammation
Root Family ud √kaṇḍ
Root √kaṇḍ･8 *e (break, pierce)
Construction ud + √kaṇḍ + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change d > k
Variant ukkaṇṭaka
Commentary (SNa) ukkaṇṭakena nāmā'ti evaṃnāmakena rogena. so kira sītakāle uppajjati. tasmiṃ uppanne sakalasarīrato lomāni patanti, sakalasarīraṃ nillomaṃ hutvā, samantato phuṭati, vātabbhāhatā vaṇā rujjanti. yathā ummattakasunakhena daṭṭho puriso anavaṭṭhitova bhamati, evaṃ tasmiṃ uppanne bhamitabbo hoti, asukaṭṭhāne sotthi bhavissatī'ti na paññāyati.
Sanskrit utkhaṇḍita (broken)
Sanskrit Root √kaḍ √kaṇḍ 10 (separate, destroy)

eso kho, bhikkhave, jarasiṅgālo ukkaṇḍakena nāma rogajātena phuṭṭho. so yena yena icchati tena tena gacchati. yattha yattha icchati tattha tattha tiṭṭhati.

SN 20.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ
ukkaṇṇaka

masc. disease (of animals) ✗
ukkantitvā

abs. having cut out; having cut off; having cut up; having butchered [ud + √kat] ✗
ukkapiṇḍaka

masc. ‘finding food in a house ‘, perhaps a house-lizard, or vermin generally ✗
ukkamma

ger. going out; going away (from) going over; omitting; neglecting [ud + √kam] ✗

adj. from Ukkala; living in Ukkala [ukkala + a] ~

Grammar adj, from ukkala
Meaning from Ukkala; living in Ukkala
Construction ukkala + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (SNa) ukkalā'ti ukkalajanapadavāsino.
Sanskrit utkala
ukkalā

masc. inhabitants of the country Ukkala (modern day Orissa) [ukkala] ✗
ukkaṃsati

pr. (+acc) exalts; praises [ud + √kas] ✗
ukkaṃsāvakaṃsa

nt. excellence or deficiency; increase or decrease; superiority or inferiority [ukkaṃsa + avakaṃsa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning excellence or deficiency; increase or decrease; superiority or inferiority
Construction ukkaṃsa + avakaṃsa
Compound dvanda (ukkaṃsa ca avakaṃsa ca)
Commentary (DNa) ukkaṃs'āvakaṃse'ti ukkaṃs'āvakaṃsā. hāyanavaḍḍhanānam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Notes see SCPN §3, 10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit utkarṣa + apakarṣa

doṇamite sukhadukkhe pariyantakate saṃsāre, n'atthi hāyanavaḍḍhane, n'atthi ukkaṃs'āvakaṃse.

DN 2.5 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
ukkaṃseti

pr. (+acc) exalts; praises; lit. causes to drag up [ud + √kas + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ukkaṃsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning exalts; praises; lit. causes to drag up
Root Family ud √kas
Root √kas･1 *e (drag, draw)
Base √kas + *e > kāse > kaṃse (caus, irreg)
Construction ud + kaṃse + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Variant ukkaṃsati
Sanskrit utkarṣayati
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

ahaṃ kho'mhi uccākulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na uccākulā pabbajitā'ti. so tāya uccākulīnatāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

n'ev'attān'ukkaṃsissāma na paraṃ vambhissāmā'ti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
ukkā 1

fem. torch; firebrand ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning torch; firebrand
Sanskrit ulkā

atha kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto pañcasu hatthinikāsatesu paccekā itthiyo āropetvā ārohaṇīyaṃ nāgaṃ abhiruhitvā ukkāsu dhāriyamānāsu rājagahamhā niyyāsi

DN 2.2 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

maṃsapes'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo. tiṇ'ukkā-upamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
ukkā 2

fem. crucible; melting pot ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning crucible; melting pot
Commentary (ANa) ukkaṃ bandheyyā'ti aṅgārakapallaṃ sajjeyya. (VISMa) ukkaṃ bandhatī'ti mūsaṃ sampādeti.
Sanskrit mūkā

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakār'antevāsī vā ukkaṃ bandheyya, ukkaṃ bandhitvā ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpeyya, ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpetvā saṇḍāsena jātarūpaṃ gahetvā ukkāmukhe pakkhipeyya

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ
ukkā 3

fem. meteor ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning meteor
Sanskrit ulkā

yathā vā pana, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamāṇavakānaṃ ... candaggāhaṃ sūriyaggāhaṃ sukkarāhucaritaṃ uḷuggahayuddhaṃ devadundubhissaraṃ okkanti ukkāpātaṃ ... sikkhā karaṇīyā

ukkāmukha 1

nt. furnace; forge; lit. fire mouth [ukkā + mukha] ✓

Sanskrit ulkā + mukha

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakār'antevāsī vā ukkaṃ bandheyya, ukkaṃ bandhitvā ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpeyya, ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpetvā saṇḍāsena jātarūpaṃ gahetvā ukkāmukhe pakkhipeyya

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vatthaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ malaggahitaṃ acchodakaṃ āgamma parisuddhaṃ hoti pariyodātaṃ, ukkāmukhaṃ vā pan'āgamma jātarūpaṃ parisuddhaṃ hoti pariyodātaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
ukkāmukha 2

masc. name of one of the sons of king Okkāka ✗
ukkāra

masc. dung, excrement [ud + √kar] ✗
ukkāsati

pr. coughs; clears one's throat; lit. coughs up [ud + √kās + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning coughs; clears one's throat; lit. coughs up
Root Family ud √kās
Root √kās･1 a (cough)
Base √kās + a > kāsa
Construction ud + kāsa + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkāsate
Sanskrit Root √kās 1 (cough)

bhikkhussa ṭhit'okāsaṃ vā nisinn'okāsaṃ vā nipann'okāsaṃ vā āgantvā mantentaṃ ukkāsitabbaṃ, vijānāpetabbaṃ, no ce ukkāseyya vā vijānāpeyya vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.8 upassutisikkhāpadaṃ
ukkāsi

aor. coughed, cleared one's throat [ud + √kās] ✗
ukkāsikā

fem. pad of cloth (for rubbing the body) ✗

ptp. should cough; should clear one's throat; lit. to be coughed up [ud + √kās + itabba] ✓

VIN 2.5.8.8 upassutisikkhāpadaṃ
ukkāsitasadda

masc. sound of coughing ✗
ukkāsitvā

abs. having coughed; having cleared one’s throat; lit. having coughed up [ud + √kās + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ukkāsati, intrans
Meaning having coughed; having cleared one’s throat; lit. having coughed up

Root √kās･1 a (cough)
Construction ud + √kās + itvā
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkās
Sanskrit Root √kās 1 (cough)

atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. vivari bhagavā dvāraṃ.

DN 3.3 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā kathāpariyosānaṃ viditvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
ukkāsetvā

abs. (+acc) having coughed; having cleared one’s throat; lit. having caused to cough up [ud + √kās + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ukkāseti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having coughed; having cleared one’s throat; lit. having caused to cough up
Root Family ud √kās
Root √kās･1 *e (cough)
Base √kās + e > kāse (caus)
Construction ud + kāse + tvā
Phonetic Change d > k
Synonym ukkāsitvā
Commentary (DNa) ukkāsitvā'ti ukkāsitasaddaṃ katvā.
Sanskrit utkāstvā
Sanskrit Root √kās 1 (cough)

atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yen'upaṭṭhānasālā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bahidvārakoṭṭhake aṭṭhāsi kathāpariyosānaṃ āgamayamāno. atha kho bhagavā kathāpariyosānaṃ viditvā ukkāsetvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. vivariṃsu kho te bhikkhū bhagavato dvāraṃ.

AN 9.4 nandakasuttaṃ
ukkiṇṇaparikha

adj. with a moat dug ✗
ukkujja

adj. turned right way up [ud + √kujj + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from ukkujjati
Meaning turned right way up
Root Family ud √kujj
Root √kujj･1 a (turn)
Construction ud + √kujj + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit udubja
Sanskrit Root √ubj 6 (force)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kumbho ukkujjo tatra udakaṃ āsittaṃ saṇṭhāti no vivaṭṭati

AN 3.30 avakujjasuttaṃ
ukkujjati

pr. holds or sets upright; holds or sets the right way up; especially turns (the bowl) the right way up (to accept food again from a layman whose alms had been refused) [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjana

nt. turning up [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjanā

fem. setting upright; turning the right way up [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjāvakujjaṃ

ind. up and down; this way and that; (comm) arising and passing; lit. turned up and turned down [ukkujja + avakujja + aṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning up and down; this way and that; (comm) arising and passing; lit. turned up and turned down
Construction ukkujja + avakujja + aṃ
ukkujjāvakujja + aṃ
Commentary (SNa) ukkujj'āvakujjan'ti ettha ukkujjaṃ vuccati udayo, avakujjaṃ vayo'ti udayabbayavasena parivattento sammasanto'ti dīpeti.
ukkujji

aor. (+acc) turned up, bent up [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjita

pp. turned up, bent up [ud + √kujj] ✗
ukkujjitvā

abs. (+acc) having turned upright [ud + √kujj + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ukkujjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having turned upright
Root Family ud √kujj
Root √kujj･1 a (turn)
Construction ud + √kujj + itvā
Phonetic Change d > k
Antonym nikkujjitvā
Sanskrit udubjya
Sanskrit Root √ubj 6 (force)

atha kho bhagavā taṃ udak'ādhānaṃ ukkujjitvā āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, passasi no tvaṃ, rāhula, imaṃ udak'ādhānaṃ rittaṃ tucchan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
ukkujjeti

pr. (+acc) turns the right way up [ud + √kujj + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ukkujjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning turns the right way up
Root Family ud √kujj
Root √kujj･1 *e (turn)
Base √kujj + e > kujje (caus)
Construction ud + kujje + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Antonym nikkujjeti
Commentary (SNa) ukkujjeyyā'ti uparimukhaṃ kareyya.
Sanskrit udubjati
Sanskrit Root √ubj 6 (force)

seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
ukkuṭika 1

adj. squatting; sitting on haunches; lit. bent up [ud + √kuṭ + a + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from ukkuṭa
Meaning squatting; sitting on haunches; lit. bent up
Root Family ud √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･1 a (be crooked, bent)
Construction ud + √kuṭ + a + ika
ukkuṭa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkuṭaka
Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā,
n'ānāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ,
sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

DHP 141 daṇḍavaggo

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
ukkuṭikappadhāna

nt. (ascetic practice of) holding the squatting posture; lit. squatting effort [ukkuṭika + padhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (ascetic practice of) holding the squatting posture; lit. squatting effort
Construction ukkuṭika + padhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (ukkuṭika + padhāna)
Commentary (MNa) ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto'ti ukkuṭikavīriyaṃ anuyutto, gacchanto'pi ukkuṭiko'va hutvā uppatitvā uppatitvā gacchati.
Sanskrit utkuṭaka + pradhāna

na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā,
n'ānāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ,
sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

DHP 141 daṇḍavaggo

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
ukkuṭikappadhānamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the ascetic practice of remaining in the squatting posture [ukkuṭika + padhāna + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the ascetic practice of remaining in the squatting posture
Construction ukkuṭika + padhāna + anuyutta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ukkuṭikapadhānaṃ + anuyutta)
Commentary (MNa) ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto'ti ukkuṭikavīriyaṃ anuyutto, gacchanto'pi ukkuṭiko'va hutvā uppatitvā uppatitvā gacchati.
Sanskrit utkuṭaka + pradhāna + anuyukta

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

Root Family ud √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･1 a (be crooked, bent)
Construction ud + √kuṭ + ika + aṃ
ukkuṭika + aṃ
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkuṭaka
Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

tena kuṭikārakena bhikkhunā kuṭivatthuṃ sodhetvā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evam'assa vacanīyo

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

navakena bhikkhunā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evam'assa vacanīyo

VIN 4.4.120 aphāsukavihāra
ukkuṭikā

fem. walking on tip toes; walking on the heels; lit. bent up [ud + √kuṭ + a + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from ukkuṭa
Meaning walking on tip toes; walking on the heels; lit. bent up
Root Family ud √kuṭ
Root √kuṭ･1 a (be crooked, bent)
Construction ud + √kuṭ + a + ikā
ukkuṭa + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Phonetic Change d > k
Commentary (VINa) ukkuṭikāyā'ti ettha ukkuṭikā vuccati paṇhiyo ukkhipitvā aggapādehi vā, aggapāde vā ukkhipitvā paṇhīhi'y'eva vā bhūmiṃ phusantassa gamanaṃ. karaṇavacanaṃ pan'ettha vuttalakkhaṇam'eva.
Sanskrit utkuṭaka
Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

na ukkuṭikāya antaraghare gamissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 25 ukkuṭikasikkhāpadaṃ

na ukkuṭikāya antaraghare gantabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ukkuṭikāya antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.3 khambhakatavaggo
ukkuṭṭhi

fem. shouting out, acclamation [ud + √kus] ✗
ukkudhita

pp. boiled up; roiling [ud + √kuth + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of ud √kuth
Meaning boiled up; roiling
Root Family ud √kuth
Root √kuth･1 a (boil, burn)
√ In Comps kkuth
Construction ud + √kuth > kudh + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change th > dh
Antonym anukkudhita
Variant ukkaṭṭhita, ukkuṭṭhita
Commentary (ANa) ukkudhito'ti kudhito.
Sanskrit utkvathita
Sanskrit Root √kvath 1 (boil)

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto agginā santatto ukkudhito ussadakajāto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ nappajāneyya na passeyya.

ukkoṭa

masc. disturbance, re-opening (of a (legal) question already settled) ✗
ukkoṭana 1

Phonetic Change d > k
u > o
Commentary (MNa) ukkoṭanan'ti sāmike assāmike kātuṃ lañjaggahaṇaṃ.
Sanskrit utkocaka, utkoṭana (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √kuṭ 6 (be crooked)

tulākūṭa kaṃsakūṭa mānakūṭa ukkoṭana vañcana nikati sāciyoga chedana vadha bandhana viparāmosa ālopa sāhasākārā paṭivirato ahosi.

ukkoṭanaka

Meaning bribing and defrauding
Construction ukkoṭana + vañcana
Compound dvanda (ukkoṭana ca vañcana ca)
Sanskrit utkocaka + vañcana
ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyoga

masc. bribing, defrauding, counterfeiting and dishonest dealing; (comm) crooked dealing by bribery, fraud and counterfeiting [ukkoṭana + vañcana + nikati + sāciyoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bribing, defrauding, counterfeiting and dishonest dealing; (comm) crooked dealing by bribery, fraud and counterfeiting
Construction ukkoṭana + vañcana + nikati + sāciyoga
Compound dvanda (ukkoṭana ca vañcana ca nikati ca sāciyoga ca)
Commentary (DNa) sāciyogo'ti kuṭilayogo, etesaṃ'y'eva ukkoṭan'ādīnam'etaṃ nāmaṃ. tasmā, ukkoṭanasāciyogo, vañcanasāciyogo, nikatisāciyogo'ti, evam'ettha attho daṭṭhabbo. keci aññaṃ dassetvā aññassa parivattanaṃ sāciyogo'ti vadanti. taṃ pana vañcanen'eva saṅgahitaṃ.
Sanskrit utkocaka + vañcana + nikṛti + sāci + yoga

dūteyyapahiṇagaman'ānuyogā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, kayavikkayā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, tulākūṭakaṃsakūṭamānakūṭā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyogā paṭivirato ahosiṃ

puriso ca te ukkhitta-asiko piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhissati. yatth'eva naṃ thokam'pi chaḍḍessati tatth'eva te siro pātessatī'ti.

yattakā bhikkhū tassa uposathakammassa pattā yuttā anurūpā, sabb'antimena paricchedena cattāro bhikkhū pakatattā, saṅghena anukkhitā, te ca kho hatthapāsaṃ avijahitvā ekasīmayaṃ ṭhitā.

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ukkhittapaligho iti'pi, saṃkiṇṇaparikkho iti'pi, abbūḷh'esiko iti'pi, niraggaḷo iti'pi, ariyo pannaddhajo pannabhāro visaṃyutto iti'pi.

puriso ca te ukkhitt'āsiko piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhissati. yatth'eva naṃ thokam'pi chaḍḍessati tatth'eva te siro pātessatī'ti.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ
ukkhittāsikasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.103 (AN6.103) ✗
ukkhipati 1

pr. (+acc) throws out; suspends; lit. throws up [ud + √khip + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning throws out; suspends; lit. throws up
Root Family ud √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Base √khip + a > khipa
Construction ud + khipa + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkṣipati
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

atha kho naṃ khippam'eva sannipatitvā ukkhipati. kiñ'c'āpi so hoti majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinno, atha kho so ārakā'va saṅghamhā, saṅgho ca tena

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
ukkhipati 2

pr. (+acc) raises up; lifts up; holds up; lit. throws up [ud + √khip + a + ti] ✓

Construction ud + khipa + ti
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkṣipati
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

brāhmaṇo evam'āha, ukkhipa laṅgiṃ, abhikkhaṇa, sumedha, satthaṃ ādāyā'ti. abhikkhaṇanto sumedho satthaṃ ādāya addasa uddhumāyikaṃ. uddhumāyikā, bhadante'ti.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ
ukkhipi

aor. lifted up; suspended [ud + √khip] ✗
ukkhipitabba

ptp. should be raised up; should be lifted up; should be held up; lit. to be thrown up [ud + √khip + itabba] ~

Grammar ptp of ukkhipati
Meaning should be raised up; should be lifted up; should be held up; lit. to be thrown up
Root Family ud √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction ud + √khip + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Phonetic Change d > k
Sanskrit utkṣepitavya
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

na ukkhittakāya antaraghare gantabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ekato vā ubhato vā ukkhipitvā antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo

dhātiyo ayyaputto ekako'ti vegena sāṇiṃ ukkhipitvā anto pavisamānā bodhisattaṃ sayane pallaṅkena nisinnaṃ tañ'ca pāṭihāriyaṃ disvā gantvā rañño ārocayiṃsu

SN 47.8 sūdasuttaṃ

uggaṇhātha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. pariyāpuṇātha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. dhāretha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. atthasaṃhitā, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā ādibrahmacariyikā'ti.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

yo andhakāre tamasi pabhaṅ'karo,
verocano maṇḍalī uggatejo.
mā rāhu gilī caram'antalikkhe,
pajaṃ mamaṃ rāhu pamuñca sūriyan'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uggayha 1

ger. (+acc) taking up; grasping; embracing; holding (onto); taking a stand (on) [ud + √gah + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of uggaṇhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking up; grasping; embracing; holding (onto); taking a stand (on)
Root Family ud √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction ud + √gah + ya > gayha
Phonetic Change d > g
hy > yh (metathesis)
Sanskrit udgṛhya
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti,
idam'eva saccan'ti ca vādayanti,
te tvaṃ vadassū na hi te'dha atthi,
vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

yehi vivitto vicareyya loke,
na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo,
jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā,
jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ,
evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho,
kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

kapī'va sākhaṃ pamuñcaṃ gahāyaṃ.

Sanskrit udgrāhita
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

aññātavāde na saṇṭhātī'ti aññātavāde jānitavāde na saṇṭhāti. kathaṃ? ekacco pañhaṃ pucchati, taṃ itaro, manāpo tayā pañho pucchito, kahaṃ te esa uggahito'ti vadati.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā

aparo pañhaṃ puṭṭho katheti, tam'añño, suṭṭhu te pañho kathito, kattha te uggahito, pañhaṃ kathentena nāma evaṃ kathetabbo'ti vadati.

with metrically lengthened ī

diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra,
yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.

aṭṭhakavaggo 8

kāmesu vinaya gedhaṃ,
nekkhammaṃ daṭṭhu khemato,
uggahītaṃ nirattaṃ vā,
mā te vijjittha kiñcanaṃ.

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ. katame cattāro? ugghaṭitaññū, vipañcitaññū, neyyo, padaparamo, ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin'ti.

Sanskrit ucyate, vācyate
Sanskrit Root √vac 2, 3 (speak)

tassa vaḍḍhanti vedanā,
anekā rūpasambhavā,
abhijjhā ca vihesā ca,
cittam'ass'ūpahaññati,
evaṃ ācinato dukkhaṃ,
ārā nibbānam'uccati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

sabbehi dhātūhi bhāvakammesu yapaccayo hoti. ṭhīyate, bujjhate, paccate, labbhate, karīyate, yujjate, uccate. bhāvakammesū'ti kim'atthaṃ? karoti, pacati, paṭhati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 440
uccati 2

pr. (gram) is pronounced; is articulated [√vac + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of vacati, intrans
Meaning (gram) is pronounced; is articulated
Root Family √vac
Root √vac･1 ya (say, speak)
Base √vac > vuc + ya > vucca > ucca (pass, irreg)
Construction ucca + ti
Phonetic Change va > u
y > c
Notes uccante is pr reflx 3rd pl "they are pronounced"
Sanskrit ucyate, vācyate
Sanskrit Root √vac 2, 3 (speak)

saṃyogato pubbe eo rassā iva-uccante kvaci, anantarā byañjanā saṃyogo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
uccaya

masc. heap; pile; accumulation [ud + √ci + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from uccināti
Meaning heap; pile; accumulation
Root Family ud √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction ud + √ci > cay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change d > c
i > ay
Sanskrit uccaya
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

pāpañ'ce puriso kayirā,
na naṃ kayirā punappunaṃ,
na tamhi chandaṃ kayirātha,
dukkho pāpassa uccayo.

DHP 117 pāpavaggo

puññañ'ce puriso kayirā,
kayirāth'etaṃ punappunaṃ,
tamhi chandaṃ kayirātha,
sukho puññassa uccayo.

uccavatthuka

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ

so tam'anugacchati. tam'anugacchanto passati nāgavane mahantaṃ hatthipadaṃ, dīghato ca āyataṃ, tiriyañ'ca vitthataṃ, uccā ca nisevitaṃ.

Sanskrit uccaiḥkula

katamo ca, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo? idha, bhikkhave, asappuriso uccākulā pabbajito hoti. so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi uccākulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na uccākulā pabbajitā'ti.

Sanskrit uccā + kulīnatā

ahaṃ kho'mhi uccākulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na uccākulā pabbajitā'ti. so tāya uccākulīnatāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ,
saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ,
ratiyo patthayantena,
uḷārā apar'āparā.

uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī

asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī ahosiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
uccārapassāvakamma

Meaning going to the toilet; defecating and urinating; lit. making excrement and urine

Compound dutiyā tappurisa (uccārapassāvaṃ + kamma)
Commentary (MNa) uccārapassāvakamme'ti uccārassa ca passāvassa ca karaṇe.
Sanskrit uccāraprasrāva + karman

so kho ahaṃ, bhante, aññatr'eva asitapītakhāyitasāyitā aññatra uccārapassāvakammā aññatra niddākilamathapaṭivinodanā vassasat'āyuko vassasatajīvī vassasataṃ gantvā appatvā'va lokassa antaṃ antarā'y'eva kālaṅ'kato.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī ahosiṃ.

uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭha

nt. bite of a hairy caterpillar [uccāliṅgapāṇaka + daṭṭha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bite of a hairy caterpillar
Construction uccāliṅgapāṇaka + daṭṭha
Commentary (VINa) uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭh'ūpatthambhe'ti uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭhena aṅgajāte upatthambhe. uccāliṅgapāṇakā nāma lomasapāṇakā honti, tesaṃ lomehi phuṭṭhaṃ aṅgajātaṃ kaṇḍuṃ gahetvā thaddhaṃ hoti, tattha yasmā tāni lomāni aṅgajātaṃ ḍaṃsantāni viya vijjhanti, tasmā uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭhenā'ti vuttaṃ, atthato pana uccāliṅgapāṇakalomavedhanenā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.

uccāvaca 1

adj. high and low; here and there; good and bad; elation and depression [ucca + avaca] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning high and low; here and there; good and bad; elation and depression
Construction ucca + avaca
Compound dvanda (ucca ca avaca ca)
Commentary (VINa) ucc'āvacehi ākārehī'ti mahant'āmahantehi upāyehi.
Sanskrit uccāvaca

sabbattha ve sappurisā cajanti,
na kāmakāmā lapayanti santo,
sukhena phuṭṭhā atha vā dukhena,
na ucc'āvacaṃ paṇḍitā dassayanti.

DHP 83 paṇḍitavaggo

sayaṃ samādāya vatāni jantu,
ucc'āvacaṃ gacchati saññasatto,
vidvā ca vedehi samecca dhammaṃ,
na ucc'āvacaṃ gacchati bhūripañño.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
uccāvaca 2

adj. diverse; various kinds of; manifold; lit. high and low [ucca + avaca] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning diverse; various kinds of; manifold; lit. high and low
Construction ucca + avaca
Compound dvanda (ucca ca avaca ca)
Commentary (SNa) ucc'āvacā'ti aññesu ṭhānesu paṇītaṃ uccaṃ vuccati, hīnaṃ avacaṃ. idha pana ucc'āvacā'ti nānāvidhā vaṇṇanibhā. (SNa) uccāvacehī'ti nānāvidhehi.
Sanskrit uccāvaca

atha kho susimassa devaputtassa devaputtaparisā āyasmato sāriputtassa vaṇṇe bhaññamāne attamanā pamuditā pītisomanassajātā ucc'āvacā vaṇṇanibhā upadaṃseti.

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ

ucc'āvacehi vaṇṇehi,
urago carati tejasī,
so āsajja ḍaṃse bālaṃ,
naraṃ nāriñ'ca ekadā,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
uccāvaca 3

adj. large and small; important and minor; lit. high and low [ucca + avaca] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning large and small; important and minor; lit. high and low
Construction ucca + avaca
Compound dvanda (ucca ca avaca ca)
Commentary (ANa) uccāvacānī'ti mahantakhuddakāni. (ANa) uccāvacānī'ti uccanīcāni.
Sanskrit uccāvaca

puna caparaṃ, subhūti, bhikkhu yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ ucc'āvacāni kiṃkaraṇīyāni tatra dakkho hoti analaso tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgato alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.

AN 11.14 subhūtisuttaṃ

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'c'āpi yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ ucc'āvacāni kiṃkaraṇīyāni tattha ussukkaṃ āpanno hoti, atha khv'āssa tibb'āpekkhā hoti adhisīlasikkhāya adhicittasikkhāya adhipaññāsikkhāya.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, devānam'inda, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre mahādhaññarāsi. tato mahājanakāyo dhaññaṃ āhareyya, kājehi'pi piṭakehi'pi ucchaṅgehi'pi añjalīhi'pi.

AN 8.8 uttaravipattisuttaṃ
ucchaṅga 2

masc. lap, hip [ud + √sañj] ✗
ucchaṅgapañña

adj. "lap brained", scatterbrained; who does not retain what he has heard ✗
ucchaḍḍitvāna

abs. having brought up; having regurgitated [ud + √chaḍḍ + itvāna] ✓

Grammar abs, intrans
Meaning having brought up; having regurgitated
Root Family ud √chaḍḍ
Root √chaḍḍ･8 *e (discard, abandon)
√ In Comps cchaḍḍ
Construction ud + √chaḍḍ + itvāna
Variant ucchadditvāna, uggiritvāna, ucchaditvā
Commentary (UDa) ucchadditvānā'ti vamitvā, yaṃnūna dadeyyan'ti sambandho.
Sanskrit uttyaktvā
Sanskrit Root √chṛd √tyaj 1, 7 (spue, eject)

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ rañño pasenadissa kosalassa koṭṭhāgāraṃ gantvā telassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pivitvā gharaṃ āgantvā ucchaḍḍitvāna dadeyyaṃ, yaṃ imissā vijātāya bhavissatī'ti.

UD16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ
ucchadditvāna

abs. having brought up; having regurgitated [ud + √chaḍḍ + itvāna] ✓

Grammar abs, intrans
Meaning having brought up; having regurgitated
Root Family ud √chaḍḍ
Root √chaḍḍ･8 *e (discard, abandon)
√ In Comps cchaḍḍ
Construction ud + √chaḍḍ > chadd + itvāna
Phonetic Change ḍḍ > dd
Variant uggiritvāna, ucchaditvā, ucchaḍḍitvāna
Commentary (UDa) ucchadditvānā'ti vamitvā, yaṃnūna dadeyyan'ti sambandho. evaṃ kir'assa ahosi ahaṃ rañño koṭṭhāgāraṃ gantvā telaṃ kaṇṭhamattaṃ pivitvā tāva'd'eva gharaṃ āgantvā ekasmiṃ bhājane yathāpītaṃ vamitvā uddhanaṃ āropetvā pacissāmi, yaṃ pittasemh'ādimissitaṃ, taṃ agginā jhāyissati, telaṃ pana gahetvā imissā paribbājikāya kamme upanessāmī'ti.
Sanskrit uttyaktvā
Sanskrit Root √chṛd √tyaj 1, 7 (spue, eject)

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ rañño pasenadissa kosalassa koṭṭhāgāraṃ gantvā telassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pivitvā gharaṃ āgantvā ucchadditvāna dadeyyaṃ, yaṃ imissā vijātāya bhavissatī'ti.

UD16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ
ucchādana 1

nt. massaging; rubbing; lit. covering [ud + √chad + *ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from ucchādeti
Meaning massaging; rubbing; lit. covering
Root Family ud √chad
Root √chad･8 *e (cover, conceal)
√ In Comps cchad
Construction ud + √chad > chād + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change d > c
a > ā
Sanskrit ucchādana
Sanskrit Root √chad 1 (cover)

tasmā hi ne namasseyya,
sakkareyya ca paṇḍito,
annena atha pānena,
vatthena sayanena ca,
ucchādanena nhāpanena,
pādānaṃ dhovanena ca.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ

Root √chad･8 *e (cover, conceal)

Construction ud + √chad > chād + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change d > c
a > ā
Sanskrit ucchādana
Sanskrit Root √chad 1 (cover)

ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātā-pettika-sambhavo odana-kummāsa-upacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti

DN 2.24 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
ucchādanaparimaddananhāpanasambāhana

nt. massaging, kneading, bathing and rubbing down [ucchādana + parimaddana + nhāpana + sambāhana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning massaging, kneading, bathing and rubbing down
Construction ucchādana + parimaddana + nhāpana + sambāhana
Commentary (ANa) so ca nesaṃ ucchādana-parimaddana-nhāpana-sambāhanenā'ti so ca putto nesaṃ mātāpitūnaṃ aṃsakūṭesu ṭhitānaṃ'y'eva duggandha-paṭivinodan'atthaṃ sugandha-karaṇena ucchādanena, parissama-vinodan'atthaṃ hattha-parimaddanena, sīt'uṇhakāle ca uṇh'odakasīt'odaka-nhāpanena, hatthapādādīnaṃ ākaḍḍhana-parikaḍḍhana-saṅkhātena sambāhanena upaṭṭhānaṃ kareyya.

byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

tassa evaṃ hoti, ucchijjissāmi nāmassu, vinassissāmi nāmassu, nassu nāma bhavissāmī'ti

n'atthi tassa punabbhavo'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaṃyojane se ucchinnamūle tāl'āvatthukate anabhāvaṃkate āyatiṃ anuppādadhamme.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

santacittassa bhikkhuno,
vikkhīṇo jātisaṃsāro,
n'atthi tassa punabbhavo'ti.

Construction ucchinna + mūla

Commentary (MNa) se ucchinnamūle'ti so ucchinnamūlo.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit ucchinna + mūla

evam'eva kho, vaccha, yena rūpena tathāgataṃ paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya taṃ rūpaṃ tathāgatassa pahīnaṃ ucchinnamūlaṃ tāl'āvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṃkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ

evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaṃyojane se ucchinnamūle tāl'āvatthukate anabhāvaṃkate āyatiṃ anuppādadhamme.

ucchu

masc. sugar cane; Saccharum officinarum ✓

Meaning sugar cane; Saccharum officinarum
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sugarcane
Sanskrit ikṣu

tuvañ'ca bhante anukampakaṃ viduṃ,
upecca vandiṃ kusalañ'ca pucchisaṃ,
tato te ucchussa adāsi khaṇḍikaṃ,
pasannacitā atulāya pītiyā'ti.

VV 30 ucchudāyikā vimānavatthu

madhu nāma makkhikāmadhu. phāṇitaṃ nāma ucchumhā nibbattaṃ.

seyyathā'pi, ānanda, sampanne ucchukkhette mañjiṭṭhikā nāma rogajāti nipatati, evaṃ taṃ ucchukkhettaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.

Sanskrit Root √ubj √ṛñj 6 (force)

tatra bhikkhavo samādahaṃsu,
cittam'attano ujukaṃ akaṃsu,
sārathī'va nettāni gahetvā,
indriyāni rakkhanti paṇḍitā'ti.

ujuko nāma so maggo,
abhayā nāma sā disā,
ratho akūjano nāma,
dhammacakkehi saṃyuto.

Sanskrit ṛju + bhūta

kāle dadanti sappaññā,
vadaññū vītamaccharā,
kālena dinnaṃ ariyesu,
ujubhūtesu t'ādisu,
vippasannamanā tassa,
vipulā hoti dakkhiṇā.

AN 5.36 kāladānasuttaṃ
ujumagga

masc. straight road; direct route [uju + magga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning straight road; direct route
Construction uju + magga
Compound kammadhāraya (uju + magga)
Sanskrit ṛju + mārga

sekhassa sikkhamānassa,
ujumagg'ānusārino,
khayasmiṃ paṭhamaṃ ñāṇaṃ,
tato aññā anantarā.

ITI 62 indriyasuttaṃ

gacchanto kho pana ujumaggen'eva gacchati, tatr'āyaṃ ujumaggo, seyyath'idaṃ, sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
ujumaggānusārī

adj. going along the straight path; following the direct route [uju + magga + anusārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning going along the straight path; following the direct route
Construction uju + magga + anusārī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ujumaggaṃ + anusārī)
Sanskrit ṛju + mārga + anusārin

sekhassa sikkhamānassa,
ujumagg'ānusārino,
khayasmiṃ paṭhamaṃ ñāṇaṃ,
tato aññā anantarā.

ITI 62 indriyasuttaṃ
ujuvipaccanīkavāda

adj. (+dat) with a directly contradictory view (to); with the exact opposite belief (to); having the diametrically opposed opinion (to) [uju + vipaccanīka + vāda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+dat)
Meaning with a directly contradictory view (to); with the exact opposite belief (to); having the diametrically opposed opinion (to)
Construction uju + vipaccanīka + vāda
Compound kammadhāraya (ujuvipaccanīka + vāda)
Sanskrit ṛju + vipratyanīka

tesaṃ'y'eva kho, gahapatayo, samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā ujuvipaccanīkavādā. te evam'āhaṃsu, atthi dinnaṃ, atthi yiṭṭhaṃ, atthi hutaṃ

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
ujuṃ

ind. uprightly; erectly [√uj + u + uṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of uju
Meaning uprightly; erectly
Root Family √uj
Root √uj×1 a (be straight)
Construction √uj + u + uṃ
uju + uṃ
Sanskrit ṛju
Sanskrit Root √ubj √ṛñj 6 (force)

so pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

tato paṭinivattitvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
ujja

ptp. should be said; lit. to be spoken [√vad + ya] ✓

Grammar ptp of vadati
Meaning should be said; lit. to be spoken
Root Family √vad
Root √vad･1 a (say, speak)
Construction √vad > ud + ya
Derivative kicca (ya)
Phonetic Change a > u
dy > jj
Sanskrit udya
Sanskrit Root √vad 1 (speak)

te vādakāmā parisaṃ vigayha,
bālaṃ dahantī mithu aññam'aññaṃ,
vadanti te aññasitā kath'ojjaṃ,
pasaṃsakāmā kusalā vadānā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

Construction ud + √ju > jav + *ana + ka
ujjavana + ka

Phonetic Change d > j
u > av
Antonym ojavanaka

Sanskrit ud + javana
Sanskrit Root √jū 1, 9 (be swift)

uddhaṃgāminin'ti ujjavanikāya. adhogāminin'ti ojavanikāya.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ

manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti, kathañ'hi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā purato'pi pacchato'pi olambentā nivāsessanti, seyyathā'pi gihī kāmabhogino'ti.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo

atha kho bhagavā sitaṃ pātvākāsi. atha kho tā devatāyo bhiyyosomattāya ujjhāyantiyo vehāsaṃ abbhuggañchuṃ.

ujjhāyi

aor. grumbled [ava + √jhā] ✗

Root √ujjh･1 a (leave, discard)
Construction √ujjh + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (THIa) ujjhito'ti vāt'ukkhitto viya yo koci, dahaniyā indhanaṃ viyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit ujjhita
Sanskrit Root √ujh √ujjh 6 (forsake)

yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

yathā saṅkāraṭhānasmiṃ,
ujjhitasmiṃ mahāpathe,
padumaṃ tattha jāyetha,
sucigandhaṃ manoramaṃ.

DHP 58 pupphavaggo
ujjhitvā

abs. having left, forsaken [√ujjh] ✗

Meaning gleaning; food gathered for subsistence

Root √uñch･1 a (glean)
Construction √uñch + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit uñcha
Sanskrit Root √uñch 1, 6 (glean)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, dubbhikkhaṃ hoti dussassaṃ dullabhapiṇḍaṃ, na sukaraṃ uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo asamayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ
uñchati

pr. seeks alms, gleans [√uñch] ✗
uñchā

fem. anything gathered for sustenance [√uñch] ✗
uñchāsaka

adj. involving eating by means of gleaning or begging ✗
uñchi

aor. sought alms, gleaned [√uñch] ✗
uññā

fem. contempt; disrespect ✗
uññātabba

ptp. to be despised; to be disdained; should be looked down (on); lit. to be known down [ava + √ñā + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of avajānāti
Meaning to be despised; to be disdained; should be looked down (on); lit. to be known down
Root Family ava √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Construction ava > o > u + √ñā + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change ava > u
Commentary (SNa) na uññātabbā'ti na avajānitabbā.
Sanskrit avajñeya
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

cattāro kho me, mahārāja, daharā'ti na uññātabbā, daharā'ti na paribhotabbā. katame cattāro?

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ

samaṇo kho daharo'ti na uññātabbo na paribhotabbo. daharo'pi c'esa samaṇo gotamo mah'iddhiko hoti mah'ānubhāvo, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ime pañhe puccheyyan'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
uṭṭhahati 1

pr. gets up; gets out; arouses oneself; lit. stands up [ud + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning gets up; gets out; arouses oneself; lit. stands up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + ti
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit uttiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

so uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati anavaññappaṭilābhāya lābhasakkārasilokappaṭilābhāya

AN 4.157 rogasuttaṃ

uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10
uṭṭhahati 2

pr. stands up; gets up; arises [ud + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning stands up; gets up; arises
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + ti
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit uttiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

atha kho bhagavā brahmāyuṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, alaṃ, brāhmaṇa, uṭṭhaha nisīda tvaṃ sake āsane yato te mayi cittaṃ pasannan'ti. atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uṭṭhahitvā sake āsane nisīdi.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

thaddhavisamabhūmibhāgasmiñ'hi caṅkame caṅkamantassa pādā rujjanti, phoṭā uṭṭhahanti, cittaṃ ekaggaṃ na labhati, kammaṭṭhānaṃ vipajjati.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
uṭṭhahanta

prp. getting up; arousing oneself; lit. standing up [ud + √ṭhā + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of uṭṭhahati, intrans
Meaning getting up; arousing oneself; lit. standing up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Commentary (MNa) uṭṭhahato'ti ājīvasamuṭṭhāpakavīriyena uṭṭhahantassa
Sanskrit utthāt
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti

MN 13 mahā dukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
uṭṭhahi 1

Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)

Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction ud + ṭhaha + i
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

atha te, jarasakko amhe matte katvā mahāsamuddapiṭṭhe khipitvā amhākaṃ devanagaraṃ gaṇhi, te mayaṃ tena saddhiṃ yujjhitvā amhākaṃ devanagaram'eva gaṇhissāmā'ti kipillikā viya thambhaṃ sineruṃ anusañcaramānā uṭṭhahiṃsu.

JAa 31 kulāvaka jātakavaṇṇanā
uṭṭhahi 2

aor. stood up, arose [ud + √ṭhā] ✗
uṭṭhahitvā 1

Meaning having stood up; having gotten up; having risen up

Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā

Construction ud + ṭhaha + itvā
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthītvā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

atha kho bhagavā brahmāyuṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, alaṃ, brāhmaṇa, uṭṭhaha nisīda tvaṃ sake āsane yato te mayi cittaṃ pasannan'ti. atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uṭṭhahitvā sake āsane nisīdi.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

bhikkhu nipanne, anupasampanno nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa. ubho vā nipajjanti, āpatti pācittiyassa. uṭṭhahitvā punappunaṃ nipajjanti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.1.5 sahaseyyasikkhāpadaṃ

Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthītvā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

tam'enaṃ uṭṭhahitvā apāpuritvā olokeyya. tassa sahadassanena amanāpatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, pāṭikulyatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jegucchatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jighacchitānam'pi na bhottukamyatā assa, pag'eva suhitānaṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
uṭṭhātar

masc. who rouses himself, is energetic [ud + √ṭhā] ✗

pr. (+abl) arises (from); emerges (from); gets up (from) [ud + √ṭhā] ✗

Antonym anuṭṭhāna

Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappessāma pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā

Antonym anuṭṭhāna
Sanskrit utthāna
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

uṭṭhānen'appamādena,
saṃyamena damena ca,
dīpaṃ kayirātha medhāvī,
yaṃ ogho n'ābhikīrati.

DHP 25 appamādavaggo

uṭṭhānaṃ anālasyaṃ bhogānaṃ āhāro, maṇḍanā vibhūsanā vaṇṇassa āhāro, sappāyakiriyā ārogyassa āhāro, kalyāṇamittatā sīlānaṃ āhāro

masc. right time for making an effort; suitable time for exertion; lit. get up time [uṭṭhāna + kāla] ✓

yuvā balī ālasiyaṃ upeto,
saṃsannasaṅkappamano kusīto,
paññāya maggaṃ alaso na vindati.

DHP 280 maggavaggo
uṭṭhānanisajjā

fem. standing up and sitting down [uṭṭhāna + nisajjā] ~

Meaning standing up and sitting down
Construction uṭṭhāna + nisajjā
uṭṭhānaphalasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.134 (AN4.134) ✗
uṭṭhānaphalūpajīvī

adj. living off the fruit of one's efforts [uṭṭhāna + phalūpajīvī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living off the fruit of one's efforts
Construction uṭṭhāna + phalūpajīvī
Commentary (ANa) uṭṭhānavīriyen'eva divasaṃ vītināmetvā tassa nissandaphalamattaṃ kiñcideva labhitvā jīvikaṃ kappeti, taṃ pana uṭṭhānaṃ āgamma kiñci puññaphalaṃ nappaṭilabhati, ayaṃ uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvī na kammaphal'ūpajīvī nāma. cātumahārājike pana deve ādiṃ katvā sabbe'pi devā uṭṭhānavīriyena vinā puññaphalasseva upajīvanato kammaphal'ūpajīvino na uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvino nāma. rājarājamahāmatt'ādayo uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvino ca kammaphal'ūpajīvino ca. nerayikasattā n'eva uṭṭhānaphal'ūpajīvino na kammaphal'ūpajīvino.
uṭṭhānavant

adj. energetic; ready for action; lit. having stand up quality [ud + √ṭhā + ana + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from uṭṭhāna
Meaning energetic; ready for action; lit. having stand up quality
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ud + √ṭhā + ana + vant
uṭṭhāna + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthānavat
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

uṭṭhānavato satīmato,
sucikammassa nisammakārino,
saññatassa dhammajīvino,
appamattassa yaso'bhivaḍḍhati.

DHP 24 appamādavaggo
uṭṭhānavīriya

nt. effort and exertion; get up and go [uṭṭhāna + vīriya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning effort and exertion; get up and go
Construction uṭṭhāna + vīriya
Compound dvanda (uṭṭhāna ca vīriya ca)
Sanskrit utthāna + vīrya

so, bhogā me atthi uṭṭhānavīriya-adhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā'ti adhigacchati sukhaṃ, adhigacchati somanassaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, gahapati, atthisukhaṃ.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ

kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriya-adhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
uṭṭhānavīriyādhigata

adj. obtained by effort and exertion [uṭṭhāna + vīriya + adhigata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obtained by effort and exertion
Construction uṭṭhāna + vīriya + adhigata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (uṭṭhānavīriyena + adhigata)
Commentary (SNa) uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatassā'ti uṭṭhānena ca vīriyena ca adhigatassa bhogassa.
Sanskrit utthāna + vīrya + adhigata

yo dhammaladdhassa dadāti dānaṃ,
uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatassa jantu,
atikkamma so vetaraṇiṃ yamassa,
dibbāni ṭhānāni upeti macco'ti.

SN 1.33 sādhusuttaṃ

kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
uṭṭhānasaññā

fem. notion of waking up; wake up time [uṭṭhāna + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning notion of waking up; wake up time
Construction uṭṭhāna + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (uṭṭhānassa + saññā)
Commentary (MNa) uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā'ti ettakaṃ kālaṃ atikkamitvā vuṭṭhahissāmī'ti vuṭṭhānasaññaṃ citte ṭhapetvā.
Sanskrit utthāna + saṃjñā

rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappessāma pāde pādaṃ accādhāya, sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā catugguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ paññāpetvā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappesi, pāde pādaṃ accādhāya, sato sampajāno, uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
uṭṭhānasampadā

fem. successful initiative; accomplishment in undertakings [uṭṭhāna + sampadā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning successful initiative; accomplishment in undertakings

Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (uṭṭhānassa + sampadā)
Sanskrit utthāna + sampradā

idha, byagghapajja, kulaputto yena kammaṭṭhānena jīvikaṃkappeti ... tattha dakkho hoti analaso, tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgato, alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, byagghapajja, uṭṭhānasampadā.

ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,

DHP 240 malavaggo
uṭṭhāyaka

adj. active, industrious [ud + √ṭhā] ✗

Sanskrit utthāya + āsana

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, uṭṭhāy'āsanā udakena akkhīni anumajjitvā disā anuvilokeyyāsi nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni ullokeyyāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu, bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā'ti.

uṭṭheti

pr. (+acc) gets up; stands up; lit. causes to stand up [ud + √ṭhā + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of uṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning gets up; stands up; lit. causes to stand up
Root Family ud √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *e (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + e > ṭhe (caus)
Construction ud + ṭhe + ti
Phonetic Change d > ṭ
Sanskrit utthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

uṭṭhehi, āvuso, diṭṭho'si bhagavatā, n'atthi te bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāso'ti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

uṭṭhehi vīra vijitasaṅgāma,
satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke,
desassu bhagavā dhammaṃ,
aññātāro bhavissantī'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ

kenassu uḍḍito loko,

Root Family ud √nam

Phonetic Change dn > ṇṇ
mt > t
Antonym anuṇṇata, avanata
Commentary (MNa) vaṭṭan'āvaḷī'ti yathā rajjuyā āvunitvā katā vaṭṭan'āvaḷī vaṭṭanānaṃ antar'antarā ninnā hoti, vaṭṭanaṭṭhānesu unnatā, evaṃ piṭṭhikaṇṭako unnatāvanato hoti.

Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

seyyathā'pi nāma vaṭṭan'āvaḷī, evam'ev'assu me piṭṭhikaṇṭako uṇṇata-avanato hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

mān'ātimānaṃ vadate pan'eso,
etam'pi disvā na vivādayetha,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 8

Sanskrit uṣṇā, uṣma, uṣmatā
Sanskrit Root √uṣ 1, 9 (burn)

atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atidhāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti.

DN 31.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bho gotama, sārīrikāya dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhassa sato ūrukkhambho'pi nāma bhavissati, hadayam'pi nāma phalissati, uṇham'pi lohitaṃ mukhato uggamissati, ummādam'pi pāpuṇissati cittakkhepaṃ.

Meaning weather; climate; temperature

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso sen'āsanaṃ paṭisevati, yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya, uṇhassa paṭighātāya, ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassānaṃ paṭighātāya, yāva'd'eva utuparissayavinodanapaṭisallān'ārām'atthaṃ

nt. weather; climate; temperature ✓

Meaning weather; climate; temperature

pittaṃ semhañ'ca vāto ca,
sannipātā utūni ca,

utu 3

masc. season; time of year ✓

Meaning season; time of year

madhurañ'ca pavanti sabbaso,
kusumarajena samuṭṭhitā dumā,
paṭhamavasanto sukho utu,
ehi ramāma supupphite vane.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

chandaparisuddhi, utu'kkhānaṃ, bhikkhugaṇanā ca, ovādo, uposathassa etāni, pubbakiccan'ti vuccati.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
utu 4

masc. refreshment ~

Grammar masc
Meaning refreshment
Sanskrit ṛtu
utu 5

masc. menses [utu] ✗
utukāla

masc. time of the menses ✗
utuddhaṭa

nt. worn thin or worn away through time ✗
utunī

adj. menstruating [utu + unī] ✓

Grammar adj, from utu
Meaning menstruating
Construction utu + unī
Derivative taddhita (unī)
Commentary (MNa) mātā ca utunī hotī'ti idaṃ utusamayaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. mātugāmassa kira yasmiṃ okāse dārako nibbattati, tattha mahatī lohitapīḷakā saṇṭhahitvā bhijjitvā paggharati, vatthu suddhaṃ hoti, suddhe vatthumhi mātāpitūsu ekavāraṃ sannipatitesu yāva satta divasāni khettam'eva hoti. tasmiṃ samaye hatthaggāhaveṇiggāh'ādinā aṅgaparāmasanena'pi dārako nibbattati'y'eva.
Sanskrit ṛtu

tiṇṇaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, sannipātā gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti. idha mātā'pitaro ca sannipatitā honti, mātā ca na utunī hoti, gandhabbo ca na paccupaṭṭhito hoti, n'eva tāva gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
utupariṇāmaja

adj. produced by change in the weather; caused by seasonal variation; due to alteration in climate [utu + pariṇāma + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning produced by change in the weather; caused by seasonal variation; due to alteration in climate
Construction utu + pariṇāma + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (utupariṇāmasmā + ja)
Commentary (SNa) utupariṇāmajānī'ti visabhāgaututo jātāni. jaṅgaladesavāsīnañ'hi anupadese vasantānaṃ visabhāgo utu uppajjati, anupadesavāsīnañ'ca jaṅgaladese'ti evaṃ malayasamuddatīr'ādivasenā'pi utuvisabhāgatā uppajjati'y'eva. tato jātāti utupariṇāmajātāni nāma. (NIDD1a) utupariṇāmajā'ti utupariṇāmena.
Sanskrit ṛtu + pariṇāma + ja

pittasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... semhasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... vātasamuṭṭhānāni'pi … sannipātikāni'pi … utupariṇāmajāni'pi … visamaparihārajāni'pi … opakkamikāni'pi … kammavipākajāni'pi kho, sīvaka, idh'ekaccāni vedayitāni uppajjanti.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ ... pittasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā semhasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā vātasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā sannipātikā ābādhā utupariṇāmajā ābādhā visamaparihārajā ābādhā opakkamikā ābādhā kammavipākajā ābādhā sītaṃ uṇhaṃ jighacchā pipāsā uccāro passāvo'ti.

Construction uttara + ānanda + mātar

adj. from the northern part; living in the northern path; lit. related to the northern path [uttarā + patha + ka] ~

Grammar adj, comp, from uttarāpatha
Meaning from the northern part; living in the northern path; lit. related to the northern path
Construction uttarā + patha + ka
uttarāpatha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (VINa) uttarāpathakā ... uttarāpathavāsikā uttarāpathato vā āgatattā evaṃ laddhavohārā assavāṇijā
uttarābhimukha

adj. facing north ✗
uttarāmukha

adj. facing north; going towards the north ✗
uttarāraṇi

fem. upper fire stick; top friction stick [uttara + araṇi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning upper fire stick; top friction stick
Construction uttara + araṇi
Compound kammadhāraya (uttara + araṇi)
Sanskrit uttarāraṇi

seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ udake nikkhittaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya, aggiṃ abhinibbattessāmi, tejo pātukarissāmī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uttarāsaṅga

masc. upper robe [uttara + āsaṅga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning upper robe
Construction uttara + āsaṅga
Compound kammadhāraya (uttara + āsaṅga)
Synonym uttara
Sanskrit uttarāsaṅga

atha kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante paṭhame yāme, uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

kālass'eva vuṭṭhāya upāhanā omuñcitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukh'odakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.

uttarāḷumpa

masc. contrivance to prevent a pot of dye from boiling over ✗
uttari 1

adj. (+abl) superior (than); higher (than); better (than) [ud + tara + i] ✓

Grammar adj, compar of ud (+abl)
Meaning superior (than); higher (than); better (than)
Construction ud + tara + i
uttara + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit uttara

paraman'ti diṭṭhīsu paribbasāno,
yaduttari kurute jantu loke,
hīnā'ti aññe tato sabbam'āha,
tasmā vivādāni avītivatto.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

nihīyati puriso nihīnasevī,
na ca hāyetha kadāci tulyasevī,
seṭṭham'upanamaṃ udeti khippaṃ,
tasmā attano uttariṃ bhajethā'ti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
uttari 2

uttara + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Phonetic Change d > t
Variant uttariṃ
Sanskrit uttarin

apalokento kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo sabbakāyen'eva apaloketi, so na uddhaṃ ulloketi, na adho oloketi, na ca vipekkhamāno gacchati, yugamattañ'ca pekkhati, tato c'assa uttari anāvaṭaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesu'y'eva kusalesu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya uttari āsavānaṃ khayāya yogo karaṇīyo'ti.

VIN PAT PC 7 dhammadesanāsikkhāpadaṃ

Sanskrit uttaram + ca

evaṃ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na c'eva sampāyissanti, uttariñ'ca vighātaṃ āpajjissanti. taṃ kissa hetu? yathā taṃ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṃ.

etadānuttariyaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇānaṃ yadidaṃ tattha tattha yathābhūtañāṇaṃ. etasmā c'āhaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇā aññaṃ ñāṇaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā n'atthī'ti vadāmi

Commentary (VIN 1.1.4) uttarimanussadhammo nāma jhānaṃ vimokkho samādhi samāpatti ñāṇadassanaṃ maggabhāvanā phalasacchikiriyā kilesappahānaṃ vinīvaraṇatā cittassa suññ'āgāre abhirati. (VINa) uttarimanussadhamman'ti uttarimanussānaṃ jhāyīnañ'c'eva ariyānañ'ca dhammaṃ
Sanskrit uttara + manuṣya + dharma

assosi kho āyasmā sāriputto sunakkhattassa licchaviputtassa vesāliyaṃ parisati evaṃ vācaṃ bhāsamānassa, n'atthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

imehi kho me, gahapati, tiṃsamattehi vassehi pabbajitassa n'atthi koci uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso adhigato phāsuvihāro, aññatra naggeyyā ca muṇḍeyyā ca pāvaḷanipphoṭanāya cā'ti

Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (uttāna + katvā)
Sanskrit uttānīkṛ (to open wide)

evarūpaṃ te, rāhula, kāyakammaṃ satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu desetabbaṃ, vivaritabbaṃ, uttānīkātabbaṃ, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'c'āpi tathārūpiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, yathārūpāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu deseti vivarati uttānīkaroti, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjati.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
uttānīkamma

nt. exposition, manifestation ✗
uttānīkariyamāna

prp. (+instr) being explained (by); being clarified (by); being elucidated (by); lit. being made spread out [uttāna + kariyamāna] ✓

Grammar prp of uttānīkariyati, comp vb, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being explained (by); being clarified (by); being elucidated (by); lit. being made spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + kariyamāna
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (uttāna + kariyamāna)
Sanskrit uttānīkriyamāṇa

yo, bhikkhave, tathāgatena evaṃ ācikkhiyamāne desiyamāne paññapiyamāne paṭṭhapiyamāne vivariyamāne vibhajiyamāne uttānīkariyamāne na jānāti na passati tam'ahaṃ, bhikkhave, bālaṃ puthujjanaṃ andhaṃ acakkhukaṃ ajānantaṃ apassantaṃ kin'ti karomi!

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ
uttānīkaroti 1

pr. (+acc) explains; clarifies; elucidates; lit. make spread out [uttāna + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning explains; clarifies; elucidates; lit. make spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + karoti
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (uttāna + karoti)
Variant uttānī karoti
Commentary (SNa) uttānīkarotī'ti pākaṭaṃ karoti
Sanskrit uttānīkaroti

na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti … sakaṃ ācariyakaṃ uggahetvā … vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti

DN 16.20 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo, taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti, abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā taṃ ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti.

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ
uttānīkaroti 2

pr. (+acc) reveals; openly admits; exposes; lit. make spread out [uttāna + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning reveals; openly admits; exposes; lit. make spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + karoti
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (uttāna + karoti)
Variant uttānī karoti
Commentary (SNa) uttānīkarotī'ti pākaṭaṃ karoti
Sanskrit uttānīkaroti

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'c'āpi tathārūpiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, yathārūpāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu deseti vivarati uttānīkaroti, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjati.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
uttānīkātabba

ptp. (+loc) should be revealed (to); should be laid open (to); should be made evident (to); lit. to be made spread out [uttāna + kātabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of uttānīkaroti, comp vb (+loc)
Meaning should be revealed (to); should be laid open (to); should be made evident (to); lit. to be made spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + kātabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (uttāna + kātabba)
Sanskrit uttānīkṛ (to open wide)

evarūpaṃ te, rāhula, kāyakammaṃ satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu desetabbaṃ, vivaritabbaṃ, uttānīkātabbaṃ, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
uttānīkātuṃ

inf. (+acc) to reveal; to lay open; to make plain; to make evident; lit. to make spread out [uttāna + kātuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of uttānīkaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning to reveal; to lay open; to make plain; to make evident; lit. to make spread out
Construction uttāna > uttānī + kātuṃ
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (uttāna + kātuṃ)
Commentary (SNa) uttānīkātun'ti uttānakaṃ kātuṃ.
Sanskrit uttānīkṛ (to open wide)

sakkā evam'evaṃ viññāṇam'p'idaṃ ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññāpetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ iti'p'idaṃ viññāṇaṃ anattā'ti.

SN 35.234 udāyīsuttaṃ

na kho mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ khemakaṃ vihes'āpekhā pucchimha, api c'āyasmā khemako pahosi tassa bhagavato sāsanaṃ vitthārena ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññāpetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ.

taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

masc. water’s edge [udaka + anta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning water’s edge
Construction udaka + anta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + anta)
Commentary (MNa) udakantan'ti udakaṃ.
Sanskrit udaka + anta

sā harit'antaṃ vā panth'antaṃ vā sel'antaṃ vā udak'antaṃ vā ramaṇīyaṃ vā bhūmibhāgaṃ āgamma anāhārā nibbāyati. hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ kukkuṭapattena'pi nhārudaddulena'pi aggiṃ gavesanti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
udakantarāya

masc. danger posed by water ✗
udakapatta

masc. bowl of water [udaka + patta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bowl of water
Construction udaka + patta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + patta)
Variant udapatta
Sanskrit udaka + pātra

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ
udakapipāsā

Meaning thirst for water
Construction udaka + pipāsā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (udake + pipāsā)
Sanskrit udaka + pipāsā

yato kuto ce'pi naṃ puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto, kilanto tasito pipāsito. so taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ āgamma vineyya udakapipāsaṃ, vineyya ghammapariḷāhaṃ.

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ

vātavuṭṭhisamayo nāma bhikkhū sarajena vātena okiṇṇā honti, dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni kāye patitāni honti, vātavuṭṭhisamayo'ti nahāyitabbaṃ.

VIN 2.5.6.7 nahānasikkhāpadaṃ
udakabindu

nt. drop of water [udaka + bindu] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning drop of water
Construction udaka + bindu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + bindu)
Sanskrit udaka + bindu

tatrāssu me idaṃ, sāriputta, jegucchismiṃ hoti, so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, sato'va abhikkamāmi, sato'va paṭikkamāmi, yāva udakabindumhi'pi me dayā paccupaṭṭhitā hoti, m'āhaṃ khuddake pāṇe visamagate saṅghātaṃ āpādesin'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

sā udakabindūhi paggharanteh'eva aḍḍh'ullikhitehi kesehi vegena gantvā, tuvaṭaṃ kho, ayyaputta, āgaccheyyāsī'ti āha

DHPa 1.1.9 nandatthera vatthu
udakabubbuḷa

nt. water bubble [udaka + bubbuḷa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning water bubble
Construction udaka + bubbuḷa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + bubbuḷa)
Variant udakapupphuḷa
Sanskrit udaka + budbuda

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, thullaphusitake deve vassante udakabubbuḷaṃ khippaṃ'y'eva paṭivigacchati, na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, udakabubbuḷ'ūpamaṃ jīvitaṃ manussānaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ bahudukkhaṃ bah'upāyāsaṃ mantāyaṃ boddhabbaṃ, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ, caritabbaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, n'atthi jātassa amaraṇaṃ.

udakabhāra

masc. load of water [udaka + bhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning load of water
Construction udaka + bhāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (udakassa + bhāra)
Sanskrit udakabhāra

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko ritto tuccho ādhāre ṭhapito. atha puriso āgaccheyya udakabhāraṃ ādāya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso labhetha udakassa nikkhepanan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
udakamaṇika

masc. water jar; large clay water-pot [udaka + maṇika] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning water jar; large clay water-pot
Construction udaka + maṇika
Compound kammadhāraya (udaka + maṇika)
Commentary (MNa) udakamaṇikan'ti mahākucchikaṃ udakacāṭiṃ. (ANa) udakamaṇiko'ti samekhalā udakacāṭi.
Sanskrit udaka + maṇika

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko ādhāre ṭhapito pūro udakassa samatittiko kākapeyyo. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āvajjeyya, āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko ritto tuccho ādhāre ṭhapito. atha puriso āgaccheyya udakabhāraṃ ādāya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso labhetha udakassa nikkhepanan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

Sanskrit udaka + mallaka

AN 7.15 udakūpamāsuttaṃ
udakūpamāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 7.15 (AN7.15) ✗
udakūpassaṭṭha

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (ritually married by) pouring water (on the hands)
Construction udaka + upassaṭṭha
Commentary (ANa) udak'ūpassaṭṭhan'ti udakena upassaṭṭhaṃ pariccattaṃ. so hi yasmiṃ kule vayappattā dārikā atthi, gantvā tassa dvāre tiṭṭhati. kasmā ṭhitosī'ti vutte ahaṃ aṭṭhacattālīsa vassāni komārabrahmacariyaṃ cariṃ, taṃ sabbaṃ tumhākaṃ demi, tumhe mayhaṃ dārikaṃ dethā'ti vadati. te dārikaṃ ānetvā tassa hatthe udakaṃ pātetvā denti.

Commentary (MNa) udakorohakassā'ti divasassa tikkhattuṃ udakaṃ orohantassa.
Sanskrit udaka + avarohaka

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchābhūmakā kamaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā aggiparicārikā udak'orohakā soceyyāni paññapenti, tes'āhaṃ soceyyāni rocemī'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, udak'orohakassa udak'orohakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
udakorohakamatta

nt. mere fact of being a ritual bather [udakorohaka + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning mere fact of being a ritual bather
Construction udakorohaka + matta
Sanskrit udaka + avarohaka + mātra

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, udakorohakassa udakorohakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlikassa rukkhamūlikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, abbhokāsikassa abbhokāsikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
udakorohanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the practice of ritual bathing [udaka + orohana + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the practice of ritual bathing
Construction udaka + orohana + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (udakorohanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Commentary (MNa) pāto majjhanhike sāyan'ti divasassa tikkhattuṃ pāpaṃ pavāhessāmī'ti udak'orohan'ānuyogaṃ anuyutto viharāmī'ti dasseti
Sanskrit udaka + avarohaṇa + anuyoga + anuyukta

kesamassulocako'pi hoti kesamassulocan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ubbhaṭṭhako'pi hoti āsanappaṭikkhitto, ukkuṭiko'pi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānam'anuyutto, kaṇṭak'āpassayiko'pi hoti kaṇṭak'āpassaye seyyaṃ kappeti, sāyatatiyakam'pi udak'orohan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
udakorohanta

masc. bather; swimmer; lit. going down into water [udaka + orohanta] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, prp of udakaṃ orohati, comp
Meaning bather; swimmer; lit. going down into water
Construction udaka + orohanta
Compound comp verb (udakaṃ + orohanta)
Commentary (ANa) udak'orohantassā'ti udakaṃ otarantassa. (MNa) udak'orohante'ti udakaṃ orohante puggale.
Sanskrit udaka + avarohat

cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, bhayāni udak'orohantassa pāṭikaṅkhitabbāni. katamāni cattāri? ūmibhayaṃ, kumbhīlabhayaṃ, āvaṭṭabhayaṃ, susukābhayaṃ

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
udagga

adj. elated; enraptured; exulted; lit. up foremost [ud + agga] ✓

Grammar adj, from agga
Meaning elated; enraptured; exulted; lit. up foremost
Construction ud + agga
Sanskrit udagra

te pabbajitvā sugatassa sāsane,
bhāvetva bojjh'aṅgabalāni paṇḍitā,
udaggacittā sumanā kat'indriyā,
phusiṃsu nibbānapadaṃ asaṅkhatan'ti.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

yaṃ vat'āhaṃ aññesu samaṇabrāhmaṇesu okāsakammamattam'pi n'ālatthaṃ taṃ me idaṃ samaṇena gotamena okāsakammaṃ katan'ti. attamano pamudito udaggo pītisomanassajāto bhagavantaṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
udaggacitta

adj. with elated heart; with exulted mind; lit. up foremost mind [udagga + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with elated heart; with exulted mind; lit. up foremost mind
Construction udagga + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (udagga + citta)
Commentary (THa) udaggacittā'ti odagyapītiyā vasena udaggacittā alīnacittā.
Sanskrit udagra + citta

yadā bhagavā aññāsi brahmāyuṃ brāhmaṇaṃ kallacittaṃ muducittaṃ vinīvaraṇacittaṃ udaggacittaṃ pasannacittaṃ, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā taṃ pakāsesi, dukkhaṃ, samudayaṃ, nirodhaṃ, maggaṃ.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

te pabbajitvā sugatassa sāsane,
bhāvetva bojjh'aṅgabalāni paṇḍitā,
udaggacittā sumanā kat'indriyā,
phusiṃsu nibbānapadaṃ asaṅkhatan'ti.

bhisapupphaṃ'va saroruhaṃ vigayha,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

sobbhesu padaresu ca,

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
udapajjatha

imperf. appeared; arose [ud + √pad + ya + ttha] ✓

Grammar imperf, reflx 3rd sg of udapajjā, irreg form of udapajjattha, intrans
Meaning appeared; arose
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ud + a + pajja + ttha > udapajjatha
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Notes (THa) evaṃ yoniso manasikāro uppajji.
Sanskrit utpad
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

tato me manasīkāro,
yoniso udapajjatha,
ādīnavo pāturahu,
nibbidā samatiṭṭhatha.

SN 22.26 assādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva yasassa kulaputtassa tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti.

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ
udapānapanāḷiyatthika

adj. wanting an outlet pipe for a well; lit. water drinking tube wanting [udapāna + panāḷī + atthika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting an outlet pipe for a well; lit. water drinking tube wanting
Construction udapāna + panāḷī + [y] + atthika
Phonetic Change +y
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (udapānapanāḷiṃ + atthika)
Sanskrit udapāna + praṇāḍī, praṇālī + arthika

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso udapānapanāḷi'y'atthiko tiṇhaṃ kuṭhāriṃ ādāya vanaṃ paviseyya. so yaṃ yadeva rukkhaṃ kuṭhāripāsena ākoṭeyya tattha yāni tāni rukkhāni daḷhāni sāravantāni tāni kuṭhāripāsena ākoṭitāni kakkhaḷaṃ paṭinadanti, yāni pana tāni rukkhāni antopūtīni avassutāni kasambujātāni tāni kuṭhāripāsena ākoṭitāni daddaraṃ paṭinadanti.

tam'enaṃ mūle chindati, mūle chinditvā agge chindati, agge chinditvā anto suvisodhitaṃ visodheti, anto suvisodhitaṃ visodhetvā udapānapanāḷiṃ yojeti.

AN 8.10 kāraṇḍavasuttaṃ
udapānasutta

udabindunipātena,
udakumbho'pi pūrati,
bālo pūrati pāpassa,
thokaṃ thokam'pi ācinaṃ.

udabindu yathā'pi pokkhare,
padume vāri yathā na limpati,
evaṃ muni n'opalimpati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
udānenta

prp. (+acc) saying something inspirational; uttering; lit. causing to sigh; breath up [ud + √an + *e + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of udāneti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning saying something inspirational; uttering; lit. causing to sigh; breath up
Root Family ud √an
Root √an･1 *e (breath, blow)
Base √an + *e > āne (caus)
Construction ud + āne + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit udānayat
Sanskrit Root √an 1, 2, 6 (breathe)

assosuṃ kho sambahulā bhikkhū āyasmato bhaddiyassa kāḷīgodhāya puttassa araññagatassa'pi rukkhamūlagatassa'pi suññ'āgāragatassa'pi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānentassa, aho sukhaṃ, aho sukhan'ti!

UD20 bhaddiyasuttaṃ
udānesi

aor. (+acc) said something inspirational; uttered; lit. caused to sigh; breath up [ud + √an + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of udāneti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning said something inspirational; uttered; lit. caused to sigh; breath up
Root Family ud √an
Root √an･1 *e (breath, blow)
Base √an + *e > āne (caus)
Construction ud + āne + si
Sanskrit udāniṣus
Sanskrit Root √an 1, 2, 6 (breathe)

atha kho bhagavā etam'atthaṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi

UD 73 tatiya nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo anupubbena nāḷik'odanaparamatāya saṇṭhāsi. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo aparena samayena susallikhitagatto pāṇinā gattāni anumajjanto tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ
udāyittheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 247 (TH247) ✗
udāyibhadda

masc. name of a prince; Ajātasattu's son ✗
udāyivagga

masc. Chapter 3 of the Bojjhaṅgasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 5 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
udāyisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.30 (SN46.30) ✗
udāyī 1

masc. name of a monk; Kāḷudāyi; lit. rising [ud + √i + *a + *ī] ✓

Grammar masc, from udāya
Meaning name of a monk; Kāḷudāyi; lit. rising
Root Family ud √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction ud + √i > ay > āy + *a + *ī
udaya + *ī
Derivative taddhita (*ī)
Phonetic Change i > āy
Commentary (ANa) āyasmā udāyī'ti paṭisambhidāppatto kāḷ'udāyitthero.
Sanskrit udāyin (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

evaṃ vutte āyasmā udāyī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, hatthim'eva nu kho, bhante, mahantaṃ brahantaṃ kāy'upapannaṃ jano disvā evam'āha, nāgo vata, bho, nāgo'ti

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ
udāyī 2

masc. name of a monk; Paṇḍitaudāyi; lit. rising [ud + √i + *a + *ī] ✓

Grammar masc, from udāya
Meaning name of a monk; Paṇḍitaudāyi; lit. rising
Root Family ud √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction ud + √i > ay > āy + *a + *ī
udaya + *ī
Derivative taddhita (*ī)
Phonetic Change i > āy
Commentary (MNa) udāyī'ti paṇḍitaudāyitthero.
Sanskrit udāyin (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

atha kho pañcak'aṅgo thapati yen'āyasmā udāyī ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

pr. (+acc) brings up; quotes; cites; lit. carries up [ud + ā + √har + a + ti] ✓

Base √har + a > hara
Construction ud + ā + hara + ti
Sanskrit udāharati

tathā hi ayam'āyasmā na c'eva gambhīraṃ atthapadaṃ udāharati santaṃ paṇītaṃ atakk'āvacaraṃ nipuṇaṃ paṇḍitavedanīyaṃ.

udāhu

ind. or (second part of a question) ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning or (second part of a question)
Synonym athavā, va
Sanskrit utāro

kacci te, bhante, bhikkhū samma'd'eva aññaṃ byākaṃsu udāhu sant'etth'ekacce bhikkhū adhimānena aññaṃ byākaṃsū'ti?

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
udikkhati

pr. (+acc) sees; perceives; beholds; expects [ud + √ikkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning sees; perceives; beholds; expects
Root Family ud √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Base √ikkh + a > ikkha
Construction ud + ikkha + ti
Sanskrit udīkṣate
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

kiṃ te idha sārasammataṃ,
kuṇapapūramhi susānavaḍḍhane,
bhedanadhamme kaḷevare,
yaṃ disvā vimano udikkhasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
udikkhi

aor. (+acc) saw; looked up (at) [ud + √ikkh + i] ✓

Grammar aor of udikkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning saw; looked up (at)
Root Family ud √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Construction ud + √ikkh + i
Commentary (THa) gacchanto naṃ udikkhisan'ti nagaravīthiyaṃ gacchanto parissayapariharaṇatthaṃ vīthiṃ olokento taṃ naṭṭakiṃ olokesiṃ.
Sanskrit udīkṣate
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

piṇḍikāya paviṭṭho'haṃ,
gacchanto naṃ udikkhisaṃ,
alaṅ'kataṃ suvasanaṃ,
maccupāsaṃ'va oḍḍitaṃ.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
udumbara

masc. cluster fig; Ficus racemosa ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning cluster fig; Ficus racemosa
Notes Flower of the plant are sheathed within the fruits and these are not visible directly.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ficus_racemosa
Sanskrit uḍumbara

yo n'ājjhagamā bhavesu sāraṃ,
vicinaṃ puppham'iva udumbaresu,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

khandhabījaṃ nāma, assattho, nigrodho, pilakkho, udumbaro, kacchako, kapitthano, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi khandhe jāyanti, khandhe sañjāyanti, etaṃ khandhabījaṃ nāma.

VIN 2.5.2.1 bhūtagāmasikkhāpadaṃ
udumbarakaṭṭha

nt. cluster fig log; cluster fig tree timber [udumbara + kaṭṭha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning cluster fig log; cluster fig tree timber
Construction udumbara + kaṭṭha
udumbarakhādaka

masc. sqanderer; who wastes resources; lit. cluster fig eater [udumbara + khādaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sqanderer; who wastes resources; lit. cluster fig eater
Construction udumbara + khādaka
Commentary (ANa) udumbarakhādī'vā'ti yathā udumbarāni khāditu'kāmena pakke udumbararukkhe cālite ekappahāren'eva bahūni phalāni patanti, so khāditabbayuttakāni khāditvā itarāni bahutarāni pahāya gacchati, evam'evaṃ yo āyato vayaṃ bahutaraṃ katvā vippakiranto bhoge paribhuñjati, so udumbarakhādikaṃ'v'āyaṃ kulaputto bhoge khādatī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit uḍumbara + khādin

sac'āyaṃ, byagghapajja, kulaputto app'āyo samāno uḷāraṃ jīvikaṃ kappeti, tassa bhavanti vattāro, udumbarakhādakaṃ c'āyaṃ kulaputto bhoge khādatī'ti.

masc. sqanderer; who wastes resources; lit. cluster fig eater [udumbara + khādī] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sqanderer; who wastes resources; lit. cluster fig eater
Construction udumbara + khādī

Commentary (ANa) udumbarakhādī'vā'ti yathā udumbarāni khāditu'kāmena pakke udumbararukkhe cālite ekappahāren'eva bahūni phalāni patanti, so khāditabbayuttakāni khāditvā itarāni bahutarāni pahāya gacchati, evam'evaṃ yo āyato vayaṃ bahutaraṃ katvā vippakiranto bhoge paribhuñjati, so udumbarakhādikaṃ'v'āyaṃ kulaputto bhoge khādatī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit uḍumbara + khādin

sac'āyaṃ, byagghapajja, kulaputto appāyo samāno uḷāraṃ jīvikaṃ kappeti, tassa bhavanti vattāro, udumbarakhādī'v'āyaṃ kulaputto bhoge khādatī'ti.
