Construction ud + dāle + ana + ka
uddālana + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (KVa) uddālanakaṃ bhedanakasadisam'eva.
Sanskrit uddālana +
Sanskrit Root √dal √dṝ 1 (burst)

yo pana bhikkhu mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā tūl'onaddhaṃ kārāpeyya, uddālanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 88 tūlonaddhasikkhāpadaṃ
uddālitvā

abs. (+acc) having torn off; having ripped up [ud + √dal + *e + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of uddāleti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having torn off; having ripped up
Root Family ud √dal
Root √dal･8 *e (split, tear apart)
Base √dal + *e > dāle
Construction ud + dāle + itvā
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit uddal
Sanskrit Root √dal √dṝ 1 (burst)

upasaṅkamitvā kummaṃ kacchapaṃ paccupaṭṭhito ahosi, yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

kārāpeyyā'ti karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ. paṭilābhena uddāletvā pācittiyaṃ desetabbaṃ.

VIN 2.5.9.6 tūlonaddhasikkhāpadaṃ
uddiṭṭha 1

pp. (+instr) recited (by); explained (by); mentioned (by); lit. pointed up [ud + √dis + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uddisati (+instr)
Meaning recited (by); explained (by); mentioned (by); lit. pointed up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Antonym anuddiṭṭha
Sanskrit uddiṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

uddiṭṭhā kho āyasmanto cattāro pārājikā dhammā. yesaṃ bhikkhu aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā na labhati bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāsaṃ yathā pure, tathā pacchā, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA pārājikuddeso

ko nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṃkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṃ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṃ vibhajeyyā'ti?

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

Sanskrit uddiṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

tena kho pana samayena sabhiyassa paribbājakassa purāṇasālohitāya devatāya pañhā uddiṭṭhā honti, yo te, sabhiya, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā ime pañhe puṭṭho byākaroti tassa santike brahmacariyaṃ careyyāsī'ti.

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

suṇātu me bhante saṅgho? ajj'uposatho pannaraso, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho uposathaṃ kareyya, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyya.

sabbañ'jaho taṇhakkhaye vimutto,
sayaṃ abhiññāya kam'uddiseyyaṃ.

DHP 353 taṇhāvaggo

api nu tumhe, bhikkhave, evaṃ jānantā evaṃ passantā aññaṃ satthāraṃ uddiseyyāthā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso

Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.8) bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissā'ti bhikkhuss'atthāya, bhikkhuṃ ārammaṇaṃ karitvā, bhikkhuṃ acchādetu'kāmo. (VINa) ettha uddissā'ti apadissa ārabbha. yasmā pana yaṃ uddissa upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, taṃ tass'atthāya upakkhaṭaṃ nāma hoti.
Sanskrit uddiśya
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

tena kho pana samayena pukkusāti nāma kulaputto bhagavantaṃ uddissa saddhāya agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.

VIN PAT PC 72 vilekhanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu anvaddhamāsaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeyya, idān'eva kho ahaṃ jānāmi, ayam'pi kira dhammo sutt'āgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī'ti.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ

etāni pañca kammāni, chand'āharaṇ'ādīni pātimokkh'uddesato paṭhamaṃ kattabbatā, uposathassa uposathakammassa pubbakiccan'ti vuccati. pubbakiccānī'ti akkhātāni.

Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, uddesā no cāvetu'kāmo samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. yo eva vo uddeso so eva vo uddeso hotu.

DN 25 udumbarikasuttaṃ
uddesa 6

adj. destined for; lit. pointing up [ud + √dis + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from uddisati
Meaning destined for; lit. pointing up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit uddeśa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

so samaṇ'uddeso bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo, m'āvuso, samaṇ'uddesa evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya

VIN PAT PC 70 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ
uddesa 7

adj. intended for; designated for; lit. pointing up [ud + √dis + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from uddisati
Meaning intended for; designated for; lit. pointing up
Root Family ud √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (VIN 1.2.6) att'uddesan'ti attano atthāya. (VINa) att'uddesan'ti, mayhaṃ esā'ti evaṃ attā uddeso assā'ti att'uddesā, taṃ att'uddesaṃ.
Sanskrit uddeśa
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena assāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ satt'antarā

VIN PAT SA 6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena sassāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya, tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.

VIN PAT SA 7 vihārakārasikkhāpadaṃ
uddesa 8

masc. (gram) summary, indication, indicative pronoun [ud + √dis] ✗
uddesaka

Grammar masc, agent, in comps, from uddisati (+gen)

Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ud + √dis > des + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit uddeśaka
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

ujjhāpanakaṃ nāma upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ sen'āsanapaññāpakaṃ vā bhatt'uddesakaṃ vā yāgubhājakaṃ vā phalabhājakaṃ vā khajjabhājakaṃ vā appamattakavissajjakaṃ vā avaṇṇaṃ kattu'kāmo

VIN 2.5.2.3 ujjhāpanakasikkhāpadaṃ
uddesanta

prp. reciting; chanting [ud + √dis] ✗
uddesapariyāpanna

adj. included in the Pātimokkha recitation; contained in the Pātimokkha chanting [uddesa + pariyāpanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning included in the Pātimokkha recitation; contained in the Pātimokkha chanting
Construction uddesa + pariyāpanna
Compound sattamī tappurisa (uddese + pariyāpanna)
Commentary (VIN 1.2.12) uddesapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesū'ti pātimokkhapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu. (VINa) uddesapariyāpannesū'ti uddese pariyāpannesu antogadhesu. yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyyā'ti evaṃ saṅgahitattā anto pātimokkhassa vattamānesū'ti attho.
Sanskrit uddeśa + paryāpanna (bsk)

bhikkhu pan'eva dubbacajātiko hoti uddesapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti

uddesavibhaṅgasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 138 (MN138) ✗

Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.
uddosita

masc. shed, store [ud + ava + √sā] ✗
uddha

adj. upper; upwards; upright [ud + dha] ✓

Grammar adj, from ud
Meaning upper; upwards; upright
Construction ud + dha
Derivative taddhita (dha)
Antonym adho, ora
Sanskrit ud, ūrdhva

dasa'y'imāni, bhikkhave, saṃyojanāni. katamāni dasa? pañc'oram'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni, pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni.

AN 10.13 saṃyojanasuttaṃ

uddh'aggalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, uddh'aggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍal'āvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇ'āvaṭṭakajātāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

taṃ idh'eva kākā vā khādanti gijjhā vā khādanti kulalā vā khādanti sunakhā vā khādanti siṅgālā vā khādanti vividhā vā pāṇakajātā khādanti, yañ'ca khv'assa cittaṃ dīgharattaṃ saddhāparibhāvitaṃ ... taṃ uddhagāmi hoti visesagāmi.

uddhacca

nt. agitation; restlessness; distraction; excitement [ud + √dhar + ta + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from uddhata
Meaning agitation; restlessness; distraction; excitement

Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar + ta + ya
uddhata + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Antonym kosajja, anuddhacca
Commentary (ANa) uddhaccāya saṃvattatī'ti uddhatabhāvāya saṃvattati.
Notes CPD suggests √han PED suggests √dhar
Sanskrit auddhatya
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

evam'evaṃ kho, soṇa, accāraddhavīriyaṃ uddhaccāya saṃvattati, atisithilavīriyaṃ kosajjāya saṃvattati.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

kathābāhulle sati uddhaccaṃ, uddhatassa asaṃvaro, asaṃvutassa ārā cittaṃ samādhimhā

uddhaccakukkucca

Commentary (ANa) uddhaccañ'ca kukkuccañ'ca uddhaccakukkuccaṃ.
Sanskrit auddhatya + kaukṛtya

idh'āvuso, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno kāmacchando pahīno hoti, byāpādo pahīno hoti, thīnamiddhaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, vicikicchā pahīnā hoti

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahāya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto uddhaccakukkuccā cittaṃ parisodheti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

caṅgavāran'ti kho, bhikkhu, pañcann'etaṃ nīvaraṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmacchandanīvaraṇassa, byāpādanīvaraṇassa, thīnamiddhanīvaraṇassa, uddhaccakukkuccanīvaraṇassa, vicikicchānīvaraṇassa.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ
uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhita

adj. obsessed by restlessness and fidgetiness; consumed by agitation and edginess [uddhacca + kukkucca + pariyuṭṭhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obsessed by restlessness and fidgetiness; consumed by agitation and edginess
Construction uddhacca + kukkucca + pariyuṭṭhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (uddhaccakukkuccena + pariyuṭṭhita)
Sanskrit auddhatya + kaukṛtya + paryavasthita

uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati uddhaccakukkuccaparetena uppannassa ca uddhaccakukkuccassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti. so uddhaccakukkuccaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ katvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati avajjhāyati.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ

sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhito hoti, pariyuṭṭhitacitto'va hoti. sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhito hoti, pariyuṭṭhitacitto'va hoti. sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu idhalokacintāya pasuto hoti, pariyuṭṭhitacitto'va hoti.

uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati uddhaccakukkuccaparetena uppannassa ca uddhaccakukkuccassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti. so uddhaccakukkuccaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ katvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati avajjhāyati.

Commentary (SNa) uddhaccasahagato'ti idha bhikkhu chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasikaronto nisīdati. ath'assa cittaṃ uddhacce patati. so buddhadhammasaṅghaguṇe āvajjetvā cittaṃ hāsetvā tosetvā kammaniyaṃ katvā puna chandaṃ uppādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasi karoti. ath'assa puna cittaṃ uddhacce patati.
uddhaccasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.116 (AN6.116) ✗
uddhaṭa 1

pp. pulled out; removed; extracted [ud + √dhar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uddharati
Meaning pulled out; removed; extracted
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > ṭ
Antonym anuddhaṭa
Sanskrit uddhṛta
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

s'āhaṃ sugatassa sāvikā,
magg'aṭṭh'aṅgikayānayāyinī,
uddhaṭasallā anāsavā,
suññ'āgāragatā ramām'ahaṃ.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

nivāto nāma nīcamanatā nivātavuttitā, yāya samannāgato puggalo nihatamāno nihatadappo pādapuñchanakacoḷasadiso chinnavisāṇausabhasamo uddhaṭadāṭhasappasamo ca hutvā saṇho sakhilo sukhasambhāso hoti, ayaṃ nivāto.

KHPa 5 maṅgala suttavaṇṇanā
uddhaṭa 2

pp. raised, lifted [ud + √dhar] ✗
uddhaṭasalla

adj. who has pulled out the arrow; who has extracted the barb [uddhaṭa + salla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has pulled out the arrow; who has extracted the barb
Construction uddhaṭa + salla
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (uddhaṭa + sallaṃ)
Commentary (THIa) uddhaṭasallā'ti attano santānato samuddhaṭarāg'ādisallā.
Sanskrit uddhṛta + śalya

s'āhaṃ sugatassa sāvikā,
magg'aṭṭh'aṅgikayānayāyinī,
uddhaṭasallā anāsavā,
suññ'āgāragatā ramām'ahaṃ.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
uddhata 1

adj. arrogant; conceited; haughty; puffed up; overbearing; (comm) confused about what is right and wrong; lit. raised up [ud + √dhar + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, pp of uddharati
Meaning arrogant; conceited; haughty; puffed up; overbearing; (comm) confused about what is right and wrong; lit. raised up
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Antonym anuddhaṭa
Commentary (SNa) uddhatā'ti akappiye kappiyasaññitāya ca kappiye akappiyasaññitāya ca anavajje sāvajjasaññitāya ca sāvajje anavajjasaññitāya ca uddhaccapakatikā hutvā.
Sanskrit uddhata
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā assaddhā jīvik'atthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitā saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

ime pana dhammayog'amhā, dhammayog'amhā'ti uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā pākat'indriyā

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye uddhataṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo vīriyasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo pītisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
uddhataavūpasantacittasandosahetu

ind. due to the defilement of being agitated and having an unsettled mind [uddhata + avūpasantacitta + sandosahetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the defilement of being agitated and having an unsettled mind
Construction uddhata + avūpasantacitta + sandosahetu
Sanskrit uddhata + vyupaśānta + citta + saṃdosa + hetu

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā uddhatā avūpasantacittā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, uddhat'āvūpasantacittasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
uddhatasutta

nt. Udāna 32 (UD 32) ✗
uddhana

nt. blacksmith's fire; forge; oven; kiln; lit. placing up [ud + √dhā + ana] ~

Meaning blacksmith's fire; forge; oven; kiln; lit. placing up
Root Family ud √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction ud + √dhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (APt) kammār'uddhanaṃ kammārānaṃ uddhanaṃ, kammārānaṃ yathā ukkā'ti.
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)
uddhamadho

ind. above and below [uddhaṃ + adho] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning above and below
Construction uddhaṃ + adho
Compound dvanda (uddhaṃ ca adho ca)
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + adhaḥ

dukkhavepakkaṃ yadatthi kammaṃ,
uddham'adho tiriyaṃ v'āpi majjhe,
paribbājayitvā pariññacārī,
māyaṃ mānam'atho'pi lobhakodhaṃ,
pariyantam'akāsi nāmarūpaṃ,
taṃ paribbājakam'āhu pattipattan'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabb'attatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
uddhamadhotiriyaṃ

sandhi. above, below and across; in every direction ✗
uddhamāghātana

adj. after death ✗
uddhamāghātanika

adj. (doctrine of) post-mortem (consciousness) ✗
uddhampādaṃ

ind. upside down; with feet in the air [uddhaṃ + pādaṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning upside down; with feet in the air
Construction uddhaṃ + pādaṃ
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + pādam
uddhambhāgiya

adj. higher; upper; lit. connected to the upper part [uddhaṃ + bhāgiya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning higher; upper; lit. connected to the upper part
Construction uddhaṃ + bhāgiya
Compound kammadhāraya (uddhaṃ + bhāgiya)
Antonym oraṃbhāgiya
Variant uddhaṃbhāgiya
Commentary (SNa) uddhambhāgiyānī'ti uparikoṭṭhāsiyāni. (SNt) uddhaṃ vuccati catasso arūpadhātuyo, vuttanayena taṃ bhajantī'ti uddhambhāgiyāni, saṃyojanāni rūp'ārūparāgamān'uddhacc'āvijjā.
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + bhāgīya

katamāni pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni? rūparāgo, arūparāgo, māno, uddhaccaṃ, avijjā, imāni pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni.

AN 10.13 saṃyojanasuttaṃ
uddhambhāgiyasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.181 (SN45.181) ✗

uddhamma

masc. false doctrine [ud + √dhar] ✗
uddharaṇa

nt. lifting; removing; dragging out; pulling out; lit. carrying up [ud + √dhar + aṇa] ~

Grammar nt, act, from uddharati
Meaning lifting; removing; dragging out; pulling out; lit. carrying up
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Sanskrit uddharaṇa
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)
uddharati 1

pr. (+acc) pulls up; pulls out; lifts up; raises [ud + √dhar + a + ti] ✓

Meaning pulls up; pulls out; lifts up; raises
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Base √dhar + a > dhara
Construction ud + dhara + ti
Sanskrit uddharati
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

appamādaratā hotha,
sacittam'anurakkhatha,
duggā uddharatha-attānaṃ,
paṅke sanno'va kuñjaro.

DHP 327 nāgavaggo

atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ māluvālataṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷamattāni'pi.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ
uddharati 2

pr. (+acc) removes; takes away; packs up [ud + √dhar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning removes; takes away; packs up
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Base √dhar + a > dhara
Construction ud + dhara + ti
Commentary (VIN 2.5.2.5) taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyyā'ti na sayaṃ uddhareyya.
Sanskrit uddharati
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 14 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 15 dutiyasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
uddharati 3

pr. derives (a meaning), adduces [ud + √dhar] ✗
uddharati 4

pr. (of taxes) extracts; imposes [ud + √dhar] ✗

pr. (+acc) causes to remove; makes take away; causes to pack up [ud + √dhar + *āpe + ti] ✓

VIN PAT PC 14 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo

atha kho, bhante, sambahulā kumārakā vā kumārikā vā tamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā nikkhamitvā yena sā pokkharaṇī ten'upasaṅkameyyuṃ, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā taṃ kakkaṭakaṃ udakā uddharitvā thale patiṭṭhāpeyyuṃ.

Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)

tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante pacchime yāme, uddhaste aruṇe, nandimukhiyā rattiyā uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs

Commentary (ANa) uddhasto'ti upari dhaṃsito.
Sanskrit uddhvaṃsa
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sālo vā dhavo vā phandano vā tīhi māluvālatāhi uddhasto pariyonaddho anayaṃ āpajjati, byasanaṃ āpajjati, anayabyasanaṃ āpajjati.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
uddhaṃ 1

ind. above; up; on top [uddha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, prep, acc sg of uddha
Meaning above; up; on top
Construction uddha + aṃ
Antonym adho
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit ūrdhvam

mettañ'ca sabbalokasmi,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ,
uddhaṃ adho ca tiriyañ'ca,
asambādhaṃ averamasapattaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

dasa'y'imāni, bhikkhave, kasiṇ'āyatanāni. katamāni dasa? pathavīkasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
uddhaṃ 2

ind. (+abl) upwards (from) [uddha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, prep, acc sg of uddha (+abl)
Meaning upwards (from)
Construction uddha + aṃ
Antonym adho
Synonym upari
Commentary (VISM) uddhaṃ pādatalā'ti pādatalato upari.
Sanskrit ūrdhvam

tatra y'āssa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa, yañ'ca khv'assa tatra sappi vā telaṃ vā taṃ uddhaṃ gāmi assa.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati

Meaning after; afterwards
Construction uddha + aṃ

kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā idh'eva sabbavedayitāni anabhinanditāni sītībhavissantī'ti pajānāti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yāv'assa kāyo ṭhassati tāva naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā kāyassa bhedā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā na naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā'ti

vinicchaye ṭhatvā sayaṃ pamāya,
uddhaṃ sa lokasmiṃ vivādam'eti,
hitvāna sabbāni vinicchayāni,
na medhagaṃ kubbati jantu loke'ti.

uddhaṃgāmī

Meaning going upwards; going upstream
Construction uddhaṃ + gāmī
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (uddhaṃ + gāmī)
Antonym adhogāmī
Variant uddhagāmī
Commentary (VIN 2.5.3.8) uddhaṃgāminin'ti ujjavanikāya. (VINa) uddhaṃgāminin'ti uddhaṃ nadiyā paṭisotaṃ gacchantiṃ.
Sanskrit ūrdhvagāmin

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 28 nāvābhiruhanasikkhāpadaṃ

saṃvidahite saṃvidahitasaññī ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhati uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.3.8 nāvābhiruhanasikkhāpadaṃ
uddhaṃpāda

adj. going upwards; going upstream ✗

uddhaṃvirecana

nt. purgative; emetic; which induces vomiting; lit. purging up [uddhaṃ + virecana] ✓

Meaning purgative; emetic; which induces vomiting; lit. purging up

Sanskrit ūrdhvam + virecana

tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ adhovirecanaṃ añjanaṃ paccañjanaṃ natthukammaṃ. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
uddhaṃsara

adj. with a high voice; with a lofty voice; (comm) believing in purity of saṃsāra; lit. up sound [uddhaṃ + sara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a high voice; with a lofty voice; (comm) believing in purity of saṃsāra; lit. up sound
Construction uddhaṃ + sara
Compound kammadhāraya (uddhaṃ + sara)
Commentary (NIDD1) uddhaṃsarā suddhim'anutthunantī'ti. sant'eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhaṃsarāvādā. katame te samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhaṃsarāvādā? ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā accantasuddhikā, saṃsārasuddhikā, akiriyadiṭṭhikā, sassatavādā, ime te samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhaṃsarāvādā. te saṃsāre suddhiṃ visuddhiṃ parisuddhiṃ, muttiṃ vimuttiṃ parimuttiṃ thunanti vadanti kathenti bhaṇanti dīpayanti voharantī'ti
Sanskrit ūrdhvam + svara

tam'ūpanissāya jigucchitaṃ vā,
athavā'pi diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
uddhaṃsarā suddhim'anutthunanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
uddhaṃsota

adj. flowing upstream; going against the flow [uddhaṃ + sota] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning flowing upstream; going against the flow
Construction uddhaṃ + sota
Compound kammadhāraya (uddhaṃ + sota)
Commentary (DHPa) uddhaṃsoto'ti evarūpo bhikkhu avihesu nibbattitvā tato paṭṭhāya paṭisandhivasena akaniṭṭhaṃ gacchanto uddhaṃsoto'ti vuccati, t'ādiso vo upajjhāyo'ti attho.
Sanskrit ūrdhvasrotaḥ (bsk)

chandajāto anakkhāte,
manasā ca phuṭo siyā,
kāmesu ca appaṭibaddhacitto,
uddhaṃsoto'ti vuccati.

DHP 218 piyavaggo

no ce pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti, atha pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā uddhaṃsoto hoti akaniṭṭhagāmī.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ
uddhaṃsotoakaniṭṭhagāmī

adj. headed upstream to the highest deva realm [uddhaṃsoto + akaniṭṭhagāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning headed upstream to the highest deva realm
Construction uddhaṃsoto + akaniṭṭhagāmī
Commentary (DNa) uddhaṃsotoakaniṭṭhagāmī'ti ettha pana catukkaṃ veditabbaṃ. yo hi avihāto paṭṭhāya cattāro devaloke sodhetvā akaniṭṭhaṃ gantvā parinibbāyati, ayaṃ uddhaṃsoto akaniṭṭhagāmī nāma. yo avihāto dutiyaṃ vā tatiyaṃ vā catutthaṃ vā devalokaṃ gantvā parinibbāyati, ayaṃ uddhaṃsoto na akaniṭṭhagāmī nāma. yo kāmabhavato akaniṭṭhesu nibbattitvā parinibbāyati, ayaṃ na uddhaṃsoto akaniṭṭhagāmī nāma.
uddhāpavant

adj. with raised embankments; lit. dig up quality [ud + √vap + *a + vant] ~

Grammar adj, from uddhāpa
Meaning with raised embankments; lit. dig up quality
Root Family ud √vap
Root √vap･1 a (sow, shave)
Construction ud + √vap > vāp + *a + vant
uddhāpa + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change dv > ddh
a > ā
Variant uddāpavanta
Commentary (SNa) uddhāpavantan'ti āpato uggatattā uddhāpan'ti laddhavohārena pākāravatthunā samannāgataṃ.
Sanskrit udvāpa +
Sanskrit Root √vap 1 (strew)
uddhāra 1.1

masc. withdrawal, pulling out [ud + ā + √har] ✗
uddhāra 2.1

masc. derivation [ud + √dhar] ✗
uddhumāta

pp. swollen; bloated; inflated [ud + √dham + āya + ta] ~

Grammar pp of uddhumāyati, deno
Meaning swollen; bloated; inflated
Root Family ud √dham
Root √dham･1 āya (blow, sound)
Base √dham + a + āya > dhamāya > dhumāya (deno, irreg)
Construction ud + dhumāya + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit uddhmīta
Sanskrit Root √dhmā √dham 1, 2 (blow)
uddhumātaka

adj. (of a corpse) swollen; bloated; lit. blown up; inflated [ud + √dham + āya + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from uddhumāta, deno
Meaning (of a corpse) swollen; bloated; lit. blown up; inflated
Root Family ud √dham
Root √dham･1 āya (blow, sound)
Base √dham + a + āya > dhamāya > dhumāya (deno, irreg)
Construction ud + dhumāya + ta + ka
uddhumāta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (DNa) kammārabhastā viya vāyunā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā yath'ānukkamaṃ samuggatena sūnabhāvena uddhumātattā uddhumātaṃ, uddhumātam'eva uddhumātakaṃ. paṭikūlattā vā kucchitaṃ uddhumātan'ti uddhumātakaṃ.
Sanskrit vyādhmātaka
Sanskrit Root √dhmā √dham 1, 2 (blow)

puna caparaṃ bhikkhave bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ ek'āhamataṃ vā dvī'hamataṃ vā tī'hamataṃ vā uddhumātakaṃ vinīlakaṃ vipubbakajātaṃ

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
uddhumātakasaññā

fem. perception of a bloated (corpse) [uddhumātaka + saññā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning perception of a bloated (corpse)
Construction uddhumātaka + saññā
uddhumātakasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.61 (SN46.61) ✗
uddhumāyikā

fem. Indian bullfrog; Hoplobatrachus tigerinus; lit. blowing up; puffing up [ud + √dham + āya + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from uddhumāyati, deno
Meaning Indian bullfrog; Hoplobatrachus tigerinus; lit. blowing up; puffing up
Root Family ud √dham
Root √dham･1 āya (blow, sound)
Base √dham + a + āya > dhamāya > dhumāya (deno, irreg)
Construction ud + dhumāya + ikā
Derivative kita (ikā)
Commentary (MNa) uddhumāyikan'ti maṇḍūkaṃ.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoplobatrachus_tigerinus
Sanskrit Root √dhmā √dham 1, 2 (blow)

brāhmaṇo evam'āha, ukkhipa laṅgiṃ, abhikkhaṇa, sumedha, satthaṃ ādāyā'ti. abhikkhaṇanto sumedho satthaṃ ādāya addasa uddhumāyikaṃ. uddhumāyikā, bhadante'ti.

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā udrabheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ

Phonetic Change +r
i > ay
Variant undraya, udaya
Sanskrit udaya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā, amhākañ'c'ev'āyaṃ pabbajjā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.

akusalaṃ idaṃ kāyakammaṃ dukkh'udrayaṃ dukkhavipākan'ti?

unnati

fem. rising, elevation, increase ✗

pr. makes bend upwards; raises [ud + √nam] ✗

Antonym anunnaḷa

Commentary (THa) unnaḷassā'ti uggatatucchamānassa. (SNa) unnaḷā'ti uggatanaḷā, uṭṭhitatucchamānā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit unnata
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

unnaḷassa pamattassa,
bāhir'āsassa bhikkhuno,
sīlaṃ samādhi paññā ca,
pāripūriṃ na gacchati.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā

yañ'hi kiccaṃ apaviddhaṃ,
akiccaṃ pana kayirati,
unnaḷānaṃ pamattānaṃ,
tesaṃ vaḍḍhanti āsavā.

Phonetic Change d > n
a > ā
Antonym onāmeti
Commentary (MNa) na satthiṃ unnāmetī'ti gambhīre udake gacchanto viya na ūruṃ unnāmeti.
Sanskrit unnāmayati
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

so gacchanto na satthiṃ unnāmeti, na satthiṃ onāmeti, na satthiṃ sannāmeti, na satthiṃ vināmeti. gacchato kho pana tassa bhoto gotamassa adharakāyo'va iñjati, na ca kāyabalena gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

so antaragharaṃ pavisanto na kāyaṃ unnāmeti, na kāyaṃ onāmeti, na kāyaṃ sannāmeti, na kāyaṃ vināmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
upaka 1

masc. name of an arahant; lit. approaching [upa + √gam + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upagacchati
Meaning name of an arahant; lit. approaching
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam > ga > ka + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change g > k
Commentary (SNa) upako'tiādīni tesaṃ therānaṃ nāmāni.
Sanskrit upaga
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

upako palagaṇḍo ca,
pukkusāti ca te tayo,
bhaddiyo khaṇḍadevo ca,
bāhuraggi ca siṅgiyo.
te hitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
dibbayogaṃ upaccagun'ti.

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu asicammaṃ gahetvā, dhanukalāpaṃ sannayhitvā, add'āvalepanā upakāriyo pakkhandanti usūsu'pi khippamānesu, sattīsu'pi khippamānāsu, asīsu'pi vijjotalantesu.

Grammar pr, trans (+acc and +instr)
Meaning attacks (with); assaults (with); lit. goes towards
Root Family upa √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + a > kama
Construction upa + kama + ti
Commentary (MNa) upakkamantī'ti paharanti.
Sanskrit upakrāmati
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

te tattha kalahaviggahavivād'āpannā aññam'aññaṃ pāṇīhi'pi upakkamanti, leḍḍūhi'pi upakkamanti, daṇḍehi'pi upakkamanti, satthehi'pi upakkamanti. te tattha maraṇam'pi nigacchanti, maraṇamattam'pi dukkhaṃ.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
upakkamati 2

pr. (+acc) strives, undertakes, begins [upa + √kam] ✗
upakkamadhātu

fem. endeavour; activity; action; lit. effort state [upakkama + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning endeavour; activity; action; lit. effort state
Construction upakkama + dhātu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upakkamassa + dhātu)
Commentary (ANa) upakkamadhātū'ti upakkamasabhāvo. sabbaṃ cetaṃ tena ten'ākārena pavattassa vīriyass'eva nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit upakrama + dhātu

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, atthi ārabbhadhātu ... atthi nikkamadhātu ... atthi parakkamadhātu... atthi thāmadhātu... atthi ṭhitidhātu... atthi upakkamadhātū'ti? evaṃ, bho.

√ In Comps kilis or kkilis

Derivative kita (ta)

Sanskrit upa + kliṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kliś 4, 9 (distress)

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

rāg'upakkiliṭṭhaṃ vā, bhikkhave, cittaṃ na vimuccati, avijj'upakkiliṭṭhā vā paññā bhāvīyati. iti kho, bhikkhave, rāgavirāgā cetovimutti, avijjāvirāgā paññāvimuttī'ti.

upagamana 1

nt. approaching; going towards [upa + √gam + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from upagacchati
Meaning approaching; going towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit upagamana
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
upagamana 2

nt. undergoing, undertaking [upa + √gam] ✗
upagami

Grammar aor of upagacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning entered; lit. went towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + i
Sanskrit upagam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
upagamma 1

ger. (+acc) coming to; approaching [upa + √gam + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upagacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning coming to; approaching
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + ya
Phonetic Change y > m
Sanskrit upagamya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

supupphit'aggaṃ upagamma bhikkhuni,
ekā tuvaṃ tiṭṭhasi sālamūle,
na c'atthi te dutiyā vaṇṇadhātu,
bāle na tvaṃ bhāyasi dhuttakānan'ti.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ
upagamma 2

ger. (+acc) going (into); getting involved (in); lit. going towards [upa + √gam + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upagacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning going (into); getting involved (in); lit. going towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam + ya
Phonetic Change y > m
Sanskrit upagamya
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

yo hoti bhikkhu arahaṃ katāvī,
khīṇ'āsavo antimadehadhārī,
mānaṃ nu kho so upagamma bhikkhu,
ahaṃ vadāmī'ti'pi so vadeyya,
mamaṃ vadantī'ti'pi so vadeyyā'ti.

SN 1.25 arahantasuttaṃ
upagā

imperf. approached; arrived at [upa + √gam] ✗
upagāmī

adj. (+acc) going to; headed towards; experiencing; lit. going towards [upa + √gam + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from upagacchati (+acc)
Meaning going to; headed towards; experiencing; lit. going towards
Root Family upa √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + √gam > gām + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant upagāhī, upaga
Sanskrit upagāmin
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

ye keci kāmesu asaññatā janā,
avītarāgā idha kāmabhogino,
punappunaṃ jātijarā-upagāmi te,
taṇh'ādhipannā anusotagāmino.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ
upaghāta 1

masc. injury; damage; harm [upa + √ghaṭ + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upaghāteti
Meaning injury; damage; harm
Root Family upa √ghaṭ
Root √ghaṭ･8 *e (strike, kill)
Construction upa + √ghaṭ > ghāṭ + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ṭ > t
Antonym anupaghāta
Sanskrit upaghāta
Sanskrit Root √han √ghaṭ 1, 2, 8 (smite)

te bhikkhuṃ pañhaṃ vā puccheyyuṃ vādaṃ vā āropeyyuṃ akkoseyyuṃ paribhāseyyuṃ roseyyuṃ viroseyyuṃ hiṃseyyuṃ vihiṃseyyuṃ heṭheyyuṃ viheṭheyyuṃ ghāteyyuṃ upaghāteyyuṃ upaghātaṃ vā kareyyuṃ.

NIDD1 16 sāriputta sutta niddeso
upaghāta 2

masc. jolting, sudden jerk [upa + √ghaṭ] ✗
upaghāti

fem. hurting; damage ✗
upaghātikā

fem. hurting, injury; damage ✗

ṭ > t
Sanskrit upaghātin

khantī paramaṃ tapo titikkhā,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ vadanti buddhā,
na hi pabbajito para-upaghātī,
na samaṇo hoti paraṃ viheṭhayanto.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ

sāsaṅkaṃ nāma ārāme ārām'ūpacāre corānaṃ niviṭṭh'okāso dissati, bhutt'okāso dissati, ṭhit'okāso dissati, nisinn'okāso dissati, nipann'okāso dissati.

AN 10.72 kaṇṭakasuttaṃ
upacālā

fem. name of a nun; lit. daughter of Cāla [upa + cāla + ā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a nun; lit. daughter of Cāla
Construction upa + cāla + ā
upacāla + ā
Commentary (THIa) tassā nāmaggahaṇadivase cālā'ti nāmaṃ akaṃsu, tassā kaniṭṭhāya upacālā'ti, atha tassā kaniṭṭhāya sīsūpacālā'ti. imā tisso'pi dhammasenāpatissa kaniṭṭhabhaginiyo, imāsaṃ puttānam'pi tiṇṇaṃ idam'eva nāmaṃ. ye sandhāya theragāthāya, cāle upacāle sīsūpacāle'ti (theragā. 42) āgataṃ.
upacālātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 60 (THI60) ✗
upacālāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 5.7 (SN5.7) ✗
upacikā

fem. termite; white ant ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning termite; white ant
Sanskrit upadīka

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā uṭṭhaheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ

naṭṭhacīvaro nāma bhikkhussa cīvaraṃ agginā vā daḍḍhaṃ hoti, udakena vā vuḷhaṃ hoti, undūrehi vā upacikāhi vā khāyitaṃ hoti, paribhogajiṇṇaṃ vā hoti.

upaccagā 1

imperf. (+acc) passed by; escaped; went past [upa + ati + a + √gam + ā] ✓

Grammar imperf of upātigacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning passed by; escaped; went past
Root Family upa ati √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction upa + ati > aty > acc + a + √gam + ā
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
Commentary (SNa) mā upaccagā'ti mā atikkami.
Notes mā upaccagā "don't let it pass"
Sanskrit upa + atigam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

yāya devā manussā ca,
sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti,
nirayamhi samappitā.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10

yam'assa vādaṃ parihīnam'āhu,
apāhataṃ pañhavimaṃsakāse,
paridevati socati hīnavādo,
upaccagā man'ti anutthunāti.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

ubho saṅgam'upaccagā,
asokaṃ virajaṃ suddhaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 412 brāhmaṇavaggo

ke ca te ataruṃ paṅkaṃ,
maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ,
ke hitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
dibbayogaṃ upaccagun'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
upacchindati

pr. (+acc) severs; cuts off; breaks off; completely stops [upa + √chid + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning severs; cuts off; breaks off; completely stops
Root Family upa √chid
Root √chid･2 ṃa (cut, steal)
√ In Comps cchid
Base √chid + ṃa > chinda
Construction upa + chinda + ti
Commentary (VIN 1.1.3) tattha jīvit'indriyassa paveṇighaṭanaṃ upacchindanto uparodhento ca, jīvitindriyaṃ upacchindati uparodhetī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit ucchinatti
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

okkhittacakkhu na ca pādalolo,
jhān'ānuyutto bahujāgarassa,
upekkham'ārabbha samāhit'atto,
takk'āsayaṃ kukkucciya-upachinde.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

jīvitā voropeyyā'ti jīvit'indriyaṃ upacchindati uparodheti santatiṃ vikopeti.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
upacchinna

pp. cut off; terminated; destroyed; ended [upa + √chid + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upacchindati
Meaning cut off; terminated; destroyed; ended
Root Family upa √chid
Root √chid･2 ṃa (cut, steal)
√ In Comps cchid
Construction upa + √chid + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Commentary (VINa) cīvarāsā vā upacchinnā'ti, asukasmiṃ nāma kule cīvaraṃ labhissāmī'ti yā cīvar'āsā uppannā hoti, sā vā upacchinnā, etesam'pi hi karaṇapalibodhass'eva niṭṭhitattā niṭṭhitabhāvo veditabbo.
Sanskrit avacchinna, upacchinna (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √chid 7, 9 (cut off)

niṭṭhitacīvarasmin'ti bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā cīvar'āsā vā upacchinnā.

Sanskrit upacchṛṇaṭṭi
Sanskrit Root √chṛd 2 (spue, eject)

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, kukkuro jighacchādubbalyapareto goghātakasūnaṃ paccupaṭṭhito assa. tam'enaṃ dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ sunikkantaṃ nikkantaṃ nimmaṃsaṃ lohitamakkhitaṃ upacchubheyya.

ahesuṃ kho ye, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ pathavīgarahakā pathavījigucchakā ... te kāyassa bhedā pāṇ'upacchedā hīne kāye patiṭṭhitā ahesuṃ.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ? yaṃ tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvit'indriyass'upacchedo, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
upajānāti

pr. finds out (for oneself), ascertains; invents; knows by personal experience (+ accusative or genitive); (first) teaches [upa + √ñā] ✗
upajāyati

pr. is produced (in addition); appears; is (re)born [upa + √jan] ✗
upajīvati

pr. (+acc) lives (on); lives dependent (on); relies (on); lit. lives near [upa + √jīv + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning lives (on); lives dependent (on); relies (on); lit. lives near
Root Family upa √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Base √jīv + a > jīva
Construction upa + jīva + ti
Sanskrit upajīv
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

puttā vatthu manussānaṃ,
bhariyā ca paramo sakhā,
vuṭṭhiṃ bhūtā upajīvanti,
ye pāṇā pathavissitā'ti.

SN 1.54 vatthusuttaṃ

vuṭṭhi alasaṃ analasañ'ca,
mātā puttaṃ'va posati,
vuṭṭhiṃ bhūtā upajīvanti,
ye pāṇā pathavissitā'ti.

i > āy
Sanskrit upādhyāya
Sanskrit Root adhi√i 1, 2 (learn)

upajjhāyo maṃ avaca,
ito gacchāma sīvaka,
gāme me vasati kāyo,
araññaṃ me gato mano,
semānakopi gacchāmi,
n'atthi saṅgo vijānatan'ti.

TH 14 sivaka sāmaṇera gāthā

upajjhāyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ. sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.

VIN 4.1.15 upajjhāya vatta kathā
upajjhāyamatta

adj. (one) having the status of preceptor; like a preceptor ✗
upajjhāyamūlaka

adj. deriving from the preceptor ✗
upajjhāyalesa

masc. preceptor as a pretext [upajjhāya + lesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning preceptor as a pretext
Construction upajjhāya + lesa
Compound kammadhāraya (upajjhāya + lesa)
Commentary (VINa) upajjhāyaleso nāma itthan'nāmassa saddhivihāriko diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto. aññaṃ itthan'nāmassa saddhivihārikaṃ passitvā codeti, itthan'nāmassa saddhivihāriko mayā diṭṭho.
Sanskrit upādhyāya + leśa

kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.

VIN 1.2.9 dutiyaduṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
upajjhāyavevacana

nt. synonym for a preceptor [upajjhāya + vevacana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning synonym for a preceptor
Construction upajjhāya + vevacana
Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.
upajjhāyasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.56 (AN5.56) ✗
upajjhāyā

fem. preceptress (of a bhikkhunī); instructor ✗
upaññatta

pp. personally discovered; found out [upa + √ñā + *āpe + ta] ~

Grammar pp of upañāpeti, caus
Meaning personally discovered; found out
Root Family upa √ñā
Root √ñā･5 *āpe (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + āpe > ñāpe > ñape (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + ñape + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit upajñāta
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)
upaññāta

pp. found out, learnt, known [upa + √ñā] ✗
upaññātasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 2.5 (AN2.5) ✗
upaññāsi

aor. (+gen) found out by oneself (about); learned from experience (of); discovered for oneself (about); lit. learned [upa + √ñā + si] ✓

Grammar aor of upajānāti, intrans (+gen)
Meaning found out by oneself (about); learned from experience (of); discovered for oneself (about); lit. learned
Root Family upa √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Construction upa + √ñā + si
Sanskrit upajñā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

dvinn'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ upaññāsiṃ, yā ca asantuṭṭhitā kusalesu dhammesu, yā ca appaṭivānitā padhānasmiṃ.

AN 2.5 upaññātasuttaṃ
upaññissati

fut. (+acc) will explain; will teach [upa + √ñā + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of upajānāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning will explain; will teach
Root Family upa √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Construction upa + √ñā + issa + ti
Sanskrit upajñāsyati
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
dukkaraṃ durabhisambhavaṃ,
handa te naṃ pavakkhāmi,
santhambhassu daḷho bhava.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
khuradhār'ūpamo bhave,
jivhāya tālum'āhacca,
udare saññato siyā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
upaññissaṃ

fut. (+acc) I myself will explain; I will teach [upa + √ñā + issa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar fut, reflx 1st sg of upaññissati, trans (+acc)
Meaning I myself will explain; I will teach
Root Family upa √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Construction upa + √ñā + issa + aṃ
Sanskrit upajñāsyāmi
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
dukkaraṃ durabhisambhavaṃ,
handa te naṃ pavakkhāmi,
santhambhassu daḷho bhava.

mahāvaggo 11

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
khuradhār'ūpamo bhave,
jivhāya tālum'āhacca,
udare saññato siyā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
upaṭṭhapetabba

ptp. should be appointed; lit. to be caused to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + tabba] ~

Grammar ptp of upaṭṭhapeti, caus
Meaning should be appointed; lit. to be caused to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe > ṭhape (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + ṭhape + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
upaṭṭhapeti 1

pr. (+acc) applies; exerts; lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning applies; exerts; lit. causes to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe > ṭhape (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + ṭhape + ti
Phonetic Change ā > a
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

āneñjapaṭisaṃyuttāya ca pana kathāya kacchamānāya na sussūsati, na sotaṃ odahati, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapeti, na ca taṃ purisaṃ bhajati, na ca tena vittiṃ āpajjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

tassa sāvakā na sussūsanti, na sotaṃ odahanti, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapenti, vokkamma ca satthusāsanā vattanti.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhapeti 2

pr. (+acc) prepares; sets up; readies; lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning prepares; sets up; readies; lit. causes to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe > ṭhape (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + ṭhape + ti
Phonetic Change ā > a
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, rañño pasenadissa kosalassa sāvatthiyaṃ paṭivasantassa sākete kiñci'd'eva accāyikaṃ karaṇīyaṃ uppajjeyya. tassa antarā ca sāvatthiṃ antarā ca sāketaṃ satta rathavinītāni upaṭṭhapeyyuṃ.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhapeti 3

pr. (+acc) provides, procures, or waits on [upa + √ṭhā] ✗

abs. (+acc) having set up; having made sure is present; lit. having caused to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + tvā] ✓

Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā

Construction upa + ṭhape + tvā
Phonetic Change ā > a
Sanskrit upasthāpayitvā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

so pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

tato paṭinivattitvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

upasaṅkamitvā sabbasanthariṃ santh'āgāraṃ santharitvā āsanāni paññapetvā udakamaṇikaṃ upaṭṭhapetvā telappadīpaṃ āropetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.

abs. (+acc) having established, having set up, caused to attend, to be present [upa + √ṭhā] ✗

aor. (+acc) prepared; set up; readied; stationed; lit. caused to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + si] ✓

Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

etassa me antarā ca sāvatthiṃ antarā ca sāketaṃ satta rathavinītāni upaṭṭhapesuṃ.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

app'ekacce maṃ paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesuṃ, app'ekacce āsanaṃ paññapesuṃ, app'ekacce pād'odakaṃ upaṭṭhapesuṃ. api ca kho maṃ nāmena ca āvusovādena ca samudācaranti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
upaṭṭhahati 1

pr. remains present; persists; lit. stands near [upa + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning remains present; persists; lit. stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)

Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction upa + ṭhaha + ti
Sanskrit upatiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti, viditā saññā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti, viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti.

AN 4.41 samādhibhāvanāsuttaṃ
upaṭṭhahati 2

pr. (+acc) serves; provides (with); attends (to); lit. stands near [upa + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning serves; provides (with); attends (to); lit. stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction upa + ṭhaha + ti
Sanskrit upatiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti. tam'enaṃ so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upaṭṭhāpeyya. so upaṭṭhaheyya pubb'uṭṭhāyī pacchānipātī kiṃkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

aññena ca kevalinaṃ mah'esiṃ,
khīṇ'āsavaṃ kukkuccavūpasantaṃ,
annena pānena upaṭṭhahassu,
khettaṃ hi taṃ puññapekkhassa hotī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
upaṭṭhahati 3

pr. (+acc) nurses; looks after; cares for; lit. stands near [upa + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning nurses; looks after; cares for; lit. stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction upa + ṭhaha + ti
Sanskrit upatiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

sace āyasmato channassa n'atthi patirūpā upaṭṭhākā, ahaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ upaṭṭhahissāmi. mā āyasmā channo satthaṃ āharesi. yāpet'āyasmā channo, yāpentaṃ mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ icchāmā'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhahati 4

pr. (+acc) understands [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhahanta

prp. (+acc) presenting [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhahi 1

aor. (+acc) attended (to); served; waited on; lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning attended (to); served; waited on; lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > ṭhaha
Construction upa + ṭhaha + i
Commentary (MNa) padhānapahit'attaṃ upaṭṭhahiṃsū'ti padhān'atthāya pesitattabhāvaṃ vasanaṭṭhāne pariveṇasammajjanena pattacīvaraṃ gahetvā anubandhanena mukh'odakadantakaṭṭhadān'ādinā ca upaṭṭhahiṃsu.
Sanskrit upasthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi, bahukārā kho me pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū, ye maṃ padhānapahit'attaṃ upaṭṭhahiṃsu. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ pañcavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ deseyyan'ti.

DHPa 1.5.11 jambukatthera vatthu
upaṭṭhahi 3

aor. (+acc) cared for, nursed [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhahitvā

abs. having attended on [upa + √ṭhā] ✗

upaṭṭhaheti

pr. stands near, stands by; places oneself by; presents oneself; is present, appears; stands near in order to serve, serves, attends (+ accusative, occasionally + dative/genitive); tends; worships [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhāka 1

masc. attendant; assistant; lit. who stands near [upa + √ṭhā + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from upaṭṭhahati
Meaning attendant; assistant; lit. who stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Sanskrit upasthāyaka
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

kosambiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto sāmaṃ sen'āsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya anāmantetvā upaṭṭhāke anapaloketvā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ eko adutiyo cārikaṃ pakkāmi

SN 22.81 pālileyyasuttaṃ

etu kho āyasmā ānando! svāgataṃ āyasmato ānandassa bhagavato upaṭṭhākassa bhagavato santik'āvacarassa!

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

so na labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, na labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, na labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, na labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāka 3

masc. follower; devotee; supporter; lit. standing near [upa + √ṭhā + aka] ✓

Sanskrit upasthāyaka
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

tena kho pana samayena āyasmato sāriputtassa upaṭṭhākakulaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa santike dārakaṃ pāhesi, imaṃ dārakaṃ thero pabbājetū'ti.

VIN 4.1.41 rāhula vatthu
upaṭṭhākakula

nt. family of followers; family of devotees; supporting family [upaṭṭhāka + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning family of followers; family of devotees; supporting family
Construction upaṭṭhāka + kula
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upaṭṭhākāyaṃ + kula)
Sanskrit upasthāyaka + kula

tena kho pana samayena āyasmato sāriputtassa upaṭṭhākakulaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa santike dārakaṃ pāhesi, imaṃ dārakaṃ thero pabbājetū'ti.

VIN 4.1.41 rāhula vatthu
upaṭṭhākatara

masc. better attendant; better assistant [upa + √ṭhā + aka + tara] ~

Grammar masc, agent, compar of upaṭṭhāka
Meaning better attendant; better assistant
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + aka + tara
upaṭṭhāka + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Sanskrit upasthāyaka +
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
upaṭṭhātabba

ptp. should be attended to; should be nursed; lit. to be stood near [upa + √ṭhā + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of upaṭṭhāti
Meaning should be attended to; should be nursed; lit. to be stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Sanskrit upasthātavya
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

imaṃ kho, bhikkhave, gilānaṃ paṭicca gilānabhattaṃ anuññātaṃ gilānabhesajjaṃ anuññātaṃ gilān'upaṭṭhāko anuññāto. imañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, gilānaṃ paṭicca aññe'pi gilānā upaṭṭhātabbā.

AN 3.22 gilānasuttaṃ

Construction upa + ṭhā + ti
Sanskrit upasthāti
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

tassa taṃ vanapatthaṃ upanissāya viharato anupaṭṭhitā c'eva sati na upaṭṭhāti, asamāhitañ'ca cittaṃ na samādhiyati, aparikkhīṇā ca āsavā na parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, ananuppattañ'ca anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ n'ānupāpuṇāti.

Sanskrit upasthānaśālā

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ sannisinnā sannipatitā anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ anuyuttā viharanti

AN 10.69 paṭhamakathāvatthusuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā visākho pañcālaputto upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti

upaṭṭhānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 9.2 (SN9.2) ✗
upaṭṭhāpana

kudāssu nām'āhaṃ tadāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharissāmi yadariyā eta'r'ahi āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharantī'ti iti anuttaresu vimokkhesu pihaṃ upaṭṭhāpayato uppajjati pihapaccayā domanassaṃ.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

sabbasanthariṃ santhataṃ, bhante, santh'āgāraṃ, āsanāni paññattāni, udakamaṇiko upaṭṭhāpito, telappadīpo āropito. yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṃ maññatī'ti.

kālena vakkhāmi no akālena, bhūtena vakkhāmi no abhūtena, saṇhena vakkhāmi no pharusena, atthasaṃhitena vakkhāmi no anatthasaṃhitena, mettacitto vakkhāmi, no dos'antaro'ti, ime pañca dhammā ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbā

atha kho āyasmato sāriputtassa etadahosi, bhagavatā paññattaṃ, na ekena dve sāmaṇerā upaṭṭhāpetabbā'ti.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

Variant upaṭṭhapeti

Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ cittaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṃ, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā sabrahmacārīsu mettaṃ cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpehī'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro.

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

āneñjapaṭisaṃyuttāya ca pana kathāya kacchamānāya na sussūsati, na sotaṃ odahati, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na ca taṃ purisaṃ bhajati, na ca tena vittiṃ āpajjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

Construction upa + ṭhāpe + ti
Variant upaṭṭhapeti
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sallena viddho assa savisena gāḷh'ūpalepanena. tassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā bhisakkaṃ sallakattaṃ upaṭṭhāpeyyuṃ.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

tassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā bhisakkaṃ sallakattaṃ upaṭṭhāpeyyuṃ.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

Construction upa + ṭhāpe + ti
Variant upaṭṭhapeti
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

rūpānaṃ tv'eva aniccataṃ viditvā vipariṇāmavirāganirodhaṃ, pubbe c'eva rūpā eta'r'ahi ca sabbe te rūpā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā anuttaresu vimokkhesu pihaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

so tasmiṃ purise kāruññaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anuddayaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anukampaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, aho vat'āyaṃ puriso labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ!

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpeti 5

pr. (+acc) makes serve; appoints as attendant; lit. causes to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upaṭṭhahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes serve; appoints as attendant; lit. causes to stand near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 *āpe (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + āpe > ṭhāpe (caus)
Construction upa + ṭhāpe + ti
Variant upaṭṭhapeti
Commentary (VIN 2.5.7.10) upaṭṭhāpeyya vā'ti tassa cuṇṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā dantakaṭṭhaṃ vā mukh'odakaṃ vā sādiyati (VINa) upaṭṭhāpeyyā'ti tena attano upaṭṭhānaṃ kārāpeyya.
Sanskrit upasthāpayati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti. tam'enaṃ so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upaṭṭhāpeyya. so upaṭṭhaheyya pubb'uṭṭhāyī pacchānipātī kiṃkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ tathānāsitaṃ samaṇ'uddesaṃ upalāpeyya vā, upaṭṭhāpeyya vā, sambhuñjeyya vā, saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 70 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ
upaṭṭhāpetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to set up; to establish; to make sure is present; lit. to cause to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + tuṃ] ✓

Construction upa + ṭhāpe + tuṃ
Sanskrit upasthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

cha, bhikkhave, ānisaṃse sampassamānena alam'eva bhikkhunā sabbasaṅkhāresu anodhiṃ karitvā aniccasaññaṃ upaṭṭhāpetuṃ. katame cha?

AN 6.102 anavatthitasuttaṃ

Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

na kho, ānanda, sukaraṃ paresaṃ dhammaṃ desetuṃ. paresaṃ, ānanda, dhammaṃ desentena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo. katame pañca?

AN 5.159 udāyīsuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāpesi

aor. (+acc) supplied; provided; furnished (with); lit. caused to stand near [upa + √ṭhā + *āpe + si] ✓

Construction upa + ṭhāpe + si
Sanskrit upasthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa tayo pāsāde kārāpesi, ekaṃ vassikaṃ ekaṃ hem'antikaṃ ekaṃ gimhikaṃ, pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi

DN 14.4 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo bhagavantaṃ paccuggantvā, eko bhagavato pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi, eko āsanaṃ paññapesi, eko pād'odakaṃ upaṭṭhāpesi.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāsi 1

aor. (+acc) took a stand (on); was established (in); lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + si] ✓

Grammar aor of upatiṭṭhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning took a stand (on); was established (in); lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + si
Sanskrit upasthā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tam'ahaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ. taṃ tathāgatassa viditaṃ, taṃ tathāgato na upaṭṭhāsi.

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhāsi 2

aor. attended; served; waited on [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhāsi 3

aor. (+acc) looked after; cared for; nursed [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhita 1

pp. present; in attendance; available; lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of upaṭṭhāti
Meaning present; in attendance; available; lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym muṭṭha, anupaṭṭhita
Sanskrit upasthita
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

sati kāyagatā upaṭṭhitā,
chasu phass'āyatanesu saṃvuto,
satataṃ bhikkhu samāhito,
jaññā nibbānam'attano'ti.

UD 25 mahāmoggallānasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, saṃvaro hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe n'ādhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhita 2

pp. arrived; present; standing near; lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of upaṭṭhāti
Meaning arrived; present; standing near; lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym anupaṭṭhita
Sanskrit upasthita
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

yo brāhmaṇaṃ samaṇaṃ vā,
bhattakāle upaṭṭhite,
roseti vācā na ca deti,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

na saṅkittīsu na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti na yattha makkhikā saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṃ na maṃsaṃ na suraṃ na merayaṃ na thus'odakaṃ pivanti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhita 3

pp. stuck to; devoted to; applied oneself to; lit. stood near [upa + √ṭhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of upaṭṭhāti
Meaning stuck to; devoted to; applied oneself to; lit. stood near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction upa + √ṭhā + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym anupaṭṭhita
Notes upaṭṭhitāse is masc nom pl
Sanskrit upasthita
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

sīl'uttamā saññamen'āhu suddhiṃ,
vataṃ samādāya upaṭṭhitāse,
idh'eva sikkhema ath'assa suddhiṃ,
bhavūpanītā kusalā vadānā.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13

sa piṇḍacāraṃ caritvā,
vanantam'abhihāraye,
upaṭṭhito rukkhamūlasmiṃ,
āsan'ūpagato muni.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
upaṭṭhitakāyasati

adj. with body awareness present; attending mindfully to the body [upaṭṭhita + kāyasati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with body awareness present; attending mindfully to the body
Construction upaṭṭhita + kāyasati
Compound kammadhāraya (upaṭṭhita + kāyasati)
Variant upaṭṭhitakāyassati
Sanskrit upasthita + kāya + smṛti

so cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe na sārajjati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyasati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso. tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, yatth'assa te pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitakāyassati

adj. with body awareness present; attending mindfully to the body [upaṭṭhita + kāyasati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with body awareness present; attending mindfully to the body
Construction upaṭṭhita + kāyasati
Compound kammadhāraya (upaṭṭhita + kāyasati)
Variant upaṭṭhitakāyasati
Sanskrit upasthita + kāya + smṛti

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe n'ādhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitasati

adj. with presence of mind; attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully [upaṭṭhita + sati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with presence of mind; attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully
Construction upaṭṭhita + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (upaṭṭhita + sati)
Antonym muṭṭhasati
Variant upaṭṭhitassati
Sanskrit upasthita + smṛti

upaṭṭhitasatissa-ayaṃ dhammo n'āyaṃ dhammo muṭṭhasatissa

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

saddhassa hi, bhante, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa upaṭṭhitassatino etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ vossagg'ārammaṇaṃ karitvā labhissati samādhiṃ, labhissati cittassa ekaggataṃ.

SN 48.50 āpaṇasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitassati

adj. with presence of mind; attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully [upaṭṭhita + sati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with presence of mind; attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully
Construction upaṭṭhita + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (upaṭṭhita + sati)
Antonym muṭṭhassati
Variant upaṭṭhitasati
Sanskrit upasthita + smṛti

tasmā hi dhīro idh'upaṭṭhitassatī,
kāme ca pāpe ca asevamāno,
sahā'pi dukkhena jaheyya kāme,
paṭisotagāmī'ti tam'āhu puggalaṃ.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ

ye pana te kulaputtā ... āraddhavīriyā pahit'attā upaṭṭhitassatino sampajānā samāhitā ekaggacittā paññavanto aneḷamūgā, tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitassatitā

fem. fact of having presence of mind; state of attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully state [upaṭṭhita + sati + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from upaṭṭhitassati
Meaning fact of having presence of mind; state of attending mindfully; lit. standing near mindfully state
Construction upaṭṭhita + sati + tā
upaṭṭhitassati + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit upasthita + smṛtitā

etam'ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, upaṭṭhitassatitaṃ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomam'āpādiṃ araññe vihārāya.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

kusītassa purisapuggalassa vīriyārambho hoti parikkamanāya, muṭṭhassatissa purisapuggalassa upaṭṭhitassatitā hoti parikkamanāya, duppaññassa purisapuggalassa paññāsampadā hoti parikkamanāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
upaṭṭhitassatisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.23 (SN37.23) ✗
upaṭṭheti 1

pr. stands near, stands by; places oneself by [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭheti 2

pr. presents oneself; is present, appears [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭheti 3

pr. stands near in order to serve, serves, attends; tends; worships [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaṭṭhenta

prp. standing near, standing by; placing oneself by; presenting oneself; being present, appearing; standing near in order to serve, serving, attending (+ accusative, occasionally + dative/genitive); tending; worshipping [upa + √ṭhā] ✗
upaḍḍha 1

adj. half [upa + aḍḍha] ✓

Grammar adj, from aḍḍha
Meaning half
Construction upa + aḍḍha
Synonym addha, aḍḍha
Sanskrit upārdha

ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ekaṃ vā rattiṃ ekaṃ vā divasaṃ upaḍḍhaṃ vā rattiṃ upaḍḍhaṃ vā divasaṃ ek'antasukhiṃ attānaṃ sañjānāthā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo
upaḍḍha 2

nt. one half; half [upa + aḍḍha] ✓

Grammar nt, from aḍḍha
Meaning one half; half
Construction upa + aḍḍha
Sanskrit upārdha

tena hi, bhaṇe, yo bāhiresu janapadesu āyo sañjāyati tato upaḍḍhaṃ antepure pavesetha, upaḍḍhaṃ tatth'eva dānaṃ detha samaṇa-brāhmaṇa-kapaṇ'addhika-vanibbaka-yācakānan'ti.

SN 2.23 serīsuttaṃ
upaḍḍhakāya

masc. one half of the body [upaḍḍha + kāya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning one half of the body
Construction upaḍḍha + kāya
Commentary (SNa) heṭṭhimena upaḍḍhakāyenā'ti nābhito paṭṭhāya heṭṭhimakāyena.

adj. half-roofed; partially covered [upaḍḍha + channa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning half-roofed; partially covered
Construction upaḍḍha + channa
Commentary (VINt) yassa dvīsu bhāgesu eko channo, eko acchanno, idaṃ upaḍḍhacchannaṃ nāma sen'āsanaṃ.
upaḍḍhadivasaṃ

ind. for half a day [upaḍḍha + divasa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for half a day
Construction upaḍḍha + divasa + aṃ
upaḍḍhadivasa + aṃ
Compound abyayībhāva (upaḍḍha + divasaṃ)
Sanskrit upārdha + divasa

yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin'ti? idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti, aho vat'āhaṃ upaḍḍhadivasaṃ jīveyyaṃ, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā'ti. evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin'ti.

AN 8.73 paṭhamamaraṇassatisuttaṃ
upaḍḍhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.2 (SN45.2) ✗
upaḍḍhullikhita

adj. half combed, half dressed ✗
upatiṭṭhati

pr. (+acc) stands around; stands next to; lit. stands near [upa + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning stands around; stands next to; lit. stands near
Root Family upa √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction upa + tiṭṭha + ti
Phonetic Change t > ṭ
Sanskrit upatiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati. tiṭṭhati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭhati. nisīdati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanisīdati. nipajjati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanipajjati.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭheyyuṃ, upanisīdeyyuṃ, upanipajjeyyuṃ.

Sanskrit upasthītvā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
upatissa

masc. name of Sāriputta; lit. son of Tissa [upa + tissa] ✓

Grammar masc, patr
Meaning name of Sāriputta; lit. son of Tissa
Construction upa + tissa
Sanskrit upatiṣya

evaṃ vutte, āyasmā puṇṇo mantāṇiputto āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca, ko nāmo āyasmā, kathañ'ca pan'āyasmantaṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti? upatisso'ti kho me, āvuso, nāmaṃ, sāriputto'ti ca pana maṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
upatissasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 21.2 (SN21.2) ✗
upatthaddha 1

pp. (+instr) supported (by); helped (by); lit. stiff [upa + √thambh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upatthambhati (+instr)
Meaning supported (by); helped (by); lit. stiff
Root Family upa √thambh
Root √thambh･1 a (support, be stiff)
√ In Comps tthambh
Construction upa + √thambh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change bht > ddh
Sanskrit upastabdha
Sanskrit Root √ṣṭabh √stabh √ṣṭambh √stambh 1, 5, 9 (prop)

yo vejayantaṃ pāsādaṃ,
pād'aṅguṭṭhena kampayi,
iddhibalen'upatthaddho,
saṃvejesi ca devatā.

pr. makes firm, supports, props up, sustains [upa + √thambh] ✗

Commentary (VINa) upadahantī'ti uppādenti.

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadaheyya iti'ssa muhuttam'pi aphāsu bhavissatī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 77 sañciccasikkhāpadaṃ

yadapi luddho lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto parassa asatā dukkhaṃ upadahati.

so antaraghare nisinno samāno na hatthakukkuccaṃ āpajjati, na pādakukkuccaṃ āpajjati, na adduvena adduvaṃ āropetvā nisīdati, na ca gopphakena gopphakaṃ āropetvā nisīdati, na ca pāṇinā hanukaṃ upadahitvā nisīdati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

Construction upa + daṃse + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Sanskrit upadṛś
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

thāmavā hoti yāva jīvitamaraṇapariyādānā thāmaṃ upadaṃsetā.

pr. (+acc) shows; manifests; exhibits; displays [upa + √dis + *e + ti] ✓

Meaning shows; manifests; exhibits; displays

Root √dis･1 *e (see)

Construction upa + daṃse + ti
Variant upadasseti
Sanskrit upadarśayati
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

rasañ'ca bhotvāna asāditañ'ca sāduṃ,
atho'pi bhotvāna asādum'ekadā,
sāduṃ rasaṃ n'ājjhosāya bhuñje,
virodham'āsādusu na-upadaṃsaye.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

ananuvicca apariyogāhetvā appasādanīye ṭhāne pasādaṃ upadaṃseti ananuvicca apariyogāhetvā pasādanīye ṭhāne appasādaṃ upadaṃseti

upadaṃsetuṃ

inf. to show; to exhibit; to display [upa + √dis] ✗
upadisati

pr. (+acc) points out; explains; shows; indicates [upa + √dis + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)

Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Base √dis + a > disa
Construction upa + disa + ti
Sanskrit upadiśati
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
upadisi

aor. pointed out, advised, showed [upa + √dis] ✗
upadissati

pr. (+loc) is seen (among); is discovered (around); is found (among) [upa + √dis + ya + ti] ✓

Meaning is seen (among); is discovered (around); is found (among)

Construction upa + dissa + ti

Sanskrit upadṛś
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

ajjhāyakakule jātā,
brāhmaṇā mantabandhavā,
te ca pāpesu kammesu,
abhiṇham'upadissare.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
upadussati

pr. (+loc) begrudges; resents [upa + √dus + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning begrudges; resents
Root Family upa √dus
Root √dus･3 ya (hate, dislike)
Base √dus + ya > dussa
Construction upa + dussa + ti
Phonetic Change y > s
Commentary (MNa) upadussatī'ti issāvasen'eva upakkosanto dussati.
Sanskrit upa + dveṣṭi
Sanskrit Root √dviṣ 2, 6 (hate)

issāmanikā kho pana hoti, para-lābha-sakkāra-garukāra-mānana-vandana-pūjanāsu issati upadussati issaṃ bandhati.

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
upadussi

aor. (+loc) begrudged; resented [upa + √dus + ya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upadussati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning begrudged; resented
Root Family upa √dus
Root √dus･3 ya (hate, dislike)
Base √dus + ya > dussa
Construction upa + dussa + i
Phonetic Change y > s
Sanskrit upa + dvikṣat
Sanskrit Root √dviṣ 2, 6 (hate)

yā nūn'āhaṃ, bhante, aññaṃ jātiṃ anissāmanikā ahosiṃ, para-lābha-sakkāra-garukāra-mānana-vandana-pūjanāsu na issiṃ na upadussiṃ na issaṃ bandhiṃ, s'āhaṃ, bhante, etarahi mahesakkhā.

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
upaddava 1

masc. accident; misfortune; calamity [upa + √du + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning accident; misfortune; calamity
Root Family upa √du
Root √du･1 a (burn, torment)
√ In Comps ddu
Construction upa + √du > dav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Antonym anupaddava, nirupaddava
Sanskrit upadrava
Sanskrit Root √du √dru √drū 5 (hurt)

kiṃ'su tassa mahabbhayan'ti kiṃ lokassa bhayaṃ mahabbhayaṃ pīḷanaṃ ghaṭṭanaṃ upaddavo upasaggoti, kiṃ'su tassa mahabbhayaṃ.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa
upaddava 2

masc. risk [upa + √du] ✗
upadduta

pp. (+instr) afflicted (by); troubled (by); persecuted (by); oppressed (by); tyrannized (by) [upa + √du + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upaddaveti (+instr)
Meaning afflicted (by); troubled (by); persecuted (by); oppressed (by); tyrannized (by)
Root Family upa √du
Root √du･1 a (burn, torment)
√ In Comps ddu
Construction upa + √du + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Commentary (THa) maccujarāy'upaddutan'ti maraṇena c'eva jarāya ca pīḷitaṃ
Sanskrit upadruta
Sanskrit Root √du √dru √drū 5 (hurt)

kadā aniccaṃ vadharoganīḷaṃ,
kāyaṃ imaṃ maccujarāy'upaddutaṃ,
vipassamāno vītabhayo vihassaṃ,
eko vane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

nagā samuddā saritā vasun'dharā,
disā catasso vidisā adho divā,
sabbe aniccā tibhavā upaddutā,
kuhiṃ gato citta sukhaṃ ramissasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)

Commentary (MNa) upadhāyā'ti yathā sīs'ūpadhānañ'ca pād'ūpadhānañ'ca paññāyati, evaṃ santharitvā tattha seyyaṃ kappemī'ti dasseti.
Sanskrit upadhāna
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, susāne seyyaṃ kappemi chav'aṭṭhikāni upadhāya. apissu maṃ, sāriputta, gāmaṇḍalā upasaṅkamitvā oṭṭhubhanti'pi, omuttenti'pi, paṃsukena'pi okiranti, kaṇṇasotesu'pi salākaṃ pavesenti.

verā so na parimuccati.

tass'eva kho pana pubbe aviddasuno upadhī honti samattā samādinnā. ty'āssa pahīnā honti ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
upanāyika 1

adj. entering; approaching; leading to; lit. related to leading near [upa + √nī + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from upanaya
Meaning entering; approaching; leading to; lit. related to leading near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī > nay + *a + *ika
upanaya + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Sanskrit upanāyika
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

te upakaṭṭhāya vassa-upanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
upanāyika 2

adj. relating to; referring to; regarding; applying to; lit. related to leading near [upa + √nī + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from upānaya
Meaning relating to; referring to; regarding; applying to; lit. related to leading near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī > nay > nāy + *a + *ika
upanaya + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Sanskrit upanāyika
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

yo pana bhikkhu anabhijānaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ att'upanāyikaṃ alam'ariyañāṇadassanaṃ samudācareyya iti jānāmi, iti passāmī'ti

VIN PAT PA 4 uttarimanussadhammasikkhāpadaṃ
upanāha

masc. resentment; bearing a grudge; harbouring enmity; rancour; lit. binding onto [upa + √nah + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upanayhati
Meaning resentment; bearing a grudge; harbouring enmity; rancour; lit. binding onto
Root Family upa √nah
Root √nah･3 ya (bind, arm)
Construction upa + √nah > nāh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anupanāha
Commentary (MNa) upanandhanalakkhaṇo upanāho, vera appaṭinissajjanaraso, kodh'ānupabandhabhāvapaccupaṭṭhāno. vuttañ'c'etaṃ, pubbakāle kodho, aparakāle upanāho'tiādi
Sanskrit upanāha
Sanskrit Root √nah 4 (tie)

upanāho cittassa upakkileso'ti, iti viditvā upanāhaṃ cittassa upakkilesaṃ pajahati.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

upanāhissa upanāho appahīno hoti, makkhissa makkho appahīno hoti, paḷāsissa paḷāso appahīno hoti, issukissa issā appahīnā hoti, maccharissa macchariyaṃ appahīnaṃ hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
upanāhapariyuṭṭhāna

nt. being obsessed by a grudge; being consumed by resentment [upanāha + pariyuṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning being obsessed by a grudge; being consumed by resentment
Construction upanāha + pariyuṭṭhāna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upanāhena + pariyuṭṭhāna)
Sanskrit upanāha + paryavasthāna

upanāhī kho pana ayam'āyasmā, upanāhapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharati. upanāhapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānam'etaṃ.

AN 10.84 byākaraṇasuttaṃ

Sanskrit Root √nah 4 (tie)

kodhano upanāhī ca,
pāpamakkhī ca yo naro,
vipannadiṭṭhi māyāvī,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

√ In Comps kkam

Construction upa + nī + khama + i
Phonetic Change īk > ikkh
k > kh (Kacc 20, 27)
Sanskrit niṣkram
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

ahaṃ middhena pakato,
vihārā upanikkhamiṃ,
caṅkamaṃ abhiruhanto,
tatth'eva papatiṃ chamā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya idaṃ sukhan'ti upanijjhāyitaṃ, ta'dam'ariyānaṃ etaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṃ, ayam'ek'ānupassanā.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ

kiñ'hi sobhati chavo manodaṇḍo imassa evaṃ oḷārikassa kāyadaṇḍassa upanidhāya! atha kho kāyadaṇḍo'va mahāsāvajjataro pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā, no tathā vacīdaṇḍo, no tathā manodaṇḍo'ti.

Sanskrit upanipadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati. tiṭṭhati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭhati. nisīdati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanisīdati. nipajjati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanipajjati.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭheyyuṃ, upanisīdeyyuṃ, upanipajjeyyuṃ.

nisajjaṃ kappeyyā'ti mātugāme nisinne bhikkhu upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. bhikkhu nisinne mātugāmo upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ

Construction upa + ni + √badh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Sanskrit upanibaddha
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sā gaddulabaddho daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā upanibaddho. so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
upanibandha

pp. tied close to, entreated [upa + ni + √bandh] ✗

Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā upanibandheyya. atha kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, hatthidamako mahantaṃ thambhaṃ pathaviyaṃ nikhaṇitvā āraññakassa nāgassa gīvāyaṃ upanibandhati āraññakānañ'c'eva sīlānaṃ abhinimmadanāya āraññakānañ'c'eva sarasaṅkappānaṃ abhinimmadanāya

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
upanisa 1

Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)
