Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having the precondition for; with the prerequisite for
Construction upanisa + sampanna
Antonym hatūpanisa
upanisasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.23 (SN12.23) ✗
upanisā 1.1

fem. (+dat) cause (for); precondition (for); prerequisite (for); lit. sitting down near [upa + ni + √si + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, in comps, from upanissayati (+dat)
Meaning cause (for); precondition (for); prerequisite (for); lit. sitting down near
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Notes (PED) contracted form of upanissaya
Sanskrit upaniśri
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, sambodhipakkhikānaṃ, āvuso, dhammānaṃ kā upanisā bhāvanāyā'ti, evaṃ puṭṭhā tumhe, bhikkhave, tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ kin'ti byākareyyāthā'ti?

AN 9.1 sambodhisuttaṃ

yam'pi'ssa taṃ, bhikkhave, khayasmiṃ khayeññāṇaṃ, tam'pi saupanisaṃ vadāmi, no anupanisaṃ. kā ca, bhikkhave, khayeñāṇassa upanisā? vimuttī'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

SN 12.23 upanisasuttaṃ
upanisā 1.2

fem. (+dat) reason (for); purpose (of); lit. sitting down near [upa + ni + √si + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from upanissayati (+dat)
Meaning reason (for); purpose (of); lit. sitting down near
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Notes (PED) contracted form of upanissaya
Sanskrit upaniśri
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

ye te, bhikkhave, kusalā dhammā ariyā niyyānikā sambodhagāmino, tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ariyānaṃ niyyānikānaṃ sambodhagāmīnaṃ kā upanisā savanāyā'ti

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

aññā hi lābha-upanisā,
aññā nibbānagāminī,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
bhikkhu buddhassa sāvako,
sakkāraṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
vivekam'anubrūhaye.

DHP 75 bālavaggo
upanisā 2.1

fem. sitting near; approaching [upa + ni + √sad + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from upanisīdati
Meaning sitting near; approaching
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction upa + ni + √sad + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit upaniṣad (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

etadatthā, bhikkhave, kathā, etadatthā mantanā, etadatthā upanisā, etadatthaṃ sot'āvadhānaṃ, yadidaṃ anupādā cittassa vimokkho'ti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
upanisinna

pp. seated close; sitting nearby [upa + ni + √sad + a + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upanisīdati
Meaning seated close; sitting nearby
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction upa + ni + sīda + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change a > ī
d > n
Sanskrit upa + niṣaṇṇa
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

nisajjaṃ kappeyyā'ti mātugāme nisinne bhikkhu upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. bhikkhu nisinne mātugāmo upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ
upanisinnavagga

masc. Chapter 4 of the Rādhasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 3 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
upanisīdati

pr. (+acc) sits next to; sits around [upa + ni + √sad + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning sits next to; sits around
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction upa + ni + sīda + ti
Phonetic Change a > ī
Sanskrit upasīdati
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭheyyuṃ, upanisīdeyyuṃ, upanipajjeyyuṃ.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati. tiṭṭhati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭhati. nisīdati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanisīdati. nipajjati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanipajjati.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
upanisīdāpetvā

abs. (+acc) having made (someone) sit nearby [upa + ni + √sad + *āpe + tvā] ~

Grammar abs of upanisīdāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having made (someone) sit nearby
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 *āpe (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + āpe > sadāpe > sīdāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + ni + sīdāpe + tvā
Phonetic Change a > ī
Sanskrit upasad
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
upanisīdi

aor. sat close to [upa + ni + √sad] ✗
upanisīdituṃ

inf. (+acc) to sit down; to sit (with); lit. to sit near [upa + ni + √sad + a + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of upanisīdati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to sit down; to sit (with); lit. to sit near
Root Family upa ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction upa + ni + sīda + ituṃ
Sanskrit upaniṣad
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

sattahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ kulaṃ anupagantvā vā n'ālaṃ upagantuṃ, upagantvā vā n'ālaṃ upanisīdituṃ. katamehi sattahi?

AN 7.13 kulasuttaṃ
upanisīditvā

abs. having sat down near (to) [upa + ni + √sad] ✗
upanisevati 1

pr. (+acc) latches onto; cling into; lit. associates closely [upa + ni + √sev + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning latches onto; cling into; lit. associates closely
Root Family upa ni √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Base √sev + a > seva
Construction upa + ni + seva + ti
Sanskrit upaniṣevate
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

s'āssa māluvālatā taruṇā mudukā lomasā vilambinī, sā taṃ sālaṃ upaniseveyya.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
upanisevati 2

pr. (+acc) associates closely [upa + ni + √sev] ✗
upanissaya

masc. decisive support; supporting condition; sufficient condition [upa + ni + √si + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from upanissayati
Meaning decisive support; supporting condition; sufficient condition
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si > say + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Sanskrit upaniśraya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)
upanissayi

aor. associated closely, depended on [upa + ni + √si] ✗
upanissāya 1

ger. (+acc) depending (on); based (on); supported (by) [upa + ni + √si + *ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upanissayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning depending (on); based (on); supported (by)
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si > sāy + *ya
Phonetic Change i > āy
Commentary (VIN 1.2.13) upanissāya viharatī'ti tattha paṭibaddhā honti cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārā.
Sanskrit upaniśrāya
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

bhikkhu pan'eva aññataraṃ gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā upanissāya viharati kuladūsako pāpasamācāro, tassa kho pāpakā samācārā dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca, kulāni ca tena duṭṭhāni dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca

VIN PAT SA 13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satthāraṃ upanissāya viharati aññataraṃ vā garuṭṭhāniyaṃ sabrahmacāriṃ, yatth'assa tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti pemañ'ca gāravo ca.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
upanissāya 2

ind. (+acc) nearby; near (to) [upa + ni + √si + *ya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, ger of upanissayati (+acc)
Meaning nearby; near (to)
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si > sāy + *ya
Phonetic Change i > āy
Sanskrit upaniśrāya
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

tenah'ānanda, yāvatikā bhikkhū vesāliṃ upanissāya viharanti te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ sannipātehī'ti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ

yaṃnūna mayaṃ amuṃ nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ nevāpikassa upanissāya āsayaṃ kappeyyāma.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
upanissita

pp. dependent on; clinging to; relying on [upa + ni + √si + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upanissayati
Meaning dependent on; clinging to; relying on
Root Family upa ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction upa + ni + √si + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit upaniśrita
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

ete ca ñatvā upanissitā'ti,
ñatvā munī nissaye so vimaṃsī,
ñatvā vimutto na vivādam'eti,
bhav'ābhavāya na sameti dhīro'ti.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11
upanīta 1

adj. (+loc) led (into); brought (into); presented; lit. lead near [upa + √nī + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, pp of upaneti (+loc)
Meaning led (into); brought (into); presented; lit. lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym anūpanīta
Sanskrit upanīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

kāmesu giddhā pasutā pamūḷhā,
avadāniyā te visame niviṭṭhā,
dukkha-upanītā paridevayanti,
kiṃ'sū bhavissāma ito cutāse.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2

sīl'uttamā saññamen'āhu suddhiṃ,
vataṃ samādāya upaṭṭhitāse,
idh'eva sikkhema athassa suddhiṃ,
bhava-upanītā kusalā vadānā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
upanīta 2

pp. (+acc) (of a sacrifice) led (to); offered; presented; lit. lead near [upa + √nī + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upaneti (+acc)
Meaning (of a sacrifice) led (to); offered; presented; lit. lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Commentary (SNa) thūṇ'ūpanītānī'ti thūṇaṃ upanītāni, thūṇāya baddhāni honti. (SNt) upanītāni yaññaṃ yajituṃ ārambhāya.
Sanskrit upanīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

saccena danto damasā upeto,
vedantagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
yañño-upanīto tam'upavhayetha,
kālena so juhati dakkhiṇeyye'ti.

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa mahāyañño paccupaṭṭhito hoti, pañca ca usabhasatāni pañca ca vacchatarasatāni pañca ca vacchatarisatāni pañca ca ajasatāni pañca ca urabbhasatāni thūṇā-upanītāni honti yaññ'atthāya.

yāvañ'c'idaṃ bhoto gotamassa evaṃ āsajja āsajja vuccamānassa, upanītehi vacanappathehi samudācariyamānassa, chavivaṇṇo c'eva pariyodāyati, mukhavaṇṇo ca vippasīdati, yathā taṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
upanīta 4

adj. (+loc) compared (to); in comparison (with); lit. lead near [upa + √nī + ta] ✓

sara catur'odadhī,
upanīte assuthaññarudhiramhi,
sara ekakappam'aṭṭhīnaṃ,
sañcayaṃ vipulena samaṃ.

THI 73 sumedhātherīgāthā
upanīta 5

pp. ended; concluded; passed; lit. lead near [upa + √nī + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upaneti, in comps
Meaning ended; concluded; passed; lit. lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Commentary (DHPa) upanītavayo'ti upā'ti nipātam'attaṃ, nītavayo'ti vigatavayo atikkantavayo, tvañ'c'asi dāni tayo vaye atikkamitvā maraṇamukhe ṭhito'ti attho.
Sanskrit upanīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

upanītavayo ca dāni'si,
sampayāto'si yamassa santike,
vāso te n'atthi antarā,
pātheyyam'pi ca te na vijjati.

upanītavaya

adj. at the end of life; come to the last stage of life; lit. brought to age [upanīta + vayas + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning at the end of life; come to the last stage of life; lit. brought to age
Construction upanīta + vayas + a
upanītavayas + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upanīta + vayaṃ)
Commentary (DHPa) upanītavayo'ti upā'ti nipātam'attaṃ, nītavayo'ti vigatavayo atikkantavayo, tvañ'c'asi dāni tayo vaye atikkamitvā maraṇamukhe ṭhito'ti attho.

upanītavayo ca dāni'si,
sampayāto'si yamassa santike,
vāso te n'atthi antarā,
pātheyyam'pi ca te na vijjati.

DHP 237 malavaggo
upanīya

Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + ya

Sanskrit upanīya
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

addhā kho te ayaṃ, aggivessana, āsajja upanīya vācā bhāsitā, api ca te ahaṃ byākarissāmi.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
upanīyati 1

pr. is carried away; is lead to the end; is brought to a conclusion; (comm) slowly approaches death; lit. is lead near [upa + √nī + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of upaneti, intrans
Meaning is carried away; is lead to the end; is brought to a conclusion; (comm) slowly approaches death; lit. is lead near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 ya (lead, carry)
Base √nī + ya > nīya (pass)
Construction upa + nīya + ti
Commentary (SNa) upanīyatī'ti parikkhīyati nirujjhati, upagacchati vā, anupubbena maraṇaṃ upetī'ti attho
Sanskrit upanīyate
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

upanīyati jīvitam'appam'āyu,
jar'ūpanītassa na santi tāṇā,
etaṃ bhayaṃ maraṇe pekkhamāno,
puññāni kayirātha sukh'āvahānī'ti.

upanīyasutta

upaneti 1

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ

atha khv'assa pubb'eva tathā cittaṃ bhāvitaṃ hoti yaṃ taṃ tathattāya upanetī'ti.

VIN 1.1.4 catutthapārājikaṃ
upanetvā

Meaning having led; having guided; lit. having led near

Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)

Construction upa + ne + tvā
Phonetic Change ī > e
Antonym anūpanetvā
Sanskrit upanītvā
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

te sāvake upanetvā pabbajite, sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desetvā pabbajitānaṃ, sāvakesu gedhitacittā pabbajitesu, kāyassa bhedā pāṇ'upacchedā hīne kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upanenta

prp. (+acc) leading; guiding; lit. leading near [upa + √nī + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of upaneti, trans (+acc)
Meaning leading; guiding; lit. leading near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)

Construction upa + ne + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ī > e
Antonym anupanenta
Sanskrit upaniyat
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

desento'pi hi, pāpima, tathāgato sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ t'ādiso'va, adesento'pi hi, pāpima, tathāgato sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ t'ādiso'va. upanento'pi hi, pāpima, tathāgato sāvake t'ādiso'va, anupanento'pi hi, pāpima, tathāgato sāvake t'ādiso'va.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upanemisa

masc. name of a privately enlightened Buddha ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha
upaneyya

ger. (+acc) suggesting; alluding; insinuating; (comm) accusing; lit. leading near [upa + √nī + eyya] ~

Grammar ger of upaneti, trans (+acc)
Meaning suggesting; alluding; insinuating; (comm) accusing; lit. leading near
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa + √nī + eyya
Phonetic Change ī > e
Commentary (DNa) amhe'pi evaṃ upaneyya upaneyyā'ti brāhmaṇo kho pana ambaṭṭha pokkharasātītiādīni vatvā evaṃ upanetvā upanetvā paṭicchannaṃ kāraṇaṃ āvikaritvā suṭṭhu dāsādibhāvaṃ āropetvā avaca, tayā amhe akkosāpitā'ti adhippāyo.
Sanskrit upanīya
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)
upanesi 1

aor. (+acc) brought up; presented; directed attention (to); lit. led near [upa + √nī + a + si] ✓

Meaning brought up; presented; directed attention (to); lit. led near

Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Base √nī + a > ne
Construction upa + ne + si
Phonetic Change ī > e
Sanskrit upanī
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

nanu tvaṃ, bhikkhu, passasi brahmaparisaṃ sannipatitan'ti? iti kho maṃ, bhikkhave, māro pāpimā brahmaparisaṃ upanesi.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

sace kho tvaṃ, mārisa, evaṃ pajānāsi, sace tvaṃ evaṃ anubuddho, mā sāvake upanesi, mā pabbajite, mā sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desesi, mā pabbajitānaṃ, mā sāvakesu gedhim'akāsi, mā pabbajitesu.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

ahesuṃ kho, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā paṭijānamānā. te sāvake upanesuṃ pabbajite, sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desesuṃ pabbajitānaṃ, sāvakesu gedhim'akaṃsu pabbajitesu

DHP 140 daṇḍavaggo

yattha nu kho, bhante, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, sakkā nu kho so, bhante, gamanena lokassa anto ñātuṃ vā daṭṭhuṃ vā pāpuṇituṃ vā'ti?

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

atha kho, pāpima, kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho nāg'āpalokitaṃ apalokesi, na v'āyaṃ dūsī māro mattam'aññāsī'ti. sah'āpalokanāya ca pana, pāpima, dūsī māro tamhā ca ṭhānā cavi mahānirayañ'ca upapajji.

na'pi dibbassa cakkhuno,
cetopariyāya iddhiyā,
cutiyā upapattiyā,
sotadhātuvisuddhiyā,
paṇidhī me na vijjati.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā'ti.

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhātuso upaparikkhati, āyatanaso upaparikkhati, paṭiccasamuppādaso upaparikkhati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividh'ūpaparikkhī hoti.

upama

Sanskrit upamā
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

kumbh'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā,
nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā.
yodhetha māraṃ paññ'āvudhena,
jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.

DHP 40 cittavaggo

pheṇapiṇḍ'ūpamaṃ rūpaṃ,
vedanā bubbuḷ'ūpamā,
marīcik'ūpamā saññā,
saṅkhārā kadal'ūpamā,
māy'ūpamañ'ca viññāṇaṃ,
desitādiccabandhunā.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ

Root √mā･5 nā (measure)

Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit upamā
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

tena h'āvuso, upamaṃ te karissāmi. upamāya'p'idh'ekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānanti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ lahuparivattaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ cittaṃ. yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, upamā'pi na sukarā yāva lahuparivattaṃ cittan'ti.

SN 1.48 paṇihitācchavaggo
upamā 2

fem. example; illustration [upa + √mā + ā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from upameti
Meaning example; illustration
Root Family upa √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction upa + √mā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit upamā
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)
upamāyapidhekacce

sandhi. just by means of a simile some people here [upamāya + api + idha + ekacce] ✓

Grammar sandhi, fem + ind + adv + pron
Meaning just by means of a simile some people here
Construction upamāya + api + idha + ekacce
Commentary (MNa) tena hī'ti yena kāraṇena ekacce paṇḍitā upamāya atthaṃ jānanti, tena kāraṇena upamaṃ te karissāmī'ti attho.
Sanskrit upamā + api + iha + ekatya

tena h'āvuso, upamaṃ te karissāmi. upamāya'p'idh'ekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānanti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

Variant opammasaṃsandana
upameti

pr. (+instr) compares [upa + √mā] ✗
upaya 1

masc. approach; engagement [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upeti
Meaning approach; engagement
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym anūpaya
Commentary (SNa) taṇhādiṭṭhiyo hi yasmā ahaṃ maman'tiādīhi ākārehi tebhūmakadhamme upenti upagacchanti, tasmā upayā'ti vuccanti.
Sanskrit upāya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

upaya-upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upaya-upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ
upaya 2

masc. attachment; lit. going near [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upeti
Meaning attachment; lit. going near
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym anūpaya
Sanskrit upāya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

yā kācimā sammutiyo puthujjā,
sabbāva etā na upeti vidvā,
anūpayo so upayaṃ kim'eyya,
diṭṭhe sute khantim'akubbamāno.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
upaya 3

masc. (+loc) who is attached (to); who is engaged (with); lit. going near [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upeti (+loc)
Meaning who is attached (to); who is engaged (with); lit. going near
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym anūpaya
Variant upāya
Commentary (SNa) upayo'ti taṇhā-māna-diṭṭhivasena pañcakkhandhe upagato.
Sanskrit upāya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ,
anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi,
adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

upayo, bhikkhave, avimutto, anupayo vimutto. rūp'upayaṃ vā, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ tiṭṭhamānaṃ tiṭṭheyya, rūp'ārammaṇaṃ rūpappatiṭṭhaṃ nand'ūpasecanaṃ vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 22.53 upayasuttaṃ

Construction upa + yā + nta

Commentary (SNa) upayanto'ti udakavaḍḍhanasamaye upari gacchanto.
Sanskrit upayāt

upayantisutta

upayasutta

upayāti

Sanskrit upayāti
Sanskrit Root √yā 2 (go)

papañcasaññā itarītarā narā,
papañcayantā upayanti saññino,
manomayaṃ gehasitañ'ca sabbaṃ,
panujja nekkhammasitaṃ irīyati.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

aj'eḷakā ca gāvo ca,
vividhā yattha haññare,
na taṃ sammaggatā yaññaṃ,
upayanti mah'esino.

Sanskrit upāya + upādāna

kathañ'ca, gahapati, anokasārī hoti? rūpadhātuyā kho, gahapati, yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upay'upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā

upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

Grammar adj, comp

Commentary (SNa) upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho'ti upayehi ca upādānehi ca abhinivesehi ca vinibandho. tattha upayā'ti dve upayā taṇh'upayo ca diṭṭh'upayo ca. upādān'ādīsu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit upāya + upādāna + abhiniveśa + vinibandha

upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

mantabhāṇī anuddhato,

Sanskrit upari + prāsāda

idh'ānanda, rañño mahāsudassanassa tadah'uposathe pannarase sīsaṃ nhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṃ cakkaratanaṃ pāturahosi sahass'āraṃ sanemikaṃ sanābhikaṃ sabbākāraparipūraṃ.

DN 17.3 mahāsudassanasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ uparipāsādavaragato hoti. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavoca, atthi nu kho te, mallike, koc'añño attanā piyataro'ti?

SN 3.8 mallikāsuttaṃ

idh'ānanda, rañño mahāsudassanassa tadah'uposathe pannarase sīsaṃ nhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṃ cakkaratanaṃ pāturahosi sahass'āraṃ sanemikaṃ sanābhikaṃ sabbākāraparipūraṃ.

DN 17.3 mahāsudassanasuttaṃ
uparibhāga

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning upper part; top part; upwards
Construction upari + bhāga

Antonym heṭṭhābhāga, adhobhāga
Variant uparibhāva
Sanskrit uparibhāga

seyyathā'pi, cunda, ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te adhobhāgaṅ'gamanīyā, ye keci kusalā dhammā sabbe te uparibhāgaṅ'gamanīyā, evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti uparibhāgāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

vattu'kāmo haṃsānaṃ sīghavegatāya bārāṇasinagare rājanivesanassa uparibhāgaṃ sampattakāle daṭṭhaṭṭhānato daṇḍakaṃ vissajjetvā ākāsaṅgaṇe patitvā dvedhā bhijji.

DHPa 2.25.3 kokālika vatthu

Sanskrit uparibhāga + paryāya

iti kho, cunda, desito mayā sallekhapariyāyo, desito citt'uppādapariyāyo, desito parikkamanapariyāyo, desito uparibhāgapariyāyo, desito parinibbānapariyāyo. yaṃ kho, cunda, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

Derivative taddhita (ima)
Antonym heṭṭhima
Sanskrit uparima (bsk)
uparimuddhani

ind. on top of the head [upari + muddha + ani] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning on top of the head
Construction upari + muddha + ani
uparimuddha + ani
Commentary (UDa) uparimuddhani mahantaṃ phaṇaṃ vihaccā'ti bhagavato muddhappadesassa upari attano mahantaṃ phaṇaṃ pasāretvā. phaṇaṃ karitvā'ti'pi pāṭho, so ev'attho.
uparivehāsa

adj. upper; upstairs; above the ground; lit. up in the air [upari + vehāsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning upper; upstairs; above the ground; lit. up in the air
Construction upari + vehāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (upari + vehāsa)
Commentary (VINa) uparivehāsakuṭiyā'ti upari acchannatalāya dvibhūmikakuṭiyā vā tibhūmikādikuṭiyā vā.
Sanskrit upari + vaihāyasa

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 18 vehāsakuṭisikkhāpadaṃ

Commentary (VINa) uparivehāsakuṭiyā'ti upari acchannatalāya dvibhūmikakuṭiyā vā tibhūmikādikuṭiyā vā, vehāsakuṭī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit upari + vaihāyasa + kuṭi

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

uparivehāsa + aṃ

Sanskrit upari + vaihāyasam

tena kho pana samayena vajirapāṇi yakkho āyasaṃ vajiraṃ ādāya ādittaṃ sampajjalitaṃ sajotibhūtaṃ saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa uparivehāsaṃ ṭhito hoti, sac'āyaṃ saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavatā yāvatatiyaṃ sahadhammikaṃ pañhaṃ puṭṭho na byākarissati etth'ev'assa sattadhā muddhaṃ phālessāmī'ti.

uparujjhati

pr. is stopped; is ended; is finished [upa + √rudh + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of uparundhati, intrans
Meaning is stopped; is ended; is finished
Root Family upa √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ya (obstruct)
Base √rudh + ya > rujjha (pass)
Construction upa + rujjha + ti
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Antonym nūparujjhati
Sanskrit uparudhyate
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

sabbaloke ca atam'mayo bhavissāmi, ahaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti, mamaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti

AN 6.104 atammayasuttaṃ

yam'etaṃ pañhaṃ apucchi,
ajita taṃ vadāmi te,
yattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhati,
viññāṇassa nirodhena,
etth'etaṃ uparujjhati.

pārāyanavaggo 1

Sanskrit uparuddha

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, mukhato ca nāsato ca assāsapassāsesu uparuddhesu kaṇṇasotehi vātānaṃ nikkhamantānaṃ adhimatto saddo hoti.

aniccaṃ dukkhan'ti vipassa yoniso,
suññaṃ anattā'ti aghaṃ vadhan'ti ca,
manovicāre uparundha cetaso,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

mūlaṃ papañcasaṅkhāya,
mantā asmī'ti sabbam'uparundhe,
yā kāci taṇhā ajjhattaṃ,
tāsaṃ vinayā sadā sato sikkhe.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā,
dukkhaṃ iñjitapaccayā,
tasmā hi ejaṃ vossajja,
saṅkhāre uparundhiya,
anejo anupādāno,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā,

sabbasaṅkhārasamathā,
saññānaṃ uparodhanā,
evaṃ dukkhakkhayo hoti,
etaṃ ñatvā yathātathaṃ.

pacchā so vigate kodhe,
aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

sevamāno sevamānaṃ,
samphuṭṭho samphusaṃ paraṃ,
saro diddho kalāpaṃ'va,
alittam'upalimpati.
upalepabhayā dhīro,
n'eva pāpasakhā siyā.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ
upalimpati 2

pr. (+instr or +loc) is smeared (by); is coated (by); is stained (by); is contaminated (by) [upa + √lip + ya + ti] ✓

Root Family upa √lip
Root √lip･2 ya (coat, smear)
Base √lip + ya > lippa > limpa (pass, irreg)
Construction upa + limpa + ti
Variant upalippati
Notes active base but passive meaning. perhaps a textual error.
Sanskrit upalimpati
Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

udabindu yathā'pi pokkhare,
padume vāri yathā na limpati,
evaṃ muni na-upalimpati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā.

upavasitvā

abs. (+acc) (of precepts) having observed [upa + √vas + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of upavasati, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of precepts) having observed
Root Family upa √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction upa + √vas + itvā
Sanskrit upavastvā
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)
upavassa

ger. (+acc) (of precepts) observing [upa + √vas + ya] ~

Grammar ger of upavasati, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of precepts) observing
Root Family upa √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction upa + √vas + ya
Phonetic Change y > s
Commentary (ANa) upavass'uposathan'ti upavasitvā uposathaṃ.
Sanskrit upavasya
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)
upavassaṃ

abs. (+acc) having spent; having lived; having observed [upa + √vas + yaṃ] ✓

Grammar abs of upavasati, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning having spent; having lived; having observed
Root Family upa √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction upa + √vas + yaṃ
Phonetic Change y > s
Commentary (VIN 1.4.3.9) upavassaṃ kho panā'ti vuṭṭhavassānaṃ. (VINa) upavassaṃ kho panā'ti ettha upavassanti upavassa, upavasitvā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Notes ṇamul absolutive
Sanskrit upavasya
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)

upavassaṃ kho pana kattikapuṇṇamaṃ yāni kho pana tāni āraññakāni sen'āsanāni sāsaṅkasammatāni sappaṭibhayāni, tathārūpesu bhikkhu sen'āsanesu viharanto ākaṅkhamāno tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipeyya

upavāda

masc. blame; insult; criticism; fault finding [upa + √vad + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upavadati
Meaning blame; insult; criticism; fault finding
Root Family upa √vad
Root √vad･1 a (say, speak)
Construction upa + √vad > vād + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anūpavāda
Sanskrit upavāda
Sanskrit Root √vad 1 (speak)

kayavikkaye na tiṭṭheyya,
upavādaṃ bhikkhu na kareyya kuhiñci,
gāme ca n'ābhisajjeyya,
lābhakamyā janaṃ na lapayeyya.

abbhakkhānañ'ca dāruṇaṃ,
parikkhayañ'ca ñātīnaṃ,
bhogānañ'ca pabhaṅguraṃ.

DHP 139 daṇḍavaggo

kiṃ'su tassa mahabbhayan'ti kiṃ lokassa bhayaṃ mahabbhayaṃ pīḷanaṃ ghaṭṭanaṃ upaddavo upasaggo'ti, kiṃ'su tassa mahabbhayaṃ.

upasaṅkanta

pp. approached; drew near; come to [upa + saṃ + √kam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upasaṅkamati

√ In Comps kkam

Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
m > n
Antonym anupasaṅkanta
Sanskrit upasaṃkram
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

imāni, bhante, asīti gāmikasahassāni idha-upasaṅkantāni bhagavantaṃ dassanāya. sādhu mayaṃ, bhante, labheyyāma bhagavantaṃ dassanāyā'ti.

VIN 4.5.147 soṇakoḷivisa vatthu
upasaṅkamati

Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

sace bhavaṃ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissati, bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati.

DN 4.2 soṇadaṇḍasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme. tena kho pana samayena aññataro navo bhikkhu ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamati.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ

ayañ'hi so udapāno mayi upasaṅkamante sabbaṃ taṃ tiṇañ'ca bhusañ'ca mukhato ovamitvā acchassa udakassa anāvilassa vippasannassa yāva mukhato pūrito vissandanto maññe ṭhito'ti!

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

kosambiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.

Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Sanskrit upasaṃkramitavya
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, icchām'ahaṃ, bhikkhave, aḍḍhamāsaṃ paṭisallīyituṃ. n'āmhi kenaci upasaṅkamitabbo, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakenā'ti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ bhikkhū evam'āhaṃsu, m'āyasmā ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamī'ti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi vuccamāno evam'āha, ime hi nāma therā bhikkhū kulāni upasaṅkamitabbaṃ maññissanti, kim'aṅgaṃ pan'āhan'ti?

AN 10.83 puṇṇiyasuttaṃ

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, anekasataṃ khattiyaparisaṃ upasaṅkamitā. tatra'pi mayā sannisinnapubbañ'c'eva, sallapitapubbañ'ca, sākacchā ca samāpajjitapubbā.

DN 5.2 kūṭadantasuttaṃ

na kho, bhikkhu, sukaro so bhagavā amhehi upasaṅkamituṃ, aññāhi mahesakkhāhi devatāhi parivuto.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
upasaṅkamitvā

abs. (+acc) having approached; having gone (to); having drawn near (to) [upa + saṃ + √kam + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of upasaṅkamati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having approached; having gone (to); having drawn near (to)
Root Family upa saṃ √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction upa + saṃ + √kam + itvā
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Antonym anupasaṅkamitvā
Variant upasaṃkamitvā
Commentary (VIN 2.5.3.3) upasaṅkamitvā'ti tattha gantvā.
Sanskrit upasaṃkramitvā
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ

upasaṅkamitvā kummaṃ kacchapaṃ paccupaṭṭhito ahosi, yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
upasaṅkamma

ger. (+acc) approaching; going (to) [upa + saṃ + √kam + ya] ✓

y > m
Sanskrit upakramya, upasanna
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

disvā pāsādachāyāyaṃ,
caṅkamantaṃ nar'uttamaṃ,
tattha naṃ upasaṅkamma,
vandisaṃ puris'uttamaṃ.

TH 227 sopākattheragāthā

eṇijaṅghaṃ kisaṃ vīraṃ,
app'āhāraṃ alolupaṃ,
sīhaṃ'v'ekacaraṃ nāgaṃ,
kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
upasaṅkamma pucchāma,
kathaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī'ti

SN 1.30 eṇijaṅghasuttaṃ
upasañhita

Phonetic Change ṃ > ñ
dhā > h
Variant upasaṃhita
Sanskrit upasaṃhita
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

dhammo nāma buddhabhāsito, sāvakabhāsito, isibhāsito, devatābhāsito, atth'ūpasañhito, dhamm'ūpasañhito.

VIN 2.5.1.4 padasodhammasikkhāpadaṃ
upasaṭṭha

adj. troubled, afflicted, visited by troubles; trouble, affliction [upa + √sajj] ✗
upasanta 1

pp. calmed; cooled; composed; still; calm; at peace; tranquil [upa + √sam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of upasammati
Meaning calmed; cooled; composed; still; calm; at peace; tranquil
Root Family upa √sam
Root √sam･3 ya (be calm, tired)
Construction upa + √sam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym anupasanta
Commentary (MNa) upasantā'ti nibbutā.
Sanskrit upaśānta
Sanskrit Root √śam 4 (be quiet)

santakāyo santavāco,
santavā susamāhito,
vantalok'āmiso bhikkhu,
upasanto'ti vuccati.

DHP 378 bhikkhuvaggo

upasanto uparato,
mantabhāṇī anuddhato,
dhunāti pāpake dhamme,
dumapattaṃ'va māluto'ti.

TH 2 mahākoṭṭhikattheragāthā
upasanta 2

masc. name of Vessabhū Buddha's attendant; lit. calmed [upa + √sam] ✗

adj. of calm appearance, looking at peace ✗

Construction upasanta + upasanta
Commentary (ANa) upasant'upasanto'ti upasanto viya upasanto.

adj. extremely calm; very peaceful [upasanta + upasanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning extremely calm; very peaceful
Construction upasanta + upasanta
Compound kammadhāraya (upasanta + upasanta)
Sanskrit upaśānta + upaśānta

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu tāva'd'eva soratasorato hoti nivātanivāto hoti upasant'ūpasanto hoti yāva na amanāpā vacanapathā phusanti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
upasama

masc. (+gen) calmness (of); tranquillisation (of); stillness (of); peace (of) [upa + √sam + a] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, from upasammati (+gen)
Meaning calmness (of); tranquillisation (of); stillness (of); peace (of)
Root Family upa √sam
Root √sam･3 ya (be calm, tired)
Construction upa + √sam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (SNa) upasamena ... rāg'ādiupasamena (SNt) upasamenā'ti rāg'ādīnaṃ sabbaso vūpasamena.
Sanskrit upaśama
Sanskrit Root √śam 4 (be quiet)

tasmā evaṃ samannāgato bhikkhu iminā paramena upasam'ādhiṭṭhānena samannāgato hoti. eso hi, bhikkhu, paramo ariyo upasamo yadidaṃ, rāgadosamohānaṃ upasamo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upasamagāmī

adj. leading to peace; conducive to calm [upasama + gāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to peace; conducive to calm
Construction upasama + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upasamaṃ + gāmī)
upasamati

pr. becomes calm or quiet; ceases; is allayed, is extinguished [upa + √sam] ✗
upasamasaṃvattanika

adj. leading to mental peace; conducive to tranquillity [upasama + saṃvattanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to mental peace; conducive to tranquillity
Construction upasama + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (upasamāya + saṃvattanika)
Antonym anupasamasaṃvattanika
Sanskrit upaśama + saṃvartanīya

evañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti yathā taṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye suppavedite niyyānike upasamasaṃvattanike sammāsambuddhappavedite.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ
upasamasukha

nt. pleasure of peace; happiness of tranquillity [upasama + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning pleasure of peace; happiness of tranquillity
Construction upasama + sukha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upasamassa + sukha)
Commentary (MNa) upasamasukhan'ti rāg'ādivūpasamatthāya sukhaṃ.
Sanskrit upaśama + sukha

idaṃ vuccati nekkhammasukhaṃ pavivekasukhaṃ upasamasukhaṃ sambodhisukhaṃ. āsevitabbaṃ, bhāvetabbaṃ, bahulīkātabbaṃ, na bhāyitabbaṃ etassa sukhassā'ti, vadāmi.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yo kho, nāgita, na'y'imassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī assa akicchalābhī akasiralābhī ... so taṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ lābhasakkārasilokasukhaṃ sādiyeyyā'ti.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ
upasamātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 10 (THI10) ✗
upasamādhiṭṭhāna

catur'ādhiṭṭhāno ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? paññ'ādhiṭṭhāno, sacc'ādhiṭṭhāno, cāg'ādhiṭṭhāno, upasam'ādhiṭṭhāno.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

tasmā evaṃ samannāgato bhikkhu iminā paramena upasam'ādhiṭṭhānena samannāgato hoti. eso hi, bhikkhu, paramo ariyo upasamo yadidaṃ, rāgadosamohānaṃ upasamo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upasamānussati

fem. recollection of peace [upasama + anussati] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning recollection of peace
Construction upasama + anussati
Commentary (ANa) upasamaṃ ārabbha uppannā anussati upasam'ānussati, sabbadukkh'ūpasam'ārammaṇāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. duvidho vā upasamo accant'ūpasamo ca khay'ūpasamo ca. tattha accant'ūpasamo nāma nibbānaṃ, khay'ūpasamo nāma maggo. evam'etaṃ duvidham'pi upasamaṃ anussarantassa uppannā sati upasam'ānussatīti ayam'ettha attho.
upasameti

pr. (+acc) calms; settles; tranquillises; lit. makes calm; makes peaceful [upa + √sam + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of upasammati, trans (+acc)

Root √sam･3 *e (be calm, tired)
Base √sam + *e > sāme > same (caus, irreg)
Construction upa + same + ti
Sanskrit upaśamayati
Sanskrit Root √śam 4 (be quiet)

ajjhattam'ev'upasame,
na aññato bhikkhu santim'eseyya,
ajjhattaṃ upasantassa,
n'atthi attāṃ kuto nirattāṃ vā.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti. so ca āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati. āsavānaṃ khayā samaṇo hoti.

bhikkhū'ti bhikkhako'ti bhikkhu, bhikkhācariyaṃ ajjhupagato'ti bhikkhu, bhinnapaṭadharo'ti bhikkhu, samaññāya bhikkhu, paṭiññāya bhikkhu, ehi bhikkhū'ti bhikkhu, tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampanno'ti bhikkhu

ahaṃ cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi, catunnaṃ vassānaṃ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājentu upasampādentu bhikkhubhāvāyā'ti.

VIN 2.5.1.3 pesuññasikkhāpadaṃ

bhiṃsāpeyyā'ti upasampanno upasampannaṃ bhiṃsāpetu'kāmo rūpaṃ vā saddaṃ vā gandhaṃ vā rasaṃ vā phoṭṭhabbaṃ vā upasaṃharati. bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.

tam'enaṃ rajako yasmiṃ yasmiṃ raṅgajāte upasaṃhareyya, yadi nīlakāya yadi pītakāya yadi lohitakāya yadi mañjeṭṭhakāya durattavaṇṇam'ev'assa aparisuddhavaṇṇam'ev'assa.

Root √har･1 a (carry)
Base √har + a > hara
Construction upa + saṃ + hara + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit upasaṃharat
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)
upasaṃhari

aor. collected, focussed, concentrated, compared [upa + saṃ + √har] ✗
upasaṃharitvā

abs. having brought together; having assembled [upa + saṃ + √har] ✗
upasaṃhita 1

pp. (+instr) connected (with); concerning; to do (with) [upa + saṃ + √dhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of upasaṃdahati (+instr)
Meaning connected (with); concerning; to do (with)
Root Family upa saṃ √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction upa + saṃ + √dhā > (da)h + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change dhā > h
Variant upasañhita
Sanskrit upasaṃhita
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

yathodhi kho pan'assa cattaṃ hoti vantaṃ muttaṃ pahīnaṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, so buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgatomhī'ti labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamma-upasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamma-upasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

Commentary (MNa) upasumbheyyā'ti iminā saddhiṃ sambandho veditabbo. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, tam'enaṃ kukkuraṃ upasumbheyya, tassa samīpe khipeyyā'ti attho.

tam'enaṃ dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ sunikkantaṃ nikkantaṃ nimmaṃsaṃ lohitamakkhitaṃ upasumbheyya.

karontam'upasevati,
saṅkiyo hoti pāpasmiṃ,
avaṇṇo c'assa rūhati.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ

yādisaṃ kurute mittaṃ,
yādisaṃ ca-upasevati,
sa ve t'ādisako hoti,
sahavāso hi t'ādiso.

abhijjhā ca vihesā ca,
cittam'assa-upahaññati,
evaṃ ācinato dukkhaṃ,
ārā nibbānam'uccati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

tatra, bhikkhave, taramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi kilamati, cittam'pi upahaññati, saro'pi upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi āturīyati, avisaṭṭham'pi hoti aviññeyyaṃ taramānassa bhāsitaṃ.

Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

virajo ñatvā imaṃ parañ'ca lokaṃ,
jātimaraṇaṃ upātivatto,
samaṇo tādi pavuccate tath'attā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

na brāhmaṇassa paraneyyam'atthi,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
tasmā vivādāni upātivatto,
na hi seṭṭhato passati dhammam'aññaṃ.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
upātivattati 1

Construction upa + ati + vatta + ti
Sanskrit upa + ativṛt
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

sace kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattissasi, seyyathā'pi nāma puriso siriṃ āgacchantiṃ daṇḍena paṭippaṇāmeyya ... evaṃ sampadam'idaṃ, bhikkhu, tuyhaṃ bhavissati.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

sace kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattissasi, seyyathā'pi nāma puriso siriṃ āgacchantiṃ daṇḍena paṭippaṇāmeyya ... evaṃ sampadam'idaṃ, bhikkhu, tuyhaṃ bhavissati.

Sanskrit upa + ativṛt
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

na maṃ tvaṃ, pāpima, hit'ānukampī evaṃ vadesi, ahit'ānukampī maṃ tvaṃ, pāpima, evaṃ vadesi. tuyhañ'hi, pāpima, evaṃ hoti, yesaṃ samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ desessati, te me visayaṃ upātivattissantī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upātivatti

aor. (+acc) went beyond; overstepped; transgressed [upa + ati + √vatt + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upātivattati, trans (+acc)
Meaning went beyond; overstepped; transgressed
Root Family upa ati √vatt
Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)
Construction upa + ati + √vatt + i
Sanskrit upa + ativṛt
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

taṃ t'āhaṃ, bhikkhu, evaṃ vadāmi, iṅgha tvaṃ, mārisa, yadeva te brahmā āha tadeva tvaṃ karohi, mā tvaṃ brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattittho.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
upādā 1

ger. (+acc) holding (on); grasping (on); attaching; clinging; taking possession (of); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ~

Grammar ger of upādiyati, irreg form of upādāya, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning holding (on); grasping (on); attaching; clinging; taking possession (of); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya > upādā
Phonetic Change ādāya > ādā (contraction)
Antonym anupādā
Variant upādāya
Commentary (SNa) upādāparitassanan'ti gahaṇena uppannaṃ paritassanaṃ.
Sanskrit upādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
upādā 2

ind. secondary; derivative; accessory; lit. taking up [upa + √ādā + ya] ~

Grammar ind, adv, abbrev of upādāya
Meaning secondary; derivative; accessory; lit. taking up
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya > upādā
Phonetic Change ādāya > ādā (contraction)
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
upādāna 1

nt. fuel (for fire); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from upādiyati
Meaning fuel (for fire); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym anupādāna
Sanskrit upādāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

laddhā hi so upādānaṃ,
mahā hutvāna pāvako,
so āsajja ḍahe bālaṃ,
naraṃ nāriñ'ca ekadā.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ kho, vaccha, samaye acci vātena khittā dūram'pi gacchati, tam'ahaṃ vāta-upādānaṃ paññāpemi. vāto hi'ssa, vaccha, tasmiṃ samaye upādānaṃ hotī'ti.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
upādāna 2

nt. acquiring; appropriating; taking possession; grasping; clinging; identifying; lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from upādiyati
Meaning acquiring; appropriating; taking possession; grasping; clinging; identifying; lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym anupādāna
Commentary (SNa) upādānan'ti daḷhaggahaṇaṃ vuccati. daḷh'attho hi ettha upasaddo upāyāsaupakaṭṭh'ādīsu viya. pañcakāmaguṇikarāgass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. ayam'ettha saṅkhepo.
Sanskrit upādāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

pañcasu kho, nāgita, upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassino viharato upādāne pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti, eso tassa nissando'ti.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ

upādāniye ca, bhikkhave, dhamme desessāmi upādānañ'ca. taṃ suṇātha. katame ca, bhikkhave, upādāniyā dhammā, katamaṃ upādānaṃ?

SN 22.121 upādāniyasuttaṃ
upādāna 3

adj. related to fuel; lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ana] ~

Grammar adj, in comps, from upādiyati
Meaning related to fuel; lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit upādāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
upādānakkhandha

masc. pile of fuel (for the fire); heap of acquisition; physical and mental conglomerations that are clung to; pile of matter and mind that are held onto as a self; grasping group; lit. mass of taking near [upādāna + khandha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning pile of fuel (for the fire); heap of acquisition; physical and mental conglomerations that are clung to; pile of matter and mind that are held onto as a self; grasping group; lit. mass of taking near
Construction upādāna + khandha
Compound kammadhāraya (upādāna + khandha)
Commentary (KPa) tattha pañcā'ti gaṇanaparicchedo. upādānajanitā upādānajanakā vā khandhā upādānakkhandhā. yaṃkiñci rūpaṃ, vedanā, saññā, saṅkhārā, viññāṇañ'ca sāsavā upādāniyā, etesam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit upādāna + skandha

so evaṃ pajānāti, evañ'hi kira imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ saṅgaho sannipāto samavāyo hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

pañcasu kho pana upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassī viharati, iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅ'gamo. iti vedanā, iti vedanāya samudayo, iti vedanāya atthaṅ'gamo.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
upādānakkhandhasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.179 (SN45.179) ✗
upādānakkhandhasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.66 (AN9.66) ✗
upādānakkhaya

masc. wearing away of grasping; ending of clinging; extinction of attachment; lit. exhaustion of taking near [upādāna + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away of grasping; ending of clinging; extinction of attachment; lit. exhaustion of taking near
Construction upādāna + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upādānassa + khaya)
Sanskrit upādāna + kṣaya

tasmā upādānakkhayā,
samma'd'aññāya paṇḍitā,
jātikkhayaṃ abhiññāya,
na gacchanti punabbhavan'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti, nekkhamm'ādhimutto hoti, pavivek'ādhimutto hoti, abyāpajj'ādhimutto hoti, taṇhākkhay'ādhimutto hoti, upādānakkhay'ādhimutto hoti, asammoh'ādhimutto hoti.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
upādānakkhayādhimutta

adj. habituated to the destruction of ownership; established in the destruction of possession; firmly entrenched in extinction of attachment [upādānakkhaya + adhimutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning habituated to the destruction of ownership; established in the destruction of possession; firmly entrenched in extinction of attachment
Construction upādānakkhaya + adhimutta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (upādānakkhayaṃ + adhimutta)
Commentary (ANa) upādānakkhayante uppannattā upādānakkhayo
Sanskrit upādāna + kṣaya + adhimukta

so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti, nekkhamm'ādhimutto hoti, pavivek'ādhimutto hoti, abyāpajj'ādhimutto hoti, taṇhākkhay'ādhimutto hoti, upādānakkhay'ādhimutto hoti, asammoh'ādhimutto hoti.

upādānagata

nt. type of acquisition; kind of appropriation; identification of a sort; lit. taking near gone [upādāna + gata] ✓

hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā'ti kho, bhikkhu, taṇhāgatam'etaṃ ... saññāgatam'etaṃ ... maññitam'etaṃ ... papañcitam'etaṃ ... upādānagatam'etaṃ ...

Sanskrit upādāna + nirodha

vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho, taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ

tassa me upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti, evam'etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa nirodho hotī'ti.

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako upādānañ'ca pajānāti, upādānasamudayañ'ca pajānāti, upādānanirodhañ'ca pajānāti, upādānanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

upādāniya

adj. graspable; which could be clung to; which can be used for fuel; which can be taken possession of; lit. to be taken near [upa + √ādā + aniya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of upādiyati

Sanskrit upādānīya

rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, upādāniyo dhammo, yo tattha chandarāgo, taṃ tattha upādānaṃ.

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, upādāniyesu dhammesu ādīnav'ānupassino viharato taṇhā nirujjhati.

upādāparitassanāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.7 (SN22.7) ✗
upādāya 1

ger. (+acc) taking; taking up; grasping (onto); taking possession (of); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking; taking up; grasping (onto); taking possession (of); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya
Antonym anupādāya
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

puṇṇo nāma, āvuso, āyasmā mantāṇiputto amhākaṃ navakānaṃ sataṃ bah'ūpakāro hoti. so amhe iminā ovādena ovadati, upādāya, āvuso ānanda, asmī'ti hoti, no anupādāya.

SN 22.83 ānandasuttaṃ

yaṃ kho, bhikkhu, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
upādāya 2

ind. (+gen) derived (from); dependent (on); based (on); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, ger of upādiyati, trans (+gen)
Meaning derived (from); dependent (on); based (on); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya
Antonym anupādāya
Commentary (SNa) upādāyā'ti tāni'y'eva ca upādāya āgamma paṭicca pavattati.
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, nāmarūpaṃ? vedanā, saññā, cetanā, phasso, manasikāro, idaṃ vuccati nāmaṃ. cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

chasu loko samuppanno,
chasu kubbati santhavaṃ,
channam'eva upādāya,
chasu loko vihaññatī'ti.

SN 1.70 lokasuttaṃ
upādāya 3

ind. (+acc) on account (of); because (of); with reference (to); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ✓

Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

sādhu vata maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī'ti kalyāṇakamyataṃ upādāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ

VIN PAT NP 8 paṭhamaupakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

na sūpaṃ vā byañjanaṃ vā odanena paṭicchādessāmi bhiyyokamyataṃ upādāyā'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 36 odanappaṭicchādanasikkhāpadaṃ
upādāya 4

ind. (+acc) according (to); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, ger of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning according (to); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + ya
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ

Construction upa + √ādā + ya
Sanskrit upādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

pāpakaṃ nāma jīvitaṃ aḍḍhānaṃ jīvitaṃ upādāya daliddānaṃ jīvitaṃ pāpakaṃ lāmakaṃ, sadhanānaṃ jīvitaṃ upādāya adhanānaṃ jīvitaṃ pāpakaṃ, devānaṃ jīvitaṃ upādāya manussānaṃ jīvitaṃ pāpakaṃ.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upādāyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.105 (SN35.105) ✗
upādāyupādāya

Grammar ind, comp
Meaning continuously; successively; repeatedly; lit. taking up, taking up
Construction upādāya + upādāya
Sanskrit upādāya + upādāya

te maṃ catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ upādāy'upādāya pañhaṃ puccheyyuṃ, puṭṭho puṭṭho c'āhaṃ tesaṃ byākareyyaṃ, byākatañ'ca me byākatato dhāreyyuṃ, na ca maṃ dutiyakaṃ uttari paṭipuccheyyuṃ.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
upādi

masc. what is grasped; fuel of existence; what is taken possession (of); lit. taken near [upa + √ādā + i] ✓

Grammar masc, from upādiyati
Meaning what is grasped; fuel of existence; what is taken possession (of); lit. taken near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā + i
Derivative kita (i)
Sanskrit upādāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

evaṃ sammā dvayat'ānupassino kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appamattassa ātāpino pahit'attassa viharato dvinnaṃ phalānaṃ aññataraṃ phalaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, diṭṭh'eva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bahū ce'pi bhikkhū anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyanti, na tena nibbānadhātuyā ūnattaṃ vā pūrattaṃ vā paññāyati

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
upādiṇṇa

pp. clung-to [upa + √ādā] ✗
upādinna 1

pp. grasped; clung to; attached to; taken as mine; taken possession (of); lit. taken near [upa + √ādā + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upādiyati
Meaning grasped; clung to; attached to; taken as mine; taken possession (of); lit. taken near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā > ādī + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ā > ī
īn > inn
Antonym anupādinna
Commentary (MNa) upādinnan'tiādinnaṃ gahitaṃ parāmaṭṭhaṃ, sarīr'aṭṭhakan'ti attho.
Sanskrit upātta
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

so rūpaṃ viññāṇaṃ upeti upādiyati adhiṭṭhāti attā me'ti. tass'ime pañc'upādānakkhandhā upetā upādinnā dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci, rāhula, ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ kakkhaḷaṃ kharigataṃ upādinnaṃ … yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ kakkhaḷaṃ kharigataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā pathavīdhātu

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
upādinna 2

pp. (of a legal dispute) taken up; lit. taken near [upa + √ādā + na] ✓

Grammar pp of upādiyati
Meaning (of a legal dispute) taken up; lit. taken near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction upa + √ādā > ādī + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ā > ī
īn > inn
Antonym anupādinna
Sanskrit upātta
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā aññabhāgiyañ'c'eva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti kocideso lesamatto upādinno, bhikkhu ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 9 aññabhāgiyasikkhāpadaṃ

koci deso lesamatto upādinno'ti tesaṃ dasannaṃ lesānaṃ aññataro leso upādinno hoti.

VIN 1.2.9 dutiyaduṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
upādiyati

pr. (+acc) grasps; holds (onto); clings (to); takes possession (of); lit. takes near [upa + √ādā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasps; holds (onto); clings (to); takes possession (of); lit. takes near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction upa + ādiya + ti
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym nikkhipati
Commentary (ANa) na kiñci loke upādiyatī'ti kiñci ekam'pi saṅkhāragataṃ taṇhāvasena na upādiyati na gaṇhāti na parāmasati.
Notes passive in form, active in meaning.
Sanskrit upādatte
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

na kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, ettāvatā saupavajjo'ti vadāmi. yo kho, sāriputta, tañ'ca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, aññañ'ca kāyaṃ upādiyati, tam'ahaṃ saupavajjo'ti vadāmi.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

so evaṃ asamanupassanto na kiñci loke upādiyati, anupādiyaṃ na paritassati, aparitassaṃ paccattaññ'eva parinibbāyati.

SN 35.234 udāyīsuttaṃ
upādiyanta

prp. (+acc) grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction upa + ādiya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Sanskrit upādāyat
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

anissito na calati,
nissito ca upādiyaṃ,
itthabhāv'aññathābhāvaṃ,
saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

taṃ, bhikkhave, attavād'upādānaṃ upādiyetha, yaṃsa attavād'upādānaṃ upādiyato na uppajjeyyuṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
upādiyamāna

prp. (+acc) grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near [upa + √ādā + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction upa + ādiya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Notes passive in form, active in meaning.
Sanskrit upādīyamāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto vihareyyan'ti. upādiyamāno kho, bhikkhu, baddho mārassa, anupādiyamāno mutto pāpimato'ti.

SN 22.63 upādiyamānasuttaṃ

ahañ'hi rūpaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, vedanaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saññaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saṅkhāreyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, viññāṇaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
upādiyamānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.63 (SN22.63) ✗
upādiyi

aor. (+acc) grasped; held (onto); clung (to); took possession (of); lit. took near [upa + √ādā + ya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of upādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning grasped; held (onto); clung (to); took possession (of); lit. took near
Root Family upa √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction upa + ādiya + i
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Sanskrit upādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

bhav'ev'āhaṃ bhayaṃ disvā,
bhavañ'ca vibhav'esinaṃ,
bhavaṃ n'ābhivadiṃ kiñci,
nandiñ'ca na upādiyin'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

ahañ'hi rūpaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, vedanaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saññaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saṅkhāreyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, viññāṇaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
upādiyitvā

abs. having grasped hold (of); having clung (to); having taken possession (of) [upa + √ādā] ✗

masc. remnant of grasping; remaining fuel of existence [upādi + sesa] ✓

Construction upādi + sesa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (upādissa + sesa)
Antonym anupādisesa

evaṃ sammā dvayat'ānupassino kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appamattassa ātāpino pahit'attassa viharato dvinnaṃ phalānaṃ aññataraṃ phalaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, diṭṭh'eva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bahū ce'pi bhikkhū anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyanti, na tena nibbānadhātuyā ūnattaṃ vā pūrattaṃ vā paññāyati

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
upāya 1

masc. means; method; way [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upeti
Meaning means; method; way
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > āy + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > āy
Sanskrit upāya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

upāyakusalen'āhaṃ,
buddhen'ādiccabandhunā
yoniso paṭipajjitvā,
bhave cittaṃ udabbahin'ti.

TH 139 nandattheragāthā

evaṃ taṃ puggalaṃ karuṇāyitvā tato paraṃ eten'eva upāyena piyapuggale, tato majjhatte, tato verimhī'ti anukkamena karuṇā pavattetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
upāya 2

masc. (+loc) attraction (to); interest (in); engagement (with); attachment (to); lit. going near [upa + √i + *a] ✓

Meaning attraction (to); interest (in); engagement (with); attachment (to); lit. going near

Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction upa + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym anupāya
Commentary (MNa) taṇhādiṭṭhiyo hi tebhūmakadhamme upentī'ti upāyā
Sanskrit upāya (approach)
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

viññāṇaṃ kho ahaṃ, āvuso, abalaṃ virāgunaṃ anassāsikan'ti viditvā ye viññāṇe upāy'ūpādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā tesaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā vimuttaṃ me cittan'ti pajānāmi.

upāyakosalla

nt. skill in means; skill in expedience ✗
upāyāsa

masc. affliction; difficulty; trouble [upa + ā + √yas + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning affliction; difficulty; trouble
Root Family upa ā √yas
Root √yas×3 ya (strive, struggle)
Construction upa + ā + √yas > yās + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anupāyāsa
Sanskrit upāyāsa (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √yas 1, 3, 4 (be heated)

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco kulaputto saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, otiṇṇo'mhi jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, dukkh'otiṇṇo dukkhapareto.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā sambhavanti

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
upāyāsabahula

adj. full of difficulty; very afflicted; greatly troubled [upāyāsa + bahula] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of difficulty; very afflicted; greatly troubled
Construction upāyāsa + bahula
Compound kammadhāraya (upāyāsa + bahula)
Sanskrit upāyāsa (bsk) + bahula

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ

idha, mallike, ekacco mātugāmo kodhanā hoti upāyāsabahulā. appam'pi vuttā samānā abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
upāyāsitatta

Meaning affliction; adversity; lit. troubled state

Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym āyāsitatta
Sanskrit upāyāsa (bsk)

katamo ca, bhikkhave, upāyāso? yo kho, bhikkhave, aññatar'aññatarena byasanena samannāgatassa aññatar'aññatarena dukkhadhammena phuṭṭhassa āyāso upāyāso āyāsitattaṃ upāyāsitattaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, upāyāso

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
upāyupādāna

nt. involvement and holding on to ✗
upāyupādānābhinivesavinibandha

adj. attached to engaging, grasping and clinging; shackled to going near, grabbing and holding [upāya + upādāna + abhinivesa + vinibandha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attached to engaging, grasping and clinging; shackled to going near, grabbing and holding
Construction upāya + upādāna + abhinivesa + vinibandha
Compound dvanda (upāya ca upādāna ca abhinivesa ca vinibandha ca)
Variant upayupādānābhinivesavinibandha
Commentary (SNa) upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho'ti upayehi ca upādānehi ca abhinivesehi ca vinibandho. tattha upayā'ti dve upayā taṇh'upayo ca diṭṭh'upayo ca. upādān'ādīsu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit upāya + upādāna + abhiniveśa + vinibandha

upāy'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

upāyūpādāna

masc. engaging and grasping; approaching and clinging; going near and grabbing hold [upāya + upādāna] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning engaging and grasping; approaching and clinging; going near and grabbing hold
Construction upāya + upādāna
Compound dvanda (upāya ca upādāna ca)
Variant upayupādāna, upāyupādāna
Sanskrit upāya + upādāna

viññāṇaṃ kho ahaṃ, āvuso, abalaṃ virāgunaṃ anassāsikan'ti viditvā ye viññāṇe upāy'ūpādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā tesaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā vimuttaṃ me cittan'ti pajānāmi.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
upāyena

ind. skillfully; in the right way; by a stratagem [upa + √i] ✗
upāraddha

pp. criticized; challenged, confuted [upa + ā + √rabh] ✗
upārambha

masc. criticism; accusation; conflict; condemnation [upa + ā + √rabh + a + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from upārambhati
Meaning criticism; accusation; conflict; condemnation
Root Family upa ā √rabh
Root √rabh･1 a (be aroused, violent)
Base √rabh + a > rabha > rambha (irreg)
Construction upa + ā + rambha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit upārambha
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

te'p'ime tayo niruttipathe adhivacanapathe paññattipathe na garahitabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ amaññiṃsu. taṃ kissa hetu? nindā-ghaṭṭana-byārosa-upārambha-bhayā'ti.

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

upārambhaṃ na sikkheyya,
khalitañ'ca na gāhaye,
n'ābhihare n'ābhimadde,
na vācaṃ payutaṃ bhaṇe.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
upārambhakacitta

Sanskrit upārambha + citta

bhiyyo bhiyyo pavaḍḍhati,
upārambhakacitto ca,
saddhammaṃ sotum'icchati.

AN 7.29 dutiyaparihānisuttaṃ
upārambhacitta

Commentary (ANa) upārambhacitto'ti niggahāropanacitto.
Sanskrit upārambha + citta
upārambhacittatā

fem. fact of having a fault-finding mind; fact of having a critical attitude [upārambha + cittatā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of having a fault-finding mind; fact of having a critical attitude
Construction upārambha + cittatā
Commentary (ADHa) upārambhacittatā'ti upārambhacittabhāvo. yasmā pana so atthato upārambho'va hoti, tasmā taṃ dassetuṃ tattha katamo upārambho'tiādi vuttaṃ. (ADHt) parassa dos'āropane randhagavesitāsaṅkhāto upārambho'va upārambhacittatā nāma.
Sanskrit upārambha + cittatā

ariyānaṃ adassanakamyataṃ appahāya, ariyadhammassa asotu'kamyataṃ appahāya, upārambhacittataṃ appahāya, ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo dhamme appahāya abhabbo muṭṭhasaccaṃ pahātuṃ asampajaññaṃ pahātuṃ cetaso vikkhepaṃ pahātuṃ.

AN 10.76 tayodhammasuttaṃ
upārambhati

pr. criticizes, finds fault; challenges, confutes [upa + ā + √rabh] ✗

te upārambh'ānisaṃsā c'eva dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti itivādappamokkh'ānisaṃsā ca. yassa c'atthāya dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti tañ'c'assa atthaṃ n'ānubhonti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
upāli 1

masc. name of a layman ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a layman
Sanskrit upāli

aṭṭhānaṃ kho etaṃ, tapassi, anavakāso yaṃ upāli gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakattaṃ upagaccheyya. ṭhānañ'ca kho etaṃ vijjati yaṃ samaṇo gotamo upālissa gahapatissa sāvakattaṃ upagaccheyya.

tena kho pana samayena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto mahatiyā gihiparisāya saddhiṃ nisinno hoti bālakiniyā parisāya upālipamukhāya.

upālisutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.31 (AN10.31) ✗
upālisutta 3

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.99 (AN10.99) ✗
upāvisi

aor. took a seat; sat down [upa + √vis] ✗
upāsaka

masc. lay disciple; lay devotee; lit. who sits near [upa + √ās + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from upāsati
Meaning lay disciple; lay devotee; lit. who sits near
Root Family upa √ās
Root √ās･1 a (sit)
Construction upa + √ās + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Sanskrit upāsaka
Sanskrit Root √ās 2 (sit)

pañc'imā, bhikkhave, vaṇijjā upāsakena akaraṇīyā. katamā pañca? satthavaṇijjā, sattavaṇijjā, maṃsavaṇijjā, majjavaṇijjā, visavaṇijjā.

AN 5.177 vaṇijjāsuttaṃ

addasā kho aññataro upāsako taṃ bhikkhuṃ kīṭāgirismiṃ piṇḍāya carantaṃ. disvāna yena so bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ abhivādetvā etadavoca, api, bhante, piṇḍo labbhatī'ti?

masc. Chapter 2 of the Brāhmaṇasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 1 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗

masc. Chapter 18 of Pañcakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.171-180 ✗

nt. synonym for a layperson [upāsaka + vevacana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning synonym for a layperson
Construction upāsaka + vevacana
Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.
upāsakasatāni

nt. one hundred lay disciples; one hundred lay devotees [upāsaka + sata + āni] ✓

Grammar nt pl, comp
Meaning one hundred lay disciples; one hundred lay devotees
Construction upāsaka + sata + āni
upāsakasata + āni
Compound digu (upāsakā + satāni)
Commentary (ANa) pañcamattehi upāsakasatehī'ti sot'āpanna-sakadāgāmīnaṃ'y'eva ariyasāvakaupāsakānaṃ pañcahi satehi parivuto bhuttapātarāso gandhamālavilepenacuṇṇāni gahetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami.
Sanskrit upāsaka + śatāni

atha kho āyasmā puṇṇo ten'ev'antaravassena pañcamattāni upāsakasatāni paṭivedesi. ten'ev'antaravassena pañcamattāni upāsikāsatāni paṭivedesi. ten'ev'antaravassena tisso vijjā sacchākāsi. ten'ev'antaravassena parinibbāyi.

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ

atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati pañcamattehi upāsakasatehi parivuto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

AN 5.176 pītisuttaṃ
upāsakasutta

nt. Udāna 15 (UD 15) ✗
upāsati

pr. attends or serve; sits at the feet (of) [upa + √ās] ✗
upāsana 1

nt. training; military training; apprenticeship; lit. sitting near [upa + √ās + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from upāsati

Root Family upa √ās
Root √ās･1 a (sit)
Construction upa + √ās + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit upāsana
Sanskrit Root √ās 2 (sit)

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kata-upāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

kaliṅgar'ūpadhānā, bhikkhave, eta'r'ahi licchavī viharanti appamattā ātāpino upāsanasmiṃ. tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.

Sanskrit Root √ās 2 (sit)

yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī so tathāgataṃ sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati paramāya pūjāya.

saddhāya sīlena ca yā'dha vaḍḍhati,
paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.

samās'antagatānaṃ nāmānam'anto saro kvaci akāro hoti. devānaṃ rājā devarājo, devarājā, devānaṃ sakhā devasakho, devasakhā, pañca ahāni pañc'āhaṃ, satt'āhaṃ, pañcagavaṃ, chatt'upāhanaṃ, upasaradaṃ, visāl'akkho, vimukho.

avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā, app'eva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇa-upāhanaṃ anujāneyya

na upāhan'āruḷhassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 62 upāhanasikkhāpadaṃ

na upāhan'āruḷhassa agilānassa dhammo desetabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca akkantassa vā paṭimukkassa vā omukkassa vā agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ
upekkha

adj. disinterested, unaffected [upa + √ikkh] ✗
upekkhaka

adj. mental poised; mentally balanced; equanimous; non-reactive; looking on; disregarding; lit. onlooker [upa + √ikkh + a + ā + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from upekkhā
Meaning mental poised; mentally balanced; equanimous; non-reactive; looking on; disregarding; lit. onlooker
Root Family upa √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Base √ikkh + a > ikkha
Construction upa + ikkha + ā + ka
upekkhā + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym samacitta
Commentary (MNa) upekkhako'ti chaḷaṅgupekkhāya upekkhako.
Sanskrit upekṣaka
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

upekkhako vihareyyaṃ sato sampajāno'ti

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ

vissajja ganthāni mun'īdha loke,
vivādajātesu na vaggasārī,
santo asantesu upekkhako so,
anuggaho uggahaṇanti m'aññe.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
upekkhati

pr. looks on; is not interested; is indifferent [upa + √ikkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning looks on; is not interested; is indifferent
Root Family upa √ikkh
Root √ikkh･1 a (see, mark)
Base √ikkh + a > ikkha
Construction upa + ikkha + ti
Phonetic Change upekkhatī with metrically lengthened ī
Sanskrit upīkṣate
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

phassena phuṭṭho na sukhena majje,
dukkhena phuṭṭho'pi na sampavedhe,
phassadvayaṃ sukhadukkhe upekkhe,
anānuruddho aviruddha kenaci.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

na brāhmaṇo kappam'upeti saṅkhā,
na diṭṭhisārī na'pi ñāṇabandhu,
ñatvā ca so sammutiyo puthujjā,
upekkhatī uggahaṇanti m'aññe.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
upekkhā

Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ upekkhā'ti

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ

upekkhaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. upekkhañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo paṭigho so pahīyissati.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
upekkhāvihārī

adj. living in a state of equanimity; dwelling with perfect mental poise; lit. living with looking on [upekkhā + vihārī] ✓

Sanskrit upekṣā + vihārin

evaṃ, bhante. sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, brahmā upekkhāvihārī'ti. taṃ me idaṃ, bhante, bhagavā sakkhidiṭṭho, bhagavā hi, bhante, upekkhāvihārī'ti.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
upekkhāvedaniya

adj. neutral; serving as a basis for mental poise; lit. to be felt equanimously [upekkhā + vedaniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning neutral; serving as a basis for mental poise; lit. to be felt equanimously
Construction upekkhā + vedaniya
Commentary (SNt) evaṃ rūpā ca manāpā upekkhāvedaniyā'ti etthā'pi yath'ārahaṃ vattabbaṃ.
upekkhāsatipārisuddhi

adj. which possesses purification of awareness by equanimity [upekkhā + sati + pārisuddhi] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which possesses purification of awareness by equanimity
Construction upekkhā + sati + pārisuddhi
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upekkhāya + satipārisuddhi)
Commentary (VINa) upekkhāsatipārisuddhin'ti upekkhāya janitasatipārisuddhiṃ. imasmiñ'hi jhāne suparisuddhā sati. yā ca tassā satiyā pārisuddhi, sā upekkhāya katā na aññena, tasmā etaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhin'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit upekṣā + smṛti + pariśuddhi

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubb'eva somanassadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā adukkham'asukhaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako imaṃ'y'eva anuttaraṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ āgamma anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarati, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo ...

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
upekkhāsatisaṃsuddha

nt. awareness perfectly purified by equanimity; (comm) perfectly purified equanimity and awareness [upekkhā + sati + saṃsuddha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning awareness perfectly purified by equanimity; (comm) perfectly purified equanimity and awareness
Construction upekkhā + sati + saṃsuddha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upekkhāya + satisaṃsuddha)
Commentary (ANa) upekkhāsatisaṃsuddhan'ti catutthajjhānike phale uppannāya upekkhāya ca satiyā ca saṃsuddhaṃ.
Sanskrit upekṣā + smṛti + saṃśuddha

upekkhāsatisaṃsuddhaṃ,
dhammatakkapurejavaṃ,
aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūmi,
avijjāya pabhedanan'ti.

AN 3.33 sāriputtasuttaṃ
upekkhāsambojjhaṅga

masc. equanimity as an element of awakening; mental poise as a factor of enlightenment [upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning equanimity as an element of awakening; mental poise as a factor of enlightenment
Construction upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga
Compound kammadhāraya (upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga)
Sanskrit upekṣā + sambodhyaṅga

yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti, upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṭṭhāniya

adj. serving as a basis for equanimity as an element of awakening; giving support to mental poise as a factor of enlightenment [upekkhāsambojjhaṅga + ṭhāniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning serving as a basis for equanimity as an element of awakening; giving support to mental poise as a factor of enlightenment
Construction upekkhāsambojjhaṅga + ṭhāniya
upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṭṭhānīya

adj. which supports equanimity as an element of awakening; serving as a basis for mental poise as a factor of enlightenment [upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga + ṭhānīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which supports equanimity as an element of awakening; serving as a basis for mental poise as a factor of enlightenment
Construction upekkhā + sambojjhaṅga + ṭhānīya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa + ṭhānīya)
Commentary (SNa) upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgaṭṭhānīyā'ti upekkhāya ārammaṇadhammā, atthato pana majjhatt'ākāro upekkhāṭṭhānīyā dhammo'ti veditabbo.
Sanskrit upekṣā + sambodhyaṅga + sthānīya

atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgaṭṭhānīyā dhammā. tattha yonisomanasikārabahulīkāro, ayam'āhāro anuppannassa vā upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ
upekkhāsahagata

adj. mentally balanced; full of equanimity; lit. going along with looking on [upekkha + sahagata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning mentally balanced; full of equanimity; lit. going along with looking on
Construction upekkha + sahagata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (upekkhāya + sahagata)
Sanskrit upekṣā + sahagata

so upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

imaṃ samādhiṃ savitakkam'pi savicāraṃ bhāveyyāsi, avitakkam'pi vicāramattaṃ bhāveyyāsi, avitakkam'pi avicāraṃ bhāveyyāsi, sappītikam'pi bhāveyyāsi, nippītikam'pi bhāveyyāsi, sātasahagatam'pi bhāveyyāsi, upekkhāsahagatam'pi bhāveyyāsi.

Sanskrit upekṣā + sukha

tassa yā purimā samādhija-pītisukha-sukhumasacca-saññā, sā nirujjhati. upekkhāsukha-sukhumasacca-saññā tasmiṃ samaye hoti, upekkhāsukha-sukhumasacca-saññī'y'eva tasmiṃ samaye hoti.

DN 9.3 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, sahetukasaññuppādanirodhakathā

sati ca sampajaññañ'ca,
caraṇā nāgassa tepare,
saddhāhattho mahānāgo,
upekkhāsetadantavā.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
upekkhi

aor. was indifferent [upa + √ikkh] ✗

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
upecca 1

ger. (+acc) approaching; arriving (at); coming towards [upa + √i + a + tya] ✓

Grammar ger of upeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning approaching; arriving (at); coming towards
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction upa + e + tya
Phonetic Change i > e
ty > cc
Sanskrit upetya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

sace ca pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
karissatha karotha vā,
na vo dukkhā pamuty'atthi,
upecca'pi palāyatan'ti.

UD 44 kumārakasuttaṃ

tuvañ'ca bhante anukampakaṃ viduṃ,
upecca vandiṃ kusalañ'ca pucchisaṃ,
tato te ucchussa adāsi khaṇḍikaṃ,
pasannacitā atulāya pītiyā'ti.

VV 30 ucchudāyikā vimānavatthu
upecca 2

ger. (+acc) following [upa + √i] ✗
upeta 1

pp. (+instr) endowed (with); possessed (of); having; lit. approached [upa + √i + a + ta] ✓

Root √i･1 a (come, go)

Construction upa + e + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym apeta, durūpeta
Sanskrit upeta
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

saccena danto damasā upeto,
vedantagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
yaññ'opanīto tam'upavhayetha,
kālena so juhati dakkhiṇeyye'ti.

yo ca vantakasāvassa,
sīlesu susamāhito,
upeto damasaccena,
sa ve kāsāvam'arahati.

anagāriy'upetassa,
bhikkhācariyaṃ jigīsato,
muni pabrūhi me puṭṭho,
moneyyaṃ uttamaṃ padaṃ.

middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca,
niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,
mahāvarāho'va nivāpapuṭṭho,
punappunaṃ gabbham'upeti mando.

tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ,
anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi,
adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabban'ti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
upesi

aor. approached, obtained [upa + √i] ✗
upehiti

nisīditvā tathāgato,
tattha pāyāsaṃ paggayha,
nerañjaram'upehiti.

nerañjarāya tīramhi,
pāyāsaṃ ada so jino,
paṭiyattavaramaggena,
bodhimūlam'upehiti.

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā

khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava,
niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo,
dibbaṃ ariyabhūmiṃ upehisi.

DHP 236 malavaggo

muñca pure muñca pacchato,
majjhe muñca bhavassa pāragū,
sabbattha vimuttamānaso,
na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi.

DHP 348 taṇhāvaggo

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītināgasahassāni ahesuṃ sovaṇṇ'ālaṅkārāni sovaṇṇaddhajāni hemajālapaṭicchannāni uposathanāgarājappamukhāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

esaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā nāgasahassānaṃ eko'y'eva so nāgo hoti yam'ahaṃ tena samayena abhiruhāmi, uposatho nāgarājā.

uposathakamma

nt. (vinaya) performance of the observance day ceremony [uposatha + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (vinaya) performance of the observance day ceremony
Construction uposatha + kamma
Compound kammadhāraya (uposatha + kamma)
Sanskrit upavasatha + karman

ettāni cattāri vattāni sammajjanakaraṇādīni saṅghasannipatato paṭhamaṃ kattabbatā, uposathassa uposathakammassa pubbakaraṇan'ti vuccati. pubbakaraṇānī'ti akkhātāni.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
uposathakaraṇa

nt. performance of the observance day ceremony; doing the uposatha [uposatha + karaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning performance of the observance day ceremony; doing the uposatha
Construction uposatha + karaṇa
Sanskrit upavasatha + karaṇa

uposathakaraṇato pubbe navavidhaṃ pubbakiccaṃ kātabbaṃ hoti

PAT PK dhammayuttika-pubbakicca
