Grammar nt, comp
Meaning observance hall
Construction uposatha + agga
Compound kammadhāraya (uposathagga + agga)
Sanskrit upavasatha + agāra

imasmiṃ uposath'agge sannipatitānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā kittakā bhikkhū honti?

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
uposathanāgarājappamukha

adj. with Observance, king of the elephants, as foremost (among them) [uposatha + nāgarāja + pamukha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with Observance, king of the elephants, as foremost (among them)
Construction uposatha + nāgarāja + pamukha
Compound kammadhāraya (uposathanāgarāja + pamukha)
Sanskrit upavasatha + nāgarāja + pramukha

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītināgasahassāni ahesuṃ sovaṇṇ'ālaṅkārāni sovaṇṇaddhajāni hemajālapaṭicchannāni uposathanāgarājappamukhāni.

savanti sabbadhi sotā,
latā uppajja tiṭṭhati,
tañ'ca disvā lataṃ jātaṃ,
mūlaṃ paññāya chindatha.

DHP 340 taṇhāvaggo

tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti

Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

bhikkhuno pan'eva addhānamaggappaṭipannassa eḷakalomāni uppajjeyyuṃ, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbāni, paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni asante hārake.

Construction ud + pajja + māna

Phonetic Change d > p
dy > jj
Antonym nirujjhamāna, nuppajjamāna
Sanskrit utpadyamāna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

dukkham'eva uppajjamānaṃ uppajjati, dukkhaṃ nirujjhamānaṃ nirujjhatī'ti na kaṅkhati na vicikicchati aparapaccayā ñāṇam'ev'assa ettha hoti. ettāvatā kho, kaccāna, sammādiṭṭhi hoti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

sā kho pan'esā, bhikkhave, taṇhā kattha uppajjamānā uppajjati, kattha nivisamānā nivisati

Commentary (SNa) bījan'ti uppatantānaṃ sattavidhaṃ dhaññabījaṃ seṭṭhaṃ. tasmiñ'hi uggate janapado khemo hoti subhikkho. (SNt) uppatantānan'ti pathaviṃ bhinditvā uṭṭhahantānaṃ.

Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

kiṃsu nipatataṃ varaṃ,
kiṃsu pavajamānānaṃ,
kiṃsu pavadataṃ varan'ti.

bījaṃ uppatataṃ seṭṭhaṃ,
vuṭṭhi nipatataṃ varā,
gāvo pavajamānānaṃ,
putto pavadataṃ varo'ti.

rathaṃ bhantaṃ'va vāraye,
tam'ahaṃ sārathiṃ brūmi,
rasmiggāho itaro jano.

DHP 222 kodhavaggo

yo uppatitaṃ vineti kodhaṃ,
visaṭaṃ sappavisaṃ'va osadhehi,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

na uppathena gacchanto pathena gacchantassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 72 uppathenagamanasikkhāpadaṃ

na uppathena gacchantena pathena gacchantassa agilānassa dhammo desetabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca uppathena gacchanto pathena gacchantassa agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo

kiṃsu rattin'divakkhayo,
kiṃ malaṃ brahmacariyassa,
kiṃ sinānam'anodakan'ti.

SN 1.58 uppathasuttaṃ

rūpaṃ jīrati maccānaṃ,
nāmagottaṃ na jīrati,
rāgo uppatho'ti vuccati,
lobho dhammānaṃ paripantho,
vayo rattin'divakkhayo.

Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ud + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > p
d > n
Antonym anuppanna
Sanskrit utpanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

tass'idaṃ, bhikkhave, manussattaṃ laddhaṃ, tathāgato loke uppanno arahaṃ sammāsambuddho, tathāgatappavedito ca dhammavinayo loke dibbati.

SN 56.48 dutiyachiggaḷayugasuttaṃ

tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti.

d > n

adj. laden with fruit; full of fruit [uppanna + phala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning laden with fruit; full of fruit
Construction uppanna + phala
Compound kammadhāraya (uppanna + phala)
Variant upapannaphala
Commentary (MNa) upapannaphalan'ti phal'ūpapannaṃ bahuphalaṃ.
Sanskrit utpanna + phala

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre tibbo vanasaṇḍo. tatr'assa rukkho sampannaphalo ca uppannaphalo ca, na c'assu kānici phalāni bhūmiyaṃ patitāni.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
uppannuppanna

adj. whatever arisen; any appeared [uppanna + uppanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning whatever arisen; any appeared
Construction uppanna + uppanna
Compound dvanda (uppanna ca uppanna ca)
Sanskrit utpanna + utpanna

ayam'pi kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi bhāvito bahulīkato santo c'eva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppann'uppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ

uppann'uppannānaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ samathāya vūpasamāya sammukhāvinayo dātabbo, sativinayo dātabbo, amūḷhavinayo dātabbo, paṭiññāya kāretabbaṃ, yebhuyyasikā, tassapāpiyasikā, tiṇ'avatthārako'ti.

VIN PAT AS adhikaraṇasamathā
uppala 1

nt. lotus; water lilly ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning lotus; water lilly
Commentary (ANa) ettha ca setarattanīlesu yaṃkiñci uppalam'eva, ūnakasatapattaṃ puṇḍarīkaṃ, satapattaṃ padumaṃ. pattaniyamaṃ vā vinā'pi setaṃ padumaṃ, rattaṃ puṇḍarīkan'ti ayam'ettha vinicchayo.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nymphaea_nouchali
Sanskrit utpala

candanaṃ tagaraṃ v'āpi,
uppalaṃ atha vassikī,
etesaṃ gandhajātānaṃ,
sīlagandho anuttaro.

DHP 55 pupphavaggo

seyyathā'pi, vāhana, uppalaṃ vā padumaṃ vā puṇḍarīkaṃ vā udake jātaṃ udake saṃvaḍḍhaṃ udakā paccuggamma ṭhitaṃ anupalittaṃ udakena.

AN 10.81 vāhanasuttaṃ
uppala 2

card. 10⁹⁸ (20 sogandhika = 1 uppala) [uppala] ✗

uppalaka

adj. rending ✗
uppalagandha

masc. scent of lotus; lotus's perfume ✗
uppalagandhapaccatthika

masc. (comm) enemy human-sacrificer [uppala + gandha + paccatthika] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (comm) enemy human-sacrificer
Construction uppala + gandha + paccatthika
Commentary (VINa) gandhan'ti hadayaṃ vuccati, taṃ uppāṭentī'ti uppalagandhā, uppalagandhā eva paccatthikā uppalagandhapaccatthikā. ete kira na kasivaṇijjādīhi jīvanti, panthaghātagāmaghāt'ādīni katvā puttadāraṃ posenti. te kammasiddhiṃ patthayamānā devatānaṃ āyācetvā tāsaṃ balikamm'atthaṃ manussānaṃ hadayaṃ uppāṭenti. sabbakāle ca manussā dullabhā. bhikkhū pana araññe viharantā sulabhā honti. te sīlavantaṃ bhikkhuṃ gahetvā, sīlavato vadho nāma bhāriyo hotī'ti maññamānā tassa sīlavināsan'atthaṃ manuss'itthi'ādike vā ānenti, taṃ vā tattha nenti. ayam'ettha viseso.

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (comm) part of the Avīci hell where one must stay an uppala-count in duration
Construction uppala + niraya
Notes see abbuda 5

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning water lilly leaf; lotus leaf
Construction uppala + patta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (uppalassa + patta)
Sanskrit utpala + pattra

pahāraṃ dadeyyā'ti kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā antamaso uppalapattena'pi pahāraṃ deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.4 pahārasikkhāpadaṃ

talasattikaṃ uggireyyā'ti kāyaṃ vā kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ vā antamaso uppalapattam'pi uccāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.4 pahārasikkhāpadaṃ

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
uppalavaṇṇā

fem. name of a nun; lit. complexion of a lotus [uppala + vaṇṇa + ā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a nun; lit. complexion of a lotus
Construction uppala + vaṇṇa + ā
uppalavaṇṇa + ā
Commentary (VINa) uppalavaṇṇā'ti sā therī sāvatthiyaṃ seṭṭhidhītā satasahassakappe abhinīhārasampannā. tassā pakatiyā'pi atidassanīyā nīl'uppalavaṇṇā kāyacchavi, abbhantare pana kilesasantāpassa abhāvena ativiya virocati. sā tā'y'eva vaṇṇapokkharatāya uppalavaṇṇā'ti nāmaṃ labhi.

uppalavaṇṇāsutta

uppalasikhar'opamāni te,
vimale hāṭakasannibhe mukhe,
tava me nayanāni dakkhiya,
bhiyyo kāmaguṇo pavaḍḍhati.

tassa narassa adāsi tāva'd'e.

katamo eko dhammo uppādetabbo? akuppaṃ ñāṇaṃ. ayaṃ eko dhammo uppādetabbo.

Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (uppādetuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit utpadayitum + kāma

atha kho māro pāpimā uppalavaṇṇāya bhikkhuniyā bhayaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃsaṃ uppādetu'kāmo samādhimhā cāvetu'kāmo yena uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī ten'upasaṅkami

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ
uppādetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to produce; to generate; to cause; to give rise to [ud + √pad + *e + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of uppādeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to produce; to generate; to cause; to give rise to
Root Family ud √pad
Root √pad･3 *e (go, step)
Base √pad + *e > pāde (caus)
Construction ud + pāde + tuṃ
Phonetic Change d > p
a > ā
Sanskrit utpadayitum
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

atha kho māro pāpimā uppalavaṇṇāya bhikkhuniyā bhayaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃsaṃ uppādetu'kāmo samādhimhā cāvetu'kāmo yena uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī ten'upasaṅkami

so sabbaso rāg'ānusayaṃ pahāya paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā asmī'ti diṭṭhimān'ānusayaṃ samūhanitvā avijjaṃ pahāya vijjaṃ uppādetvā diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti

niccaṃ ubbiggam'idaṃ mano,
anuppannesu kicchesu,
atho uppatitesu ca,
sace atthi anutrastaṃ,
taṃ me akkhāhi pucchito'ti.

jt > gg
Antonym anubbigga
Sanskrit udvigna
Sanskrit Root √vij 1, 6 (tremble)

so kho ahaṃ, bhante, evaṃ rakkhito gopito santo bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrāsī vihāsiṃ. eta'r'ahi kho pan'āhaṃ, bhante, araññagato'pi rukkhamūlagato'pi suññ'āgāragato'pi eko abhīto anubbiggo anussaṅkī anutrāsī app'ossukko pannalomo paradattavutto, migabhūtena cetasā viharāmi.

UD20 bhaddiyasuttaṃ

ubbiggā tasitā bhītā,
bhantā byāthitamānasā,
mahājanā samāgamma,
dīpaṅkaram'upāgamuṃ.

Construction ubbhaṭṭhaka + matta
Sanskrit ūrdhvasthiti + mātra

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, ubbhaṭṭhakassa ubbhaṭṭhakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, pariyāyabhattikassa pariyāyabhattikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, mantajjhāyakassa mantajjhāyakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
ubbhaṭṭhika

masc. ascetic who practices continuous standing; ascetic who practices self-immolation by standing upright ✗
ubbhaṇḍita

adj. loaded, burdened ✗
ubbhata 1

pp. (+abl) lifted up (from); pulled out (from) [ud + √dhar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of uddharati (+abl)
Meaning lifted up (from); pulled out (from)
Root Family ud √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction ud + √dhar > bhar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ddh > bbh
rt > t
Variant uddhaṭa
Sanskrit uddhata
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

vārijo'va thale khitto,
okam'okata'ubbhato,
pariphandat'idaṃ cittaṃ,
māradheyyaṃ pahātave.

DHP 34 cittavaggo

anupādiseso'ti maññamāno so evaṃ vadeyya, ambho purisa, ubbhataṃ kho te sallaṃ, apanīto visadoso anupādiseso.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

rt > t

Commentary (DNa) ubbhid'odako'ti ubbhinnaudako, na heṭṭhā ubbhijjitvā uggacchanakaudako. anto'y'eva pana ubbhijjanakaudako'ti attho

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakarahado ubbhit'odako. tassa n'ev'assa puratthimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ ... devo ca na kālena kālaṃ sammādhāraṃ anuppaveccheyya.

SN 3.17 attabyābādhasuttaṃ
ubhato

ind. (+gen) both; on both sides (of); in both ways; dually; lit. from both [ubha + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of ubha (+gen)
Meaning both; on both sides (of); in both ways; dually; lit. from both
Construction ubha + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Antonym ekato
Notes see SCPN §3
Sanskrit ubhayatas

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ubhato bhaṭṭho ubhato parihīno, seyyathā'pi sā gāvī pabbateyyā bālā abyattā akhettaññū akusalā visame pabbate carituṃ.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo ubhato sujāto hoti, mātito ca pitito ca. yassaṃ disāyaṃ aññe'pi bhaddā ass'ājānīyā jāyanti, tassaṃ disāyaṃ jāto hoti.

vuttaṃ kho pan'etaṃ bhagavatā kakac'ūpam'ovāde, ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya na me so tena sāsanakaro'ti.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo

Sanskrit ubhayataḥpakṣa

yassa kassaci, aggivessana, evaṃ ubhatopakkhaṃ uppannā'pi sukhā vedanā cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati abhāvitattā kāyassa, uppannā'pi dukkhā vedanā cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati abhāvitattā cittassa, evaṃ kho, aggivessana, abhāvitakāyo ca hoti abhāvitacitto ca.

upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṃ rajakaputtaṃ evaṃ vadehi, icchām'ahaṃ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṃ makkaṭacchāpakaṃ pīt'āvalepanaṃ nāma raṅgajātaṃ rajitaṃ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan'ti.

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

dhitipparaṃ kiṃ mama citta kāhisi,
na te alaṃ citta vas'ānuvattako,
na jātu bhastaṃ ubhatomukhaṃ chupe,
dhi'r'atthu pūraṃ nava sotasandaniṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

tatr'assa pallaṅko gonak'atthato paṭik'atthato paṭalik'atthato kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇo sauttaracchado ubhatolohitak'ūpadhāno

SNP 57 tissametteyya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 2
ubhaya

adj. both; referring to two things [ubha + ya] ✓

Meaning both; referring to two things
Construction ubha + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Notes see SCPN §3
Sanskrit ubhaya

tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha tato tvaṃ bāhiya n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

saddhāya sīlena ca yā'dha vaḍḍhati,
paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.

SN 37.34 vaḍḍhīsuttaṃ
ubhayato

ind. as to both; on both sides ✗
ubhayattha 1

ind. in both cases; on both sides; lit. both matters [ubhaya + attha] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning in both cases; on both sides; lit. both matters
Construction ubhaya + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ubhayassa + attha)
Commentary (ANa) ubhay'attha kaliggāho'ti ubhay'esam'pi diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikānaṃ atthānaṃ kaliggāho, parājayaggāho'ti attho. (DHPa) idam'assa paraloke vipākasocanaṃ. evaṃ so ubhay'attha socati'y'eva.
Sanskrit ubhayatra

idha socati pecca socati,
pāpakārī ubhay'attha socati,
so socati so vihaññati,
disvā kammakiliṭṭham'attano.

DHP 15 yamakavaggo

sace kho atth'eva paro loko, evaṃ imassa bhoto purisapuggalassa ubhay'attha kaṭaggaho, yañ'ca diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ pāsaṃso, yañ'ca kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissati.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
ubhayattha 2

masc. benefit of both; welfare of both [ubhaya + attha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning benefit of both; welfare of both
Construction ubhaya + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ubhayassa + attha)
Sanskrit ubhayārtha

att'atthaṃ vā ñassati par'atthaṃ vā ñassati ubhay'atthaṃ vā ñassati uttariṃ vā manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ sacchikarissatī'ti n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

AN 5.51 āvaraṇasuttaṃ
ubhayatthasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 23 (ITI 23) ✗
ubhayanta

masc. both ends; both extremes ✗
ubhayantarena

ind. in-between the two [ubhaya + antara + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of ubhayantara
Meaning in-between the two
Construction ubhaya + antara + ena
ubhayantara + ena
Compound abyayībhāva (ubhaya + antarena)
Variant ubhayamantarena
Sanskrit ubhaya + antareṇa

yo sukhaṃ dukkhato adda,
dukkham'addakkhi sallato,
ubhay'antarena n'āhosi,
kena lokasmi kiṃ siyā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
ubhayabyābādha

masc. hurting both; affliction of both; harm to both (self and other) [ubhaya + byābādha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning hurting both; affliction of both; harm to both (self and other)
Construction ubhaya + byābādha
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ubhayāya + byābādha)
Variant ubhayavyābādha
Sanskrit ubhaya + vyābādha

yaṃ nu kho ahaṃ idaṃ kāyena kammaṃ kattu'kāmo idaṃ me kāyakammaṃ attabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, parabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, ubhayabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhu, paṇḍito mahāpañño n'ev'attabyābādhāya ceteti na parabyābādhāya ceteti na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti attahita-parahita-ubhayahita-sabbalokahitam'eva cintayamāno cinteti.

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ
ubhayamantare

ind. between the two; within the two ✗
ubhayamantarena

ind. in-between the two [ubhayaṃ + antara + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of ubhayamantara
Meaning in-between the two
Construction ubhayaṃ + antara + ena
ubhayamantara + ena
Compound abyayībhāva (ubhayaṃ + antarena)
Variant ubhayantarena, ubhayamantare
Sanskrit ubhaya + antareṇa

yato tvaṃ, māluṅkyaputta, na tattha, tato tvaṃ, māluṅkyaputta, n'ev'idha, na huraṃ, na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 74 catutthanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ
ubhayametaṃ

sandhi. both of these; both of them [ubhayaṃ + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + pron
Meaning both of these; both of them
Construction ubhayaṃ + etaṃ
Sanskrit ubhayam + etam

ye ca diṭṭhadhammikā kāmā, ye ca samparāyikā kāmā, yā ca diṭṭhadhammikā kāmasaññā, yā ca samparāyikā kāmasaññā, ubhayam'etaṃ māradheyyaṃ, mārass'esa visayo, mārass'esa nivāpo, mārass'esa gocaro.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ

ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ taṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ, āpattiṃ āpanno'ti. jānanti maṃ bhikkhū āpattiṃ āpanno'ti, iti so kupito hoti appatīto. yo c'eva kho, āvuso, kopo yo ca appaccayo, ubhayam'etaṃ aṅgaṇaṃ.

ubhinnam'atthaṃ carati,
attano ca parassa ca,
paraṃ saṅkupitaṃ ñatvā,
yo sato upasammati.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ

ubhinnaṃ tikicchantānaṃ,
attano ca parassa ca,
janā maññanti bālo'ti,
ye dhammassa akovidā'ti.

mahāvīrassa bhāsato,

ubho nāradapabbatā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

mam'eva kata maññantu,
gihīpabbajitā ubho,
mam'ev'ātivasā assu,
kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo,
icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

yo v'āpi katvā na karomi c'āha,
ubho'pi te pecca samā bhavanti,
nihīnakammā manujā parattha.

Meaning both together
Construction ubho + eva
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.9) ubho'va santā ekenā'ti dve'pi janā ekena.
Sanskrit ubhe + eva

ehi dāni, āvuso, ubho'va santā imaṃ gaṇaṃ pariharāmā'ti. iti kho, aggivessana, āḷāro kālāmo ācariyo me samāno attano antevāsiṃ maṃ samānaṃ attanā samasamaṃ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṃ pūjāya pūjesi.

sādhu vata maṃ āyasmanto imehi paccekacīvaracetāpannehi evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādetha ubho'va santā ekenā'ti kalyāṇakamyataṃ upādāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2

tassā ubhosu tīresu kāsā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, kusā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, pabbajā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, bīraṇā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, rukkhā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ.

ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni. seyyathā'pi nāma umāpupphaṃ nīlaṃ nīlavaṇṇaṃ nīlanidassanaṃ nīlanibhāsaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā ummaggaṃ gaṇhati, ubbaṭumaṃ rathaṃ karoti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho assadoso.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, bhikkhave, upako ājīvako, hupeyya'p'āvuso'ti vatvā sīsaṃ okampetvā ummaggaṃ gahetvā pakkāmi.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
ummagga 2.1

masc. coming up with question; emergence of an enquiry; lit. emergence [ud + √mujj + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ummujjati
Meaning coming up with question; emergence of an enquiry; lit. emergence
Root Family ud √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Construction ud + √mujj > majj > magg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > m
j > g
Variant ummaṅga
Commentary (ANa) ummaggo'ti pañh'ummaggo.
Sanskrit unmajjana
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu! bhaddako kho te, bhikkhu, ummaggo, bhaddakaṃ paṭibhānaṃ, kalyāṇī paripucchā

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, puggalo puggalena saddhiṃ sākacchāyamāno evaṃ jānāti, yathā kho imassa āyasmato ummaggo yathā ca abhinīhāro yathā ca pañhāsamudāhāro, duppañño ayam'āyasmā, n'āyam'āyasmā paññavā.

AN 4.192 ṭhānasuttaṃ
ummagga 2.2

masc. emergence; surfacing [ud + √mujj + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ummujjati, intrans
Meaning emergence; surfacing
Root Family ud √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Construction ud + √mujj > majj > magg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > m
j > g
Antonym nimujjamāna
Sanskrit unmajjana
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso udakarahadassa tīre ṭhito passeyya parittaṃ macchaṃ ummujjamānaṃ. tassa evam'assa, yathā kho imassa macchassa ummaggo yathā ca ūmighāto yathā ca vegāyitattaṃ, paritto ayaṃ maccho, nāyaṃ maccho mahanto'ti.

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ
ummaṅga 2

masc. tunnel [ud + √magg] ✗
ummatta

adj. mad; insane; crazy; loony; nuts [ud + √mad + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, pp of ummajjati
Meaning mad; insane; crazy; loony; nuts
Root Family ud √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction ud + √mad + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit unmatta
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

evaṃ vutte, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto upāliṃ gahapatiṃ etadavoca, ummatto'si tvaṃ, gahapati, datto'si tvaṃ, gahapati!

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

kiṃ ummatto'si, nanu idān'eva divākaro atthaṅ'gato, so kathaṃ imaṃ puṇṇacandaṃ anubandhamāno uggacchissati?

DNa 2.4.2 mahāsudassanasutta vaṇṇanā
ummattaka 1

masc. madman; crazy; lunatic; loony; nut-job [ud + √mad + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from ummatta
Meaning madman; crazy; lunatic; loony; nut-job
Root Family ud √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction ud + √mad + ta + ka
ummatta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change d > t
Sanskrit unmattaka
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

nanu dubbhissasi maṃ punappunaṃ,
muhuṃ muhuṃ cāraṇikaṃ'va dassayaṃ,
ummattaken'eva mayā palobhasi,
kiñ'c'āpi te citta virādhitaṃ mayā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

saññasaññino vuccanti ye pakatisaññāya ṭhitā, na'pi so pakatisaññāya ṭhito. visaññasaññino vuccanti ummattakā ye ca khittacittā, na'pi so ummattako, no'pi khittacitto'ti.

NIDD1 11 kalahavivāda suttaniddesa

ummatta + ka

Sanskrit unmattaka

ruṇṇam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ gītaṃ. ummattakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ naccaṃ. komārakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ ativelaṃ dantavidaṃsakahasitaṃ.

ummattakasaṃvattanika

adj. leading to madness; conducive to insanity [ummattaka + saṃvattanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to madness; conducive to insanity
Construction ummattaka + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ummattakāya + saṃvattanika)
Commentary (ANa) ummattakasaṃvattaniko hotī'ti ummattakabhāvaṃ saṃvatteti. tena hi manusso ummatto vā khittacitto vā eḷamūgo vā hoti. ayaṃ surāpānassa nissando.
Sanskrit unmattaka + saṃvartanīya

surāmerayapānaṃ, bhikkhave, āsevitaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ nirayasaṃvattanikaṃ tiracchānayonisaṃvattanikaṃ pettivisayasaṃvattanikaṃ. yo sabbalahuso surāmerayapānassa vipāko, manussabhūtassa ummattakasaṃvattaniko hotī'ti. dasamaṃ.

AN 8.40 duccaritavipākasuttaṃ
ummaddāpeti

pr. causes (someone) to massage or rub (with unguents) [ud + √madd] ✗
ummaddeti

pr. massages, rubs (with unguents) [ud + √madd] ✗
ummasati

pr. touches; strokes in an upward direction; lifts [ud + √mas] ✗
ummasanā

fem. stroking upwards; lifting [ud + √mas] ✗
ummāda

masc. madness; insanity; lunacy [ud + √mad + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning madness; insanity; lunacy
Root Family ud √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction ud + √mad > mād + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (ANa) ummādassā'ti ummattakabhāvassa.
Sanskrit unmāda
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

mandattā momūhattā aññaṃ byākaroti, pāpiccho icchāpakato aññaṃ byākaroti, ummādā cittakkhepā aññaṃ byākaroti, adhimānena aññaṃ byākaroti, samma'd'eva aññaṃ byākaroti.

AN 5.93 byākaraṇasuttaṃ

cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, acinteyyāni, na cintetabbāni, yāni cintento ummādassa vighātassa bhāgī assa. katamāni cattāri?

ummādana

ummādananta

ummāra

masc. threshold; doorway; entrance ✓

Meaning threshold; doorway; entrance
Sanskrit umbara

kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyyā'ti aññassa ghar'ūpacāraṃ okkamantassa āpatti dukkaṭassa. paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ ummāraṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. dutiyaṃ pādaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

indakhīlo nāma sayanigharassa ummāro vuccati.

VIN 2.5.5.2 uyyojanasikkhāpadaṃ

abs. (+acc) having dismissed; having sent away; having sent off [ud + √yuj] ✗
uyyojesi 1

aor. (+acc) dismissed; released; sent away; sent off; lit. up yoked [ud + √yuj + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of uyyojeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning dismissed; released; sent away; sent off; lit. up yoked
Root Family ud √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ud + yoje + si
Phonetic Change d > y
u > o
Sanskrit udyuj
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu

Phonetic Change d > y
u > o

dirattatirattaṃ ce bhikkhu senāya vasamāno uyyodhikaṃ vā bal'aggaṃ vā senābyūhaṃ vā anīkadassanaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Sanskrit uraga

visaṭaṃ sappavisaṃ'va osadhehi,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

urago kho, mahārāja, daharo'ti na uññātabbo, daharo'ti na paribhotabbo.

so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati paritassanā hotī'ti.

Meaning ram

tena kho pana samayena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa mahāyañño paccupaṭṭhito hoti, pañca ca usabhasatāni pañca ca vacchatarasatāni pañca ca vacchatarisatāni pañca ca ajasatāni pañca ca urabbhasatāni thūṇ'ūpanītāni honti yaññ'atthāya.

Commentary (MNa) uruvelā'ti mahāvelā, mahāvālikarāsī'ti attho. atha vā urū'ti vālikā vuccati, velā'ti mariyādā, vel'ātikkamanahetu āhaṭā uru uruvelā'ti evam'ettha attho daṭṭhabbo.
Sanskrit urubilvā, uruvilvā (bsk)

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

atha khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, uruvelāyaṃ yath'ābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena bārāṇasī tena cārikaṃ pakkamiṃ.

Root √lok･8 *e (look)

Phonetic Change d > l
Antonym oloketabba
English Cognate look, looks, looking
Sanskrit ullokayati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

sace, bhikkhave, nandassa uddhaṃ ulloketabbā hoti, sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā nando anudisaṃ anuviloketi, evaṃ me anudisaṃ anuvilokayato n'ābhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssavissantīti. itiha tattha sampajāno hoti.

AN 8.9 nandasuttaṃ
ulloketi

pr. (+acc) looks up (at); gazes up (at) [ud + √lok + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning looks up (at); gazes up (at)
Root Family ud √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ud + loke + ti
Phonetic Change d > l
Antonym oloketi
Commentary (MNa) na uddhan'tiādīsu nakkhattāni gaṇento viya na uddhaṃ ulloketi
English Cognate look, looks, looking
Sanskrit ullokayati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

apalokento kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo sabbakāyen'eva apaloketi, so na uddhaṃ ulloketi, na adho oloketi, na ca vipekkhamāno gacchati, yugamattañ'ca pekkhati, tato c'assa uttari anāvaṭaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, uṭṭhāy'āsanā udakena akkhīni anumajjitvā disā anuvilokeyyāsi nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni ullokeyyāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

Root √lok･8 *e (look)

Phonetic Change d > l
Antonym oloketvā
English Cognate look, looks, looking
Sanskrit ullokayitvā
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

ekam'antaṃ nisinnassa kho abhayassa rājakumārassa sūriyaṃ ulloketvā etadahosi, akālo kho ajja bhagavato vādaṃ āropetuṃ.

MN 58 abhayarājakumārasuttaṃ
ullokenta

prp. looking up [ud + √lok] ✗
ullokesi

aor. looked up or for [ud + √lok] ✗
usabha 1

masc. head bull; stud bull ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning head bull; stud bull
Commentary (ANa) gavasatajeṭṭhako usabho, gavasahassajeṭṭhako vasabho. vajasatajeṭṭhako vā usabho, vajasahassajeṭṭhako vasabho.
Sanskrit ṛṣabha

so evam'āha, ettakā usabhā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā vacchatarā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā vacchatariyo haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā ajā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā urabbhā haññantu yaññ'atthāya

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, usabho chinnavisāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvāhiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
usabha 2

masc. noble being; lit. stud bull ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning noble being; lit. stud bull
Sanskrit ṛṣabha

usabhaṃ pavaraṃ vīraṃ,
mah'esiṃ vijitāvinaṃ,
anejaṃ nhātakaṃ buddhaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. stud bull

usabhachinnavisāṇasama

adj. like a dehorned bull [usabha + chinnavisāṇa + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a dehorned bull
Construction usabha + chinnavisāṇa + sama
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (usabhachinnavisāṇena + sama)
Sanskrit ṛṣabha + chinna + viṣāṇa + sama

seyyathāpi, bhante, usabho chinnavisāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvāhiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā, evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, usabhachinnavisāṇasamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.

nt. bull battle; bull fight ✗

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ
usīra

nt. fragrant root of vetiver grass ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning fragrant root of vetiver grass
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chrysopogon_zizanioides
Sanskrit uśīra

taṃ vo vadāmi bhaddaṃ vo,
yāvant'ettha samāgatā,
taṇhāya mūlaṃ khaṇatha,
usīra-attho'va bīraṇaṃ,
mā vo naḷaṃ'va soto'va,
māro bhañji punappunaṃ.

DHP 337 taṇhāvaggo

mūlabījaṃ nāma, haliddi, siṅgiveraṃ, vacā, vacattaṃ, ativisā, kaṭukarohiṇī, usīraṃ, bhaddamūttakaṃ, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi mūle jāyanti, mūle sañjāyanti, etaṃ mūlabījaṃ nāma.

VIN 2.5.2.1 bhūtagāmasikkhāpadaṃ
usīrattha

adj. who wants the fragrant root of vetiver grass [usīra + attha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who wants the fragrant root of vetiver grass
Construction usīra + attha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa > bahubbīhi (usīraṃ + attha)
Commentary (DHPa) usīr'attho'va bīraṇaṃ, yathā usīrena atthiko puriso mahantena kudālena bīraṇaṃ khaṇati, evam'assā mūlaṃ khaṇathā'ti attho.
Sanskrit uśīra + artha

taṃ vo vadāmi bhaddaṃ vo,
yāvant'ettha samāgatā,
taṇhāya mūlaṃ khaṇatha,
usīr'attho'va bīraṇaṃ,
mā vo naḷaṃ'va soto'va,
māro bhañji punappunaṃ.

DHP24 taṇhāvaggo
usīranāḷamatta

nt. all the root fibres; lit. root-stalk-measure [usīra + nāḷa + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning all the root fibres; lit. root-stalk-measure
Construction usīra + nāḷa + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (usīranāḷa + matta)
Variant usīranāḷimatta
Sanskrit uśīra + nāḍī + mātra

atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ māluvālataṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷamattāni'pi.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ
usīranāḷimatta

nt. all the root fibres; lit. root-stalk-measure [usīra + nāḷi + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning all the root fibres; lit. root-stalk-measure
Construction usīra + nāḷi + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (usīranāḷi + matta)
Variant usīranāḷamatta
Sanskrit uśīra + nāḍī + mātra

atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ māluvālataṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷimattāni'pi.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, vappa, thūṇaṃ paṭicca chāyā paññāyati. atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ thūṇaṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chinditvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷimattāni'pi.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
usu

masc. arrow ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning arrow
Synonym sara
Commentary (MNa) usūsū'ti kaṇḍesu.
Sanskrit iṣu

anamataggo'yaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃsāro. pubbā koṭi nappaññāyati sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ pharasuppahārānaṃ

SN 56.35 sattisatasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato khamo hoti sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ pharasuppahārānaṃ bheripaṇavasaṅkhatiṇavaninnādasaddānaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khantā hoti.

dūrakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ,
ujuṃ karoti medhāvī,
usukāro'va tejanaṃ.

udakañ'hi nayanti nettikā,
usukārā namayanti tejanaṃ,
dāruṃ namayanti tacchakā,
attānaṃ damayanti paṇḍitā.

fem. heat; warmth; body heat [√us + mā] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning heat; warmth; body heat
Root Family √us
Root √us×6 ṇhā (be hot)
Construction √us + mā
Derivative kita (mā)
Commentary (MNa) usmaṃ paṭiccā'ti jīvit'indriyaṃ kammajatejaṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhati. yasmā pana kammajatejo'pi jīvit'indriyena vinā na tiṭṭhati, tasmā usmā āyuṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhatī'ti āha.
Sanskrit uṣma
Sanskrit Root √uṣ 1, 9 (burn)

yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ,
yadā kāyaṃ jahant'imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti,
parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.

usmīkata

adj. getting warm; kindled a flicker of understanding; close to comprehension; in the ballpark; lit. made warm [usmā + kata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning getting warm; kindled a flicker of understanding; close to comprehension; in the ballpark; lit. made warm

Compound dutiyā tappurisa (usmaṃ + kata)
Sanskrit uṣṇīkṛta

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api n'āyaṃ ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo usmīkato'pi imasmiṃ dhammavinaye'ti? kiñ'hi siyā, bhante, no h'etaṃ, bhante'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
usmudakajāta

adj. bubbling; boiling; steaming [usmā + udaka + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bubbling; boiling; steaming

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto agginā santatto pakkuthito usm'udakajāto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ
ussa

adj. excellent; superior [ud + √sad + a] ✓

Grammar adj, abbrev of ussada
Meaning excellent; superior
Root Family ud √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ud + √sad + a
ussada > ussa
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change d > s
Antonym avama
Synonym seyyo, visesi, parama
Sanskrit utsada (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

vītagedho amaccharī,
na ussesu vadate muni,
na samesu na omesu,
kappaṃ n'eti akappiyo.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

na samesu na omesu,
na ussesu vadate muni,
santo so vītamaccharo,
n'ādeti na nirassatī'ti.

d > n
Notes PED takes as √sand

Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
ussuka

adj. zealously desiring; ambitious; anxiously striving; anxious; agitated; stressed [ud + su + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from ud
Meaning zealously desiring; ambitious; anxiously striving; anxious; agitated; stressed
Construction ud + su + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change d > s
Antonym anussuka
Commentary (DHPa) pañcakāmaguṇapariyesane ussukesu tāya pariyesanāya abhāvena anussukā'ti.
Notes (MW) restless, uneasy, unquiet, anxious; fr. su, "well", with ud in the sense of "apart", and affix ka
Sanskrit utsuka

susukhaṃ vata jīvāma,
ussukesu anussukā,
ussukesu manassesu,
viharāma anussukā.

DHP 199 sukhavaggo
ussukka

nt. zeal; desire; ambition; effort [ud + su + ka + ya] ✓

Meaning zeal; desire; ambition; effort
Construction ud + su + ka + ya

Phonetic Change d > s

Sanskrit autsukya

tesu ussukkajātesu,
bhavasot'ānusārisu,
ke'dha taṇhaṃ pajahiṃsu,
ke lokasmiṃ anussukā'ti.

SN 1.28 mahaddhanasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ kho, āvuso uttiya, na tathāgatassa evaṃ ussukkaṃ hoti, sabbo vā tena loko nīyati, upaḍḍho vā, tibhāgo vā'ti.

Phonetic Change d > s
u > ū
Commentary (VINa) ussūre āhariyitthā'ti atidivā āhariyittha. (PYt) uddhaṃ sūro uggato asmiṃ kāle'ti ussūro'ti vutte atidivākālo'ti āha atidivā'ti.
Sanskrit utsūra (evening)
Sanskrit Root √sur 6 (possess power)
ussūrabhatta

adj. whose meal is late in the day ✗
ussūrabhattasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.228 (AN5.228) ✗
ussūraseyyā

fem. sleep after sunrise ✗
ussūre

ind. at midday; lit. at sun up [ud + √sur + *a + e] ~

Grammar ind, adc, loc sg of ussūra
Meaning at midday; lit. at sun up
Root Family ud √sur
Root √sur･1 a (shine, be supreme)
Construction ud + √sur > sūr + *a + e
ussūra + e
Phonetic Change d > s
u > ū
Commentary (VINa) ussūre āhariyitthā'ti atidivā āhariyittha. (PYt) uddhaṃ sūro uggato asmiṃ kāle'ti ussūro'ti vutte atidivākālo'ti āha atidivā'ti.
Sanskrit utsūra (evening)
Sanskrit Root √sur 6 (possess power)
usseka

masc. pouring; scooping; showering; lit. pouring up [ud + √sic + *a] ~

Meaning pouring; scooping; showering; lit. pouring up
Root Family ud √sic
Root √sic･2 ṃa (sprinkle, pour)

Sanskrit utseka

usseti

pr. (+acc) raises; lifts; elevates; hoists [ud + √si] ✗
usseneti

pr. (+acc) (of an army) enlists; gathers; bands together; associates; (comm) raises up [ud + senā + e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, deno of ussenā, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of an army) enlists; gathers; bands together; associates; (comm) raises up
Construction ud + senā + e + ti
Antonym viseneti, paṭiseneti
Variant ussineti
Commentary (ANa) na ussenetī'ti diṭṭhivasena na ukkhipati.
Sanskrit ut + senayati

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako apacināti no ācināti, pajahati no upādiyati, viseneti no usseneti, vidhūpeti no sandhūpeti

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu n'eva usseneti na paṭiseneti na dhūpāyati na pajjalati na sampajjhāyati.

AN 4.200 pemasuttaṃ
usseḷeti

pr. whistles [ud + √siḷ + *e + ti] ~

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning whistles
Root Family ud √siḷ
Root √siḷ･8 *e (whistle)
Base √siḷ + *e > seḷe
Construction ud + seḷe + ti
Commentary (VINt) tattha usseḷentī'ti mukhena usseḷanasaddaṃ pamuñcanti, mahantaṃ katvā abyattasaddaṃ pavattentī'ti attho. ajānaṃ saññaṃ dentā ajapālakā viya mukhena vātaṃ nicchārentā sukhumaṃ abyattanādaṃ pavattentī'ti'pi vadanti.
Sanskrit Root - - (-)
ussoḷhi

fem. endurance, exertion [ud + √sah] ✗
ussoḷhikā

fem. great energy ✗
ussoḷhipañcama

adj. with exertion as the fifth; with enthusiasm as the fifth [ussoḷhī + pañcama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with exertion as the fifth; with enthusiasm as the fifth
Construction ussoḷhī + pañcama
ussoḷhipannarasaṅgasamannāgata

adj. endowed with fifteen factors including effort [ussoḷhī + pannarasa + aṅga + samannāgata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning endowed with fifteen factors including effort
Construction ussoḷhī + pannarasa + aṅga + samannāgata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgehi + samannāgata)
Variant ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgasamannāgata
Commentary (MNa) ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgasamannāgato'ti pañca cetokhilappahānāni pañca vinibandhappahānāni cattāro iddhipādā ussoḷhī'ti evaṃ ussoḷhiyā saddhiṃ pannarasahi aṅgehi samannāgato.
Sanskrit utsāha, utsoḍhi + pañcadaśa + aṅga + samanvāgata

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, evaṃ ussoḷhipannaras'aṅgasamannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo abhinibbidāya, bhabbo sambodhāya, bhabbo anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāyā'ti.

MN 16 cetokhilasuttaṃ
ussoḷhī

fem. exertion; activity; active involvement; enthusiasm [ud + √sah + tī] ✓

Grammar fem, from ussahati
Meaning exertion; activity; active involvement; enthusiasm
Root Family ud √sah
Root √sah･1 a (overcome, prevail)
Construction ud + √sah + tī > soḍhī > soḷhī
Derivative kita (tī)
Phonetic Change d > s
a > o
t > ḍ > ḷ
Synonym vāyāma, ussāha, appaṭivānī
Commentary (ANa) ussoḷhī'ti paṅkalaggasakaṭauddharaṇasadisaṃ mahāvīriyaṃ.
Sanskrit utsāha, utsoḍhi
Sanskrit Root √sah 1, 2, 4 (prevail)

so chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, vīriyasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, cittasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, vīmaṃsāsamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti, ussoḷhī'y'eva pañcamī.

MN 16 cetokhilasuttaṃ
ussoḷhīpannarasaṅgasamannāgata

Sanskrit utsāha, utsoḍhi + pañcadaśa + aṅga + samanvāgata

sa kho so, bhikkhave, evaṃ ussoḷhīpannaras'aṅgasamannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo abhinibbidāya, bhabbo sambodhāya, bhabbo anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya.

Sanskrit ūhasati (bsk)

uḷāra 1

adj. excellent; lofty; high; noble [ud + √ar + *a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning excellent; lofty; high; noble
Root Family ud √ar
Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)
Construction ud > uḷ + √ar > ār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change d > ḷ
a > ā
Commentary (MNa) uḷārāyā'ti uttamāya.
Sanskrit udāra
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

idha, bhante ānanda, sambahulā bhikkhuniyo catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhitacittā viharantiyo uḷāraṃ pubben'āparaṃ visesaṃ sañjānantī'ti

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

ehi dāni, āvuso, ubho'va santā imaṃ gaṇaṃ pariharāmā'ti. iti kho, aggivessana, āḷāro kālāmo ācariyo me samāno attano antevāsiṃ maṃ samānaṃ attanā samasamaṃ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṃ pūjāya pūjesi.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
uḷāra 2

adj. vast; extensive [ud + √ar + *a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning vast; extensive
Root Family ud √ar
Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)
Construction ud > uḷ + √ar > ār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change d > ḷ
a > ā
Commentary (SNa) uḷāre uḷāre'ti paṇīte ca bahuke ca.
Sanskrit udāra
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati

DN 18.4 janavasabhasuttaṃ

appakā te sattā lokasmiṃ ye uḷāre uḷāre bhoge labhitvā na c'eva majjanti, na ca pamajjanti, na ca kāmesu gedhaṃ āpajjanti, na ca sattesu vippaṭipajjanti.

AN 11.14 subhūtisuttaṃ
uḷārabhoga

adj. of vast wealth; very rich [uḷāra + bhoga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of vast wealth; very rich
Construction uḷāra + bhoga
Compound kammadhāraya (uḷāra + bhoga)
Sanskrit udāra + bhoga

mahāsatto hi tadā mahati uḷārabhoge kule nibbattitvā vuddhim'anvāya disāpāmokkhassa ācariyassa santike garuvāsaṃ vasanto sabbasippānaṃ nipphattiṃ patvā kulagharaṃ āgantvā

CPa 3.15 mahālomahaṃsacariyāvaṇṇanā
uḷārabhogakula

nt. family of vast wealth [uḷāra + bhoga + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning family of vast wealth
Construction uḷāra + bhoga + kula
Compound kammadhāraya (uḷārabhoga + kula)
Sanskrit udāra + bhoga + kula

ahaṃ kho'mhi uḷārabhogakulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na uḷārabhogakulā pabbajitā'ti. so tāya uḷārabhogatāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
uḷārabhogatā

fem. fact of having extensive wealth [uḷāra + bhoga + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from uḷārabhoga
Meaning fact of having extensive wealth
Construction uḷāra + bhoga + tā
uḷārabhoga + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Compound kammadhāraya (uḷāra + bhogatā)
Sanskrit udāra + bhoga + tā

ahaṃ kho'mhi uḷārabhogakulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na uḷārabhogakulā pabbajitā'ti. so tāya uḷārabhogatāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho uḷārabhogatāya lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu

so araññato āgacchante mālākāre disvā thokaṃ thokaṃ phāṇitakhaṇḍaṃ datvā uḷuṅkena pānīyaṃ adāsi, te c'assa ek'ekaṃ pupphamuṭṭhiṃ adaṃsu.
